detegamus.

& primò debet præmitti &longs;equens propo­

PROP. CLXXII.

Si corpus angulo&longs;um innixum parietis verticalis a&longs;perita­
tibus &longs;u&longs;tineatur à potentia termino oppo&longs;ito, & horizon­
tali eiu&longs;dem corporis applicata; potentia ad corporis
pondus &longs;e habebit, vt di&longs;tantia centri grauitatis
eius à fulcimento ad di&longs;tantiam poten­
tiæ ab eodem fulcimento.

SIt corpus D à pluribus angulis comprehen&longs;um,
& paries verticalis AB, cuius &longs;uperficies &longs;it a­
&longs;pera, & denticulata, in huius lo­
co B innitatur &longs;u&longs;tineaturque ex­
tremitas angulo&longs;a corporis D, vt
nimirum minimè excurrere po&longs;&longs;it
deor&longs;um; &longs;u&longs;pendatur po&longs;teà op­
po&longs;ita eius extremitas E ab aliqua
potentia, tunc vis eleuans in E mi­
nor erit pondere corporis D, & ad
eius grauitatem ab&longs;olutam eamdem
proportionem habebit, quam di&longs;tantia BD à centro
grauitatis prædicti &longs;olidi v&longs;que ad parietem habet
adlongitudinem EB totius &longs;axi; quia corpus graue
D &longs;u&longs;penditur in medio vectis horizontalis EB à dua­
bus potentijs, ab illa quam exercet potentia &longs;u&longs;ten­
tans E, & ab a&longs;peritate parietis denticulati in B, er­
gò ex mechanicis potentia E ad re&longs;i&longs;tentiam ponderis
D eandem rationem habet quam di&longs;tantia DB ad to­
tam vectis EB longitudinem.

PROP. CLXXIII.

Ii&longs;dem po&longs;itis eadem potentia eleuare altiùs poterit conuer­
tendo, & rotando corpus polihedrum regulari &longs;imile
innixum a&longs;peritatibus eiu&longs;dem verticalis
parietis.

SIt corpus D angulo&longs;um, & regulari &longs;imile, ita vt
centrum grauitatis eius &longs;it quoque centrum ma­
gnitudinis eiu&longs;dem.

Dico quòd eadem potentia &longs;ub­
dupla E poterit eleuare corpus graue D ad quallibet
altitudinem parietis AC; quia cùm &longs;olidum D &longs;it re­
gulare, & habeat figuram angulo&longs;am, & denticula­
tam, vt in quolibet &longs;itu &longs;uæ &longs;uperficiei po&longs;&longs;it adnecti,
& &longs;u&longs;tineri in &longs;ub &longs;equentibus a&longs;peritatibus parietis
denticulati CA, &longs;equitur vt quomodolibet reuolua­
tur corpus D, &longs;emper in &longs;ub &longs;equentibus eminentijs
parietis a&longs;peris AB paritèr &longs;u&longs;tineatur fulciaturque,
atque in eodem &longs;itu horizontali ab ij&longs;dem duabus
potentijs corpus D &longs;u&longs;tinebitur, &longs;cilicèt à potenti&atail;
E, & ab aliqua denticulari eminentia parietis AC;
cùmque &longs;emper eadem proportio remaneat inter eo­
rum di&longs;tantias à contactu, &longs;cilicèt inter DB ad BE,
igitur &longs;emper eadem vis E &longs;u&longs;tinere, & impeller&etail;
&longs;ursùm poterit eamdem re&longs;i&longs;tentiam corporis D; qua­
propter fiet continua vertigo &longs;olidi D nedùm circ&atail;
eius centrum, &longs;ed etiam rotando, adh&etail;rendoque lon­
gitudini verticali BA, & proindè eleuabitur ad quan­
cum que &longs;ublimitatem A.

Particulæ aquæ &longs;uperficiales po&longs;&longs;unt rotando altiùs eleuari
parieti va&longs;is adhærendo à vi ponderis aqua collate­
ralis impul&longs;æ.

PO&longs;tea con&longs;idero in va&longs;e XRSV in aquæ &longs;uprem&atail;

nimis aquæ particulis A, B, D, tunc
exiguum corpus A parietem fir­
mum contingat in L, ob huius a­
&longs;peritatem fulcietur, &longs;u&longs;tentabi­

A, reliqua verò portio eius ver­
sùs C cùm non adhæreat nequ&etail;
&longs;u&longs;tentetur ab vllo pariete, fulcietur, &longs;u&longs;tinebiturque
à &longs;ubiecta aqua FI, quæ non grauatur ab integro pon­

Con&longs;ideretur po&longs;tea con&longs;equens mi­

integram &longs;uam grauitatem exercet comprimendo &longs;ub­

ris ip&longs;ius A, ergo pars FI minus pre&longs;&longs;a &longs;ursùm impel­
letur ab EI magis pre&longs;&longs;a, proindeque pars aquæ FI
vim faciet &longs;ursùm impellendo terminum C granuli
aquei A; quia verò eius extremitas L foueolis a&longs;pe­
ris parietis adhæret, impeditur retineturque nè dire­
cto motu &longs;ursùm ferriqueat, ergò nece&longs;sè e&longs;t, vt gra­
nulum A flectatur ad modum vectis circa firmum ter­
minum L, cùmque tactus, & adhæ&longs;io in pariete reno­
uetur continentèr po&longs;t flexionem &longs;ursùm termini C non
&longs;ecùs, ac in rotis dentatis contingit, pariterque re­

Videndum modò qua ratione po&longs;&longs;int &longs;aluari effe­

PROP. CLXXV.

Ratio affertur quare guttæ aquæ pendulæ è &longs;uperficie prona
&longs;olidi corporis &longs;ustineantur.

ET primò con&longs;ideretur gutta pendula ex &longs;uperfi­
cie prona rami alicuius arboris, cuius figur&atail;
videtur conoidalis parabolica: reddi debet hìc cau&longs;a
efficiens, & formalis huius &longs;u&longs;pen&longs;ionis; concipian­
tur externæ &longs;uperficiales particulæ huiu&longs;modi gutt&etail;,
quæ vici&longs;&longs;im connexæ à &longs;uis machinulis aliquo pacto
incuruatis ad modum arcus efficiant veluti linteum,
vel &longs;accum in eius perimetro annexum &longs;ummitati li­
gni duri, & con&longs;i&longs;tentis; partes verò intermediæ gut­
tulæ &longs;ua grauitate naturali premunt, & di&longs;trahunt lin­
teum, vel rete &longs;uperficiale, at quia energia machi­
nularum non cedit vi pu&longs;illæ grauitatis guttulæ pen­
dentis, fit vt æquatis momentis tota gutta &longs;u&longs;pen&longs;&atail;
hæreat.
PROP. CLXXVI.

Quare globuli fluidi pendentes è filo paritèr fluido
&longs;u&longs;tineantur.

SEcundo loco &longs;it pila fluida pendula ex filo pari­
tèr fluido, vt euidentiùs contingit in Saliua, &
in alijs humoribus glutino&longs;is; hìc iam concipi debent
hinc inde à filo in orbem particulæ fluidi, quæ excur­
rendo deorsùm vt graues ad infimum fili &longs;itum, ibi con­
glutinatis, concatenati&longs;que externis particulis ope
machinularum earum efformant veluti &longs;acculum reti­
cularem intra quem tanta moles fluidi contineri pote&longs;t,
vt eius pondus non &longs;uperet robur machinularu&mtail;
glutinis.

Cap.
8. cur
exiguæ aquæ
guttæ &longs;upra

a&longs;cendunt.
PROP. CLXXVII.

Et cur globulus fluidus pauimento innixus;
&longs;u&longs;tineatur.

TErtiò pila fluida innixa pauimento paritèr &longs;u&longs;ti­
netur veluti à filo, &longs;eù virga perpendiculari ad
planum &longs;ubiectum à quo &longs;u&longs;tentatur; à prædicta vir­
ga in orbem colligantur aliæ particulæ eiu&longs;dem flui­
di, quæ in èxigua ba&longs;i fulciuntur à plano &longs;ubiecto,
quando ob ariditatem eius, & incongruitatem po­
rorum aqua non diffluit, nec ip&longs;um humectat; in tali
ca&longs;u filum fluidum perpendiculare perinde agit, ac
filum pendulum; &longs;ed guttæ figura differt aliquo pa­
cto à præcedenti, non enim e&longs;t &longs;phærica, nec oblon­
ga oualis, &longs;ed inferiùs dilatatur, & &longs;upernè acumen
veluti conoidale acquirit.
PROP. CLXXVIII.

Declaratur quomodò, & quou&longs;que ex nouo affluxu guttulæ
augentur, & quare po&longs;t violentam fluidi tractionem
denuò &longs;ponte &longs;ua recolliguntur.

IN primo, & &longs;ecundo ca&longs;u ex affluxu noui fluidi
augeri pote&longs;t moles guttæ pendulæ, vt eius pon­
dus maius &longs;it, quàm vt à vi glutinis &longs;u&longs;tineri queat, &
tunc elongatur infernè, & tandem di&longs;rumpitur, &
decidit, at pars re&longs;idua oblonga recolligitur &longs;ursùm,
efficitque nouam exiguam globo&longs;itatem; cau&longs;a verò
huius recollectionis, & a&longs;cen&longs;us &longs;ursùm hæc e&longs;t, quia
à pondere, & à motu ingentis guttulæ decidentis ma­
chinulæ re&longs;iduarum partium fluidi violentèr di&longs;tra­
ctæ &longs;pontè &longs;ua apt&etail; natæ &longs;unt, denuò &longs;e &longs;e recollige­
re, reducique ad naturalem &longs;itum, &longs;icut contingit in
arcu, & in qualibet machina, quæ po&longs;t violenta&mtail;
di&longs;tractionem, exten&longs;ionemque, denuò &longs;e flectit re­
duciturque ad pri&longs;tinum &longs;itum, cùmque in hac vni­
uer&longs;ali actione machinularum filum fluidum compo­
nentium &longs;ub&longs;equatur motus regre&longs;&longs;us &longs;ursùm, nec
motus fieri po&longs;&longs;it ab&longs;que impetu, igitur ab hoc præ­
dictæ fluidi particulæ impelluntur altiùs quàm exi­
gat naturalis earum grauitas, & hinc &longs;equitur vt de­
nuò po&longs;tea affluentibus circumcirca fluidi particulis,
denuò gutta rotunda efformetur.

In tertio ca&longs;u Propo&longs;it. præcedentis augeri pote&longs;t
gutta duplici modo, & ex concur&longs;u noui fluidi &longs;u­
pernè &longs;en&longs;im additi, quou&longs;que vis glutinis &longs;ufficiat,
vt pondus guttæ &longs;u&longs;tinere valeat, nè decidat, &longs;ed dum
augetur, lateralitèr cre&longs;cit, ampliaturque, & &longs;ic gut­
ta amittit pri&longs;tinam globo&longs;itatem.
PROP. CLXXIX.

Quare duæ guttæ homogeneæ &longs;e &longs;e tangentes colliguntur
vniunturque.

SEd dignior inqui&longs;itione e&longs;t recollectio duarum
guttularum quoties lateralitèr &longs;e mutuò tangant,
ex quibus componitur vnica gutta rotunda.

Ratio
e&longs;t, quia partes eiu&longs;dem fluidi homogenei facillimè
excurrunt &longs;upra, & intra &longs;e ip&longs;as, dum propter &longs;oli
ariditatem, quando ip&longs;um humectare, & madeface­
re non po&longs;&longs;unt ob pororum incongruentiam, oportet
vt omnes &longs;imul in&longs;i&longs;tant &longs;uper &longs;ilum fluidum, vel &longs;uper
axim perpendicularitèr plano &longs;ubiecto in&longs;i&longs;tentem,
& &longs;ic in orbem, vt priùs dictum e&longs;t, axi connectuntur,
& globum integrum efformant magis tamen contu­
&longs;um, & depre&longs;&longs;um, quàm antea.

Sed dices, quænam e&longs;t vis motiua, quæ impellit

Re&longs;pondeo, quòd hoc pendet ex vi compre&longs;­
&longs;iua collateralium partium, quæ cùm non po&longs;&longs;int pla­
no &longs;ubiecto vniri, & à vi glutinis &longs;uperatur pondus

mò duo globi mercurij A

PROP. CLXXX.

Quare filum ceræ alaccæ, vitri, aui metalli liquefacti à
flamma candelæ in&longs;ufflatæ ope fistulæ dum lique&longs;cit
recolligitur pilam rotundam efformans,
& augens.

RAtio huius effectus e&longs;t quia dum à copio&longs;o, &
vehementi igne particulæ vitri di&longs;gregantur,
non tamen omninò, neque &longs;ecundùm totum, nam vni­
cam ma&longs;&longs;am inflatam, & fluidam componunt, & ideò
ex parte &longs;e &longs;e tangunt, ergo cùm habeant glute&ntail;,
&longs;cilicèt habeant machinas flexiles, & re&longs;ilientes, &longs;it
vt à prædicta ignis penetratione violentèr di&longs;trahan­
tur machinulæ illæ, vt totidem arcus, & ideò pro eo­
rum ingenio vim habent &longs;e recolligendi, & &longs;e vnien­
di cum reliquis partibus fili liquefacti, à quibus di­
&longs;tractæ fuerant: cùmque adueniant duæ aliæ cau&longs;æ
accidentales, quarum vna e&longs;t durities, aut minor flu­
xibilitas perimetri, aut &longs;uperficiei eius externæ re­
&longs;pectu partium intermediarum magis fluidarum, vn­
de efficitur veluti epidermis, & &longs;acculus con&longs;i&longs;ten­
tior; altera cau&longs;a e&longs;t inflatio, quam efficit ignis ve­
hementi&longs;&longs;imè agitans internas vitri partes fluidiores,
quæ cùm circumdentur ambianturque à perimetro,
& &longs;uperficie duriori, & tenaciori, veluti à &longs;acculo,
&longs;it vt à vi glutinis dum conantur &longs;e recolligere par­
tes prædicti fluidi tota ma&longs;&longs;a fu&longs;a, & inflata retraha­
tur, recolligaturque versùs filum, & &longs;ic efformetur
globulus, & eadem ratione augeatur eius diameter,
at dum augetur pila cre&longs;cente pondere amittit prio­
rem illam formam orbicularem, & efficitur gutta ob­
longa deorsùm tendens.

modò quia vis glutinis, &longs;eù
energia machinularum e&longs;t cau&longs;a retractionis particu­

PROP. CLXXXI.

Declaratur quemadmodum lamina gracilis aqua grauior
&longs;pecie foueam efficit in aqua dum innatat, & quare
monticuli illi aquei non decidant.

PRo clariori eiu&longs;dem problematis intelligenti&atail;
inquirenda e&longs;t ratio alterius effectus, qui in flui­
dis ob&longs;eruatur: in va&longs;e BCEI
aqua pleno applicetur graci­
li&longs;&longs;ima lamina ænea FG ho­
rizontalitèr, hæc quidem &longs;i
arida fuerit licèt grauior &longs;pe
cie &longs;it ip&longs;a aqua, non omninò
demergetur, nec ad fundum va&longs;is feretur, &longs;ed de&longs;cen­
det infra &longs;upremam libellam aquæ IB, ibique inna­
tabit efficiendo argines aqueos tumidos, & eleuatos
GAB, & IF, qui non &longs;ecus, ac &longs;i e&longs;&longs;ent parietes im­
pediunt effluxum &longs;upremæ aquæ AB vt nequeat de­
&longs;cendere in profunda fouea IFGA genita à depre&longs;&longs;io­
ne eiu&longs;dem laminæ: & hìc anima deuertendum e&longs;t ca­
uitatem, &longs;eu puteum IFGA effici tunc &longs;olummodò,
quando excurrit ad prædictum &longs;patium replendu&mtail;
aliquod fluidum leuius, &longs;ed non homogeneum ip&longs;i
aquæ veluti e&longs;t aer, vel vacuum Torricellianum: at
adueniente aqua, vel fluido aquæ naturam participan­
te, vt e&longs;t vinum, tunc margines aquei GAB, & IF non
per&longs;i&longs;tent, &longs;ed di&longs;rumpentur, & deorsùm dilap&longs;i fo­
ueam replebunt.

Præterea notandum e&longs;t fieri no&ntail;
po&longs;&longs;e vt argines prædicti aquei cuiu&longs;cumque altitu­
dinis per&longs;i&longs;tant, &longs;i enim quartam partem latitudinis
digiti auricularis &longs;uperauerint, &longs;ubitò deorsùm præ­
cipitantur.

Ratio quæ a&longs;&longs;ignari &longs;olet, huius effectus,
aut e&longs;t compre&longs;&longs;io aeris multoties à nobis reiecta, aut
quia veluti in aceruo granorum tritici, vel arenæ con­
tingit efficitur montuo&longs;itas quædam decliuis, qui&atail;
nimirùm &longs;upremæ partes fulciuntur ab inferioribus,
vt arginem inclinatum efforment, qui non pote&longs;t e­
leuari vltra angulum &longs;emirectum, aliàs &longs;ubitò grana
ip&longs;a deciderent deorsùm; concipiunt ergo minim&atail;
aquam componentia e&longs;&longs;e minuti&longs;&longs;ima quædam gra­
nula, & proindè ad in&longs;tar arenæ efformare po&longs;&longs;e ar­
ginem prædictum.

Sed hoc non videtur &longs;ufficiens
duplici de cau&longs;a, primò quia argines aquei non ele­
uantur ad quamlibet altitudinem, vt contingit in a­
ceruo granorum tritici, licèt enim angulus inclina­
tionis arginis aquei, &longs;cilicèt complementum anguli
AGF, minor &longs;it &longs;emi&longs;&longs;e vnius anguli recti, non pote&longs;t
altitudo prædicti arginis eleuari vltra altitudine&mtail;
quadrantis latitudinis digiti auricularis, cùm oppo­
&longs;itum ob&longs;eruetur in aceruo granorum tritici.

Præte­
rea argines aquei BAG, & FI &longs;unt curui, & gibbi, &
in infima eius parte G angulus inclinationis maior e&longs;­
&longs;e &longs;olet &longs;emirecto, igitur requiritur aliqua alia cau&longs;a
præter fulcimentum particularum minimarum, quod
in arena, & in aceruo granorum tritici contingit.

Hoc
egregiè ex no&longs;tra hypothe&longs;i &longs;aluatur, dum enim la­
mina FG de&longs;cendit infra &longs;upremam aquæ libellam IB,
particulæ extimæ &longs;uperficiei aquæ CAG, & IF quæ
mutuò inter &longs;e connectebantur, ob iam dictam lanu­
ginem flexibilem, & re&longs;ilien­
tem, po&longs;tea di&longs;trahun­
tur machinul&etail;, & ideò fortiùs
ad inuicem vinciuntur, & pro­
indè efformant veluti pleu­
ram, &longs;eù reticulum à quo re­
tineri, & impediri po&longs;&longs;unt partes aquæ prædicti mon­
ticuli GAB, &longs;ed non licet prædictam montuo&longs;itatem
ad quancunque altitudinem eleuare, propterea quòd
re&longs;i&longs;tentia machinularum ip&longs;ius aquæ exigui roboris
e&longs;t, & proindè tamdiù per&longs;euerabit, quamdiù pu&longs;il­
lam vim grauitatis &longs;uperat, quæ naturali in&longs;tinctu
deorsùm tendere debet obliquo, & inclinato itine­
re, & ideò eius momentum men&longs;uratur à perpendi­
culari altitudine &longs;upra planum FG, quæ valdè exi­
gua e&longs;t vt diximus.

DEbemus modò rationem afferre alterius phœ­
nomeni difficilioris.

&longs;it vas aqua plenum RDEI
in quo immergatur quodlibet corpus &longs;olidum, & du­
rum FGK, quod &longs;it aridum, & non vngatur &longs;ebo, vel

va&longs;is, tunc con&longs;tat experientia,
quòd aqua non per&longs;i&longs;tit in in­
fima eius libella horizontali
AK, &longs;ed repit, a&longs;cenditque per &longs;uperficiem eleuatam

&longs;ectio e&longs;t BGK, ibidemque retinetur &longs;u&longs;penditurque

uo BG impediretur eius fluxus deor&longs;um ver&longs;us aquam

Quia verò aqua non amittit naturalem
eius grauitatem, a&longs;&longs;ignari debet cau&longs;a à qua &longs;u&longs;pen&longs;a
retinetur, & quæ vis ip&longs;am &longs;ursùm prius impulit.

Hæc profectò aut propria, & naturalis e&longs;t ip&longs;ius aqu&etail;,

Quòd verò non &longs;it vis propria, & natiua ip&longs;ius
aquæ, patet ex &longs;uperiùs dictis, quia nimirùm &longs;emper
aqua grauis e&longs;t, exercetque &longs;uam vim compre&longs;&longs;iuam

iectum mercurium K, quàm aer

tus premat &longs;ubiectum mercurium B, & præterea mercu­

igitur hìc quoque eleuari deberet mons mer­

Et licèt re&longs;ponderi po&longs;&longs;et quòd cau&longs;a

Verùm minus grauis mercu­
rij moles in &longs;trictiori fi&longs;tula contenti faciliùs &longs;u&longs;pen­

quàm CA. po&longs;tea aer perimetris in­

aeris pre&longs;&longs;iones debilitat&etail; viribus æ­

primere debent; at intermediæ par­
tes aeris versùs axes cylindrorum exi&longs;tentes inæqua­

in G, igitur validiori vi retundetur monticulus tumi­
dus BAD quàm EGL, & ideo altior erit monticulus

&longs;cilicèt non eleuarentur argines illi aquei &etail;què ab ae­
re compre&longs;&longs;i, ac reliqua aquæ &longs;uperficies horizonta­
lis.

Præterea in vacuo Torricelliano aer ibi non exi­
&longs;tens non po&longs;&longs;et eleuare argines aqueos parietibus fi­
&longs;tulæ adh&etail;rentes; vel &longs;i ibidem remanet minima aeris

terni eiu&longs;dem molis: igitur illa non poterit &longs;upra a­
quæ libellam eleuare idem pondus arginis aquei quod
in aere aperto ab huius ingenti pondere &longs;u&longs;pendeba­

in prædicto vacuo &longs;ublimantur, ac in aere aperto, igi­
tur non ab aere ibidem non exi&longs;tente, vel rari&longs;&longs;imo

parietis à qua impeditur de&longs;cen&longs;us, &longs;u&longs;pendunturque

nam ad &longs;ummum dicta &longs;cabrities commoda e&longs;&longs;et, &
apta ad retinendam aquam po&longs;tquam &longs;emèl eleuata
fui&longs;&longs;et ad illam altitudinem, quatenùs ab a&longs;peritati­
bus, veluti vncinis impediretur defluxus aquæ deor­
sùm, at non po&longs;&longs;ent aquam &longs;ubleuare, cùm &longs;cabrities
vim motiuam non habeat; & &longs;anè a&longs;peritates nedum
non adiuuarent, &longs;ed potiùs impedirent aquæ eleua­
tionem in prædictis arginibus duplici nomine, primò
quia eædem parietis &longs;cabro&longs;itates, quæ vim habent
prohibendi de&longs;cen&longs;um aquæ, impediunt quoque eius
a&longs;cen&longs;um; præterea multò magis, & maiori vi a&longs;cen­
&longs;us aquæ impediri deberet quàm eius de&longs;cen&longs;us, quia
in a&longs;cen&longs;u aqua præter re&longs;i&longs;tentiam a&longs;peritatis parie­
tis &longs;uperare debet impedimentum, & reluctantiam
propriæ grauitatis, cum è contra in de&longs;cen&longs;u ab hac
adiuuetur.

igitur &longs;cabrities parietis non pote&longs;t e&longs;&longs;&etail;
cau&longs;a eleuationis aquæ in prædictis arginibus.

Debet modo a&longs;&longs;ignari virtus motiua, quæ eleuat,

&longs;ummitatem arginis, & hanc demon&longs;trabo e&longs;&longs;e &longs;im­

Quia aquæ particulæ ad­
hærentes parieti va&longs;is in&longs;inuant ramos &longs;uarum machi­
nularum intra poro&longs;itates, & foueolas parietis, à cu­
ius eminentijs, & a&longs;peritatibus fulciuntur extremi­
tates particularum aquæ, quarum oppo&longs;iti termini
&longs;u&longs;tinentur, à &longs;ubiecta collaterali aqua, proptereà
efficientur veluti totidem vectes conuertibiles circa
eorum fulcimenta parieti annexa.

Hinc fit vt prædi­
ctæ aquæ particulæ exiguam vim compre&longs;&longs;iuam exer­
ceant, & minori momento &longs;ubiectam aquam com­
primant, cùm partes aquæ collateralis liberè premen­

momentum exerceant, igitur ex prop.
174. partes
minùs pre&longs;&longs;æ &longs;ursùm impelli debent à partibus ma­
gis compre&longs;&longs;is: & licèt illæ retineantur, & impedian­
tur ne motu &longs;ibi ip&longs;i æquidi&longs;tanti ferri &longs;ursùm queant,
tamen eadem impedimenta a&longs;peritatum parietis præ­
clarè adiuuant flexionem, & turbinationem earun­
dem aquæ particularum, igitur à vi motiua grauita­
tis maioris aquæ collateralis flecti, rotari, & impelli
&longs;ursùm po&longs;&longs;unt parieti adh&etail;rendo eædem aquæ par­
ticulæ; dum verò efficitur prædicta eleuatio, &longs;ummi­
tates guttularum reuolutarum eminentiores reddun­
tur quàm aliæ particulæ parieti adhærentes, igitur
tunc prædictæ particulæ iam eleuatæ naturali in&longs;tin-
ctu excurrent versùs parietem, cui &longs;uis villis adhæ­
rebunt, ex qua adhæ&longs;ione momentum eius grauitatis
denuò imminuetur, & ideò renouabitur cau&longs;a vlte­
rioris eius eleuationis à compre&longs;&longs;ione laterali aquæ
&longs;uo momento non imminuto comprimentis, & hinc
&longs;equitur continuatio prædicti a&longs;cen&longs;us rotando, &
adhærendo parieti, quou&longs;que efficiatur æquilibrium
cum prædicta aqua collaterali liberè premente.

PROP. CLXXXIII.

Aqua in fi&longs;tulis non a&longs;cendit &longs;pontè &longs;ua à vi motiua particu­
larum eius impul&longs;a, neque in&longs;inuatur, retineturque
ibidem ab æquilibrio aeris, aut ab internis ca­
naliculi a&longs;peritatibus.

RElatis ob&longs;eruationibus inquirendum e&longs;t, an præ­
dicta phænomena &longs;aluari po&longs;&longs;int ex no&longs;tris, vel
ex aliorum Authorum principijs.

Et primò &longs;i aqu&atail;
&longs;ponte &longs;ua a&longs;cendit intra fi&longs;tulæ cauitatem à vi parti­
cularum eius &longs;e mouentium, igitur aut grauitate om­
ninò carent, aut in tali ca&longs;u eam non exercent (quod
vltrò aliqui Authores concedunt) &longs;i inquam hoc ve­
rum e&longs;t, impo&longs;&longs;ibile e&longs;&longs;et vt aqua in fi&longs;tula immi&longs;&longs;&atail;
perpendiculariter erecta exerceret vllam vim com­
pre&longs;&longs;iuam deorsùm, & ideò &longs;i fi&longs;tula infernè prolon­
garetur, nullo pacto aqua ibidem deorsùm de&longs;cende­
ret, quod tamen experientiæ refragatur, nam eadem
fi&longs;tula cum aqua contenta in aere translata, & per­
pendiculariter ad horizontem erecta &longs;i inuer&longs;o &longs;itu
di&longs;ponatur vt pars eius &longs;upina A fiat prona, aut ei alia
fi&longs;tula infernè adnectatur, aqua in ea contenta celeri
motu de&longs;cendit, &longs;i madida fuerit, quou&longs;que prope
infimum orificium perducatur; igitur fal&longs;um e&longs;t a­
quæ in fi&longs;tula contentæ particulas grauitate priuari,
proindeque &longs;ponte &longs;ua intra fi&longs;tulam a&longs;cendere.

Cum
verò aiunt cau&longs;am prædicti a&longs;cen&longs;us aquæ pender&etail;
ex eo quòd eius particulæ naturali in&longs;tinctu feruntur
versùs fluidum aqueum, vel aquæ analogum conten­
tum in vitri internis poro&longs;itatibus, nec à grauitate,
quam negant, impediri po&longs;&longs;unt: &longs;i hoc, inquam, ve­
rum e&longs;&longs;et, madefacta vniuer&longs;a fi&longs;tulæ interna cauita­
te, & po&longs;tea exinanita, atque immer&longs;o orificio infra
aquæ &longs;ubiectæ libellam eleuari &longs;emper altiùs deberet
aqua v&longs;que ad fi&longs;tulæ &longs;upremum orificium, quod ta­
men e&longs;t fal&longs;um, non ergo &longs;ponte &longs;ua aqua intra fi&longs;tu­
lam eleuatur.

Alij po&longs;tea aiunt quòd dum fi&longs;tula AB tangit aquam

&longs;uo pondere, & vi ela&longs;tica com­
primit infernè partem aqu&etail; F ex­
tra fi&longs;tulam exi&longs;tentem, eamque

nè verò aer penetrando cauita­
tem fi&longs;tulæ, AB contrario ni&longs;u re­
pellit &longs;ummitatem aquæ F intr&atail;
orificium B in&longs;inuatam: quia ve­
rò fieri non pote&longs;t vt contactus,
& a&longs;peritates internæ fi&longs;tulæ non
impediant de&longs;cen&longs;um, & ni&longs;um
compre&longs;&longs;iuum aeris, fit vt minori momento aer per

mitatem F, quàm liber aer externus à nullo impedi­
mento debilitatus; igitur aqua F à validiori vi impul
&longs;iua aeris externi impelli &longs;ursùm debet, & in&longs;inuari
intra fi&longs;tulam à B ad C. quou&longs;que minor vis aeris per
AC tran&longs;euntis vnà cum pondere aquæ CB æquili­
brentur momento totali aeris externi, quapropter
exce&longs;&longs;us momenti totalis aeris non impediti &longs;upr&atail;
momentum aeris debilitati æqualis e&longs;t ponderi aquæ
CD.

Debemus modò fal&longs;itatem huius &longs;ententiæ o&longs;ten­
dere.

Reuoluatur fi&longs;tula AB vnà cum aqua contenta
CD inuer&longs;o &longs;itu, vt &longs;upina eius pars A fiat prona, tunc
aer infernè per prolixum canaliculum AC immi&longs;&longs;us
non &longs;ecùs ac priùs impeditur à contactibus, & a&longs;pe-
ritatibus internis vitri, & ideò eodem debiliori, &
imminuto momento pellit aquam CD &longs;ursùm, impe­
ditque eius de&longs;cen&longs;um.

E contrà aer &longs;upernè nil fe­
rè impeditus premit deorsùm aquam D orificio B pe­
nè contiguam, igitur non &longs;ecùs, ac priùs aer totali
momento eius deorsùm impellit aquam DC: ab hoc
verò momento non &longs;ubtrahitur, immò ei additur pon­
dus aquæ DC, igitur momentum, quo aqua DC im­
pellitur deorsùm maiori exce&longs;&longs;u, nempè duplò &longs;upe­
rat vim, qua &longs;ursùm repellitur, &longs;cilicèt æqualis e&longs;t
duplo ponderis aquæ DC, &longs;ed priùs medietas pr&etail;di­
cti exce&longs;&longs;us, non ob&longs;tante fi&longs;tulæ interna ariditate, a­
quam &longs;ursùm celeri motu eleuauerat, igitur multò ce­
leriùs, & faciliùs in &longs;ecundo ca&longs;u à duplici exce&longs;&longs;u vir­
tutis motiu&etail; deprimi aqua DC deorsùm deberet per
aridum canalem CA, &longs;ed hoc e&longs;t fal&longs;um, nam aqu&atail;
DC quie&longs;cit, aut tardi&longs;&longs;imo motu de&longs;cendit versùs
A, ergò non eleuatur aqua in fi&longs;tula ob inæquales ae­
ris impul&longs;iones.

Quare aqua ab ima fi&longs;tulæ parte in aere con&longs;titutæ non

MOdò remanet difficultas, quare &longs;cilicèt in infi­
mo fi&longs;tulæ confinio in aere con&longs;titutæ impe-

aeris fieri, nihilominùs ex no&longs;tris principijs dici po­

nis particularum aquæ inter &longs;e connexæ di&longs;trahuntur,
& ideo tenaciori re&longs;i&longs;tentia vinciuntur, & efficiunt

ac &longs;u&longs;tinentur guttæ aqueæ è ramis arborum pen­

PROP. CLXXXV.

Re&longs;tat modò cau&longs;a motiua, à qua &longs;ur&longs;um
impellitur aqua in fi&longs;tulis.

QVæ meo iudicio ex theoria nuper expo&longs;ita pen­
det, quia nempe in cauitatibus &longs;ubtilium fi&longs;tu­
larum internus aquæ contactus grandis e&longs;t, & amplus

efficitur in eius interno, & cauo perimetro efficaci&longs;­
&longs;imus contactus à cuius adhæ&longs;ione fulciri &longs;u&longs;tineri­
què pote&longs;t maius pondus, quàm habet pu&longs;illa aquæ
particula in&longs;inuata, & ideo gradus prædictæ virtutis
&longs;u&longs;pen&longs;iuæ, & adhæ&longs;ionis exercetur in aqua &longs;ubicta,
& proinde ea reddetur aliquo pacto leuis, &longs;eu minùs
pondero&longs;a, quàm &longs;it aqua collateralis liberè premens.

Et quia minimæ aquæ particulæ poro&longs;itatibus, & a&longs;-
peritaribus internis fi&longs;tulæ innixæ efficiuntur operan­

compre&longs;&longs;æ à totali energia &longs;ui ponderis vim faciant
impellendo &longs;ursùm particulas illas aquæ, quæ minùs
comprimuntur à vectibus &longs;upradictis, & ideo rotando

monticulum aqueum, qui excurrendo lateralitèr al­
tioribus fi&longs;tulæ poro&longs;itatibus in&longs;inuabitur, adhære­
bitque, & ideò denuò imminuetur | eius vis compre&longs;&longs;i­
ua, renouabiturque cau&longs;a vlterioris &longs;u&longs;pen&longs;ionis, &
proindè altiùs aqua intra fi&longs;tulam impelletur, & &longs;ic

æquilibrium cum aqua collaterali liberè premente
efficiatur, tunc quidem quies eius &longs;ub&longs;equetur, nec

SEd pro clariori huius rei intelligentia ph&etail;menon

His po&longs;itis tran&longs;portetur integra fi&longs;tu­
la vnà cum aqua contenta ab aqua ad aerem,
perpendicularitèr tamen erecta ad planum
horizontis tunc effluere cunctanter con&longs;pi­
citur ab infimo orificio B guttula quædam,
quæ &longs;en&longs;im colligitur, tume&longs;citque; & hoc

orificio B defluat noua aquæ gutta.

Modò
dum aqua &longs;upra terminum E versùs C per&longs;euerat orificium

& extremæ parti ip&longs;ius fi&longs;tulæ B, videbis aquam BC

guttulæ inferioris augetur eius altitudo exugendo
nimirùm aquam ip&longs;ius guttulæ D.

pri­
mò quando gutta pendula D adhæret in&longs;imo fi&longs;tulæ

Sed in priori

&longs;ed re&longs;ponderi pote&longs;t quod à vi im­

Aqua in fistula magis demer&longs;a non debet altiùs eleuari
quàm in ca quæ aquam, aut aerem tangit.

SEd procedamus ad præcipuam difficultatem, ex
cuius &longs;olutione reliquis omnibus &longs;atisfiet.

Sit
vas RSV aqua plenum, &longs;umanturque duæ fi&longs;tulæ æ­
quales, & æquè amplis cauitatibus perforatæ, vtrin­
que apertæ, vna quidem AB profundiùs demergatur
infra aquæ libellam RV; reliqua verò EH tantum­
modò &longs;uperficiem aquæ RV contingat, & ambo per­
pendicularitèr in&longs;i&longs;tant &longs;upremo
plano aquæ RV.

Si ergo veru&mtail;
e&longs;t, quòd aqua collateralis magis
compre&longs;&longs;a à totali eius momento
qualis e&longs;t cylindrus aqueus FI
comparatus cum aqua BC, quæ
minus comprimit &longs;ubiectam aquam,
eò quòd &longs;u&longs;penditur, &longs;u&longs;tentatur­
que ab internis vitri a&longs;peritati­
bus, redditurque aqua CB veluti
virga lignea re&longs;pectu aquæ colla­
teralis FI; ergo quò profundiùs demergitur fi&longs;tul&atail;
longior e&longs;t virgula minùs grauis aquea BC, & ideò,
ex demon&longs;tratis, validiori vi &longs;ursùm impelletur ab a­
qua collaterali FI, quàm impellatur &longs;ursùm exiguus
cylindrulus aquæ H, qui &longs;u&longs;tinetur, & comparatur cum

Sed re&longs;pondetur, quòd aqua CB non redditur le­
uior ob internum contactum fi&longs;tulæ, nam intern&atail;
fi&longs;tulæ &longs;uperficies cùm &longs;it madida, nihil, aut paru&mtail;

BC, & hoc experitur cùm in aere transfertur fi&longs;tula,
tunc enim aqua intra cauitatem eius madidam libe­
rè mouetur de&longs;cendit que; præcipuum verò impedi­
mentum in extremo orificio fi&longs;tulæ B experitur, non
intra aquam, &longs;ed po&longs;tquam aerem attingit; non qui­
dem à vi ela&longs;tica, vel ponder&etail;
eiu&longs;dem aeris, &longs;ed quia tunc i&ntail;
aqua ad confinium B perducta effi­
citur rete &longs;uperiùs expo&longs;itum, qua­
tenùs particul&etail; infernæ illius aqu&etail;
vici&longs;&longs;im connexæ dum pendent à
vi propri&etail; grauitatis di&longs;tract&etail; ea­
rum machinulæ paritèr maiorem
violentiam patiuntur, & ideò ma­
iori vi vici&longs;&longs;im connectuntur, &
&longs;ic re&longs;i&longs;tere violentiæ pre&longs;&longs;ionis
aquæ po&longs;&longs;unt; at in ca&longs;u no&longs;tro exi&longs;tente orificio B
demer&longs;o infra aquam non pote&longs;t effici rete illud ro­
bu&longs;tum aptum ad &longs;u&longs;tinendam aquam incumbentem,
quia non di&longs;trahuntur machinulæ aquæ B exi&longs;tentes,
& contingentes internam aquam va&longs;is RSV: hinc fit
vt facilè vna aquæ pars &longs;uper aliam &longs;ibi contigua&mtail;
excurrere valeat, & hinc deducitur ratio quare i&ntail;

RV tetigerit, tunc enim de&longs;cendit à K ad G, & HG

diùs mergitur, vt in B; quia nimirum dum in aere ex­

&longs;ubiectam contingit, tum connexio illa tenax facilè
&longs;oluitur diffluitque, & &longs;ic non ampliùs &longs;u&longs;tinere tan­

Id ip&longs;um præterea confirmatur, quia in contactu
aquæ in H &longs;u&longs;penditur circa fi&longs;tulam externè monti­
culus quidam aqueus &longs;upra libellam RV, quod con­
&longs;equenter &longs;uadet aquam a vi contactus vitri externi
&longs;u&longs;pendi ni&longs;u contrario eius, qui à grauitate aquæ
exercetur, & proindè aqua prædicto monticulo &longs;ub­
iecta, & annexa leuior redditur, igitur aqua infr&atail;
orificium &longs;ubiectum fi&longs;tulæ ob prædictam &longs;u&longs;pen&longs;io­
nem minùs grauis facta, nece&longs;sè e&longs;t, vt eleuetur ab

quæ &longs;ubiectæ libellam quou&longs;que fiat momentorum
æquilibrium.

Ex hac theoria facilè re&longs;oluuntur circum&longs;tantiæ,

uantur, & &longs;imul magis confirmatur doctrina &longs;uperiùs

PROP. CLXXXVIII.

In fi&longs;tulis strictioribus altiùs aqua eleuari debet, quàm in
latioribus, & in fistulis æqualibus, &longs;ed in æqualiter ad
aquæ &longs;uperficiem inclinatis aqua ad eamdem
altitudinem eleuatur.

ET primo loco percipitur quare in fi&longs;tulis latio­
ribus aqua ad minorem altitudinem eleuatur,
quàm in &longs;ubtili&longs;&longs;imis, & angu&longs;ti&longs;&longs;imis canalibus: &
e&longs;t, quia adhærentia, & connexio aquæ parietibus
internis canalium maiorem proportionem ad molem
aquæ in&longs;inuatæ exten&longs;iuè, & inten&longs;iuè in canaliculis
&longs;ubtili&longs;&longs;imis, habet quàm in amplis, & capacioribus.

Et quoad exten&longs;ionem pertinet, quia vis adhæ&longs;ionis
men&longs;uratur à contactibus, & ideò à &longs;uperficie inter­
na canaliculorum, è contrà re&longs;i&longs;tentia men&longs;uratur à
pondere cylindri aquei contenti in ij&longs;dem canalicu­
lis, e&longs;tque proportio cylindrorum aqueorum eiu&longs;dem
altitudiais duplicata eius rationis, quam habent eo­
rum perimetri | interni, igitur quanto magis cre&longs;cit
interna canalis amplitudo, tantò magis minuitur ad­
hæ&longs;io, & augetur re&longs;i&longs;tentia ponderis ip&longs;ius aquæ con­
tentæ.

Imminuitur po&longs;teà gradus inten&longs;iuus internæ
adhæ&longs;ionis, proptereà quod, vt dictum e&longs;t &longs;upra, non
e&longs;t æquè valida facultas, & energia adhæ&longs;ionis aqu&etail;,
& connexionis | cum parietibus internis |in | vniuer&longs;o
illo argine montuo&longs;o, &longs;ed e&longs;t minus efficax, quantò
magis ab internis parietibus remouetur.

Modò i&ntail;
fi&longs;tulis amplioribus aqua contenta versùs axim caui­
tatis eius magis recedit à &longs;uperficie interna fi&longs;tulæ
dilatatæ, quàm in fi&longs;tula &longs;trictiori, & ideò in illa de­
biliùs aqua &longs;u&longs;tinebitur &longs;u&longs;pendeturque, & quantò
minor e&longs;t vis &longs;u&longs;tinens, & eleuans re&longs;pectu ponderis
fluidi contenti, tantò debet imminui &longs;ublimitas eius
eleuationis, vbi præcisè efficitur æquilibrium &longs;upe­
riùs expo&longs;itum.
In fine prop.

Similitèr in eodem canaliculo ad horizontem in­

pelletur ab eadem cau&longs;a eleuante non alterata, &longs;cili­

&longs;int vtrinque

ctus fui&longs;&longs;et aer idem internè comprehen&longs;us impediret
aqu&etail; a&longs;cen&longs;um, quia non po&longs;&longs;et aqua in&longs;inuari ab&longs;que
eo quod contentus aer &longs;tringeretur conden&longs;aretur­
que, cumque aer conden&longs;ari con&longs;tiparique nequeat,
ni&longs;i à noua cau&longs;a violentèr eum conden&longs;ante, cui aer
&longs;ua vi ela&longs;tica re&longs;i&longs;tit, igitur &longs;i aqua intra prædictam
fi&longs;tulam ingrederetur, con&longs;tringere aerem internu&mtail;

dict prædictum ingre&longs;&longs;um.

SVnt ferè triginta duo anni, cùm ego experiri vo­

&longs;e vniebant, amplectebanturque, aliæ verò &longs;egrega­

igitur ab hac nouitate excitatus idip&longs;um comproba­
ui adhibitis alijs corpu&longs;culis, fe&longs;tucis, folijs arborum,
& innumeris alijs corporibus; cùmque ego &longs;ummo­
perè optarem cau&longs;am prædicti effectus perciper&etail;,

pendere ab aqueis arginibus
circa corpora natantia adia­
centia, aliquando eminenti­
bus, aliquando depre&longs;&longs;is.

Sump&longs;i
duas laminulas æreas papyro

X, & in earum punctis intermedijs C, & L appo&longs;ui

appo&longs;ui po&longs;tea laminas &longs;upra aquam va&longs;is FRSO

quarum altitudines &longs;e­

ij&longs;dem quoque &longs;e&longs;tucas per

tur circà earum perimetrum montuo&longs;itates quædam decli­

His præparatis &longs;olertèr digitis impuli &longs;ummitate&mtail;
D fe&longs;tucæ approximando laminulam V versùs X, ean­
que firmitèr retinendo antequam ad contactum al­

versùs alteram, & licèt mediocri violentia digitis re­

non minùs, quàm priùs veloci cur&longs;u &longs;e mutuò ample­
ctebantur, &longs;ed in ip&longs;o actu coniunctionis earum om­
ninò explanabatur monticulus GHN aqu&etail;, quo priùs
&longs;egregabantur, po&longs;tea me conuerti ad a&longs;&longs;ulas ligneas,
Y, & Z quæ paritèr immobiles, & inertes erant quan­
do ab inuicem di&longs;tabant &longs;patio maiori, quàm digita-
li, &longs;ed magis appropinquata vna versùs alteram, &longs;u­
bitò a&longs;&longs;ulæ excurrebant ad &longs;e &longs;e amplectendum, &

FH de&longs;cendendo, &longs;ed è contrà &longs;patium intermedium,

Tandem coniunxi laminam æream V cum
a&longs;&longs;icula Z, & vidi, quod
quotie&longs;cumque approxi­
mabantur ad di&longs;tantia&mtail;
digito minorem, nedùm &longs;e
mutuò non amplecteban­
tur, &longs;ed è contra vna rapi­
dè ab altera effugiebat,
&longs;egregabaturque, qua&longs;i a­

Quaprop­
ter experientia con&longs;tat, quòd acce&longs;&longs;io, approximatio,
& amplexus laminularum, tunc &longs;olummodò accidit,
quando argines aquei &longs;imiles &longs;unt inter &longs;e, &longs;cilicèt
quando ambo sunt eleuati, vel vterque depre&longs;&longs;us e&longs;t in­
tra aquæ va&longs;is libellam; &longs;ed quando argines aquei sunt
contrario ordine di&longs;po&longs;iti, vnus quidem depre&longs;&longs;us,
alter verò eleuatus &longs;upra aquæ libellam, tunc effici­
tur a&longs;&longs;ularum &longs;eparatio, & fuga.

Et in omnibus præ­
dictis operationibus experitur, quod &longs;i vna prædi­
ctarum laminularum fixè, & in quiete retineatur, &longs;eù
potiùs in ori&longs;icio va&longs;is exi&longs;tat, reliqua laminula li­
bera, & non retenta, aut accedet, aut fugiet conta-
ctum alterius laminæ immobilis; cùm verò ambo li­
berè in fluido innatant, tunc motus e&longs;t communis in
vtroque corpore, cum hac tamen differentia, quòd
corpus minùs amplum, & minùs pondero&longs;um veloci­
ori motu, aut accedit, aut refugit à reliquo, cum è
contrà agitatio amplioris laminæ tardi&longs;&longs;imo, & lan­
guido motu fiat.

Et hæc e&longs;t vera, & accurata hi&longs;toria
huius admirandi effectus.

non igitur miror veram cau­

Hanc experientiam Amicis communicaui, quorum
quamplurimi adhùc viuunt, tùm in Sicilia, tùm Romæ.

po&longs;te à anno 1655 Florentiæ Sereni&longs;&longs;imo Ferdinando
Magno Duci, & Principi Co&longs;mo Hetruriæ, ac Mæ­
cenati optimo, &longs;apienti&longs;&longs;imoque Leopoldo Cardi­
nali Mediceo, qui humani&longs;&longs;imè nuperis &longs;uis literis
huius meæ o&longs;ten&longs;ionis, & ratiocinij à me tunc tem­
poris adducti &longs;e optimè recordari &longs;crip&longs;it.

In&longs;titut&atail;
po&longs;tea Experimentali Academia Medicea publicè &longs;o­
cijs illis docti&longs;&longs;imis eamdem experientiam o&longs;tendi,
& innumeris præclaris viris variarum nationum, qui­
bus præcipiente Sereni&longs;&longs;imo Cardinali offerebatur
&longs;pectaculum &longs;electiorum experimentorum prædictæ
Academiæ.

Præter iam dictas nouitates aliam po&longs;tea ob&longs;eruaui
àcau&longs;a longè diuer&longs;a pendentem pro cuius intelli-
gentia recen&longs;eri priùs debet effectus &longs;atis vulgatus
duarum laminularum ex vitro exqui&longs;itè explanato, &
l&etail;uigato, quæ &longs;ibi mutuò congruunt, atque exo&longs;cu­
lantur, amplexanturque tanta tenacitate vt &longs;i &longs;upre­
ma horizonti parallela &longs;ursùm eleuetur, pariter &longs;uc­
cedit, trahiturque alia lamina contigua inferior, &longs;u­
&longs;tineturque pendula, non &longs;ecùs, ac &longs;i e&longs;&longs;et &longs;uperiori
connexa conglutinataque, quod &longs;i &longs;uperna vitrea la­
minula pauli&longs;pèr ad planum horizontis inclinetur,
tunc &longs;ubitò inferior laminula excurret versùs partem
decliuem plani &longs;uperioris ab&longs;que eo quod à &longs;uprema
lamina diuellatur, &longs;ed &longs;emper illi adhærendo de&longs;cen­
det impul&longs;a ab in&longs;tinctu naturali, quo grauia conan­t
ur &longs;emper magis ad centrum grauium accedere eo
modo, quo po&longs;&longs;unt, &longs;cilicèt via inclinata, cum directa,
& perpendicularis fuerit impedita.

HOc &longs;uppo&longs;ito &longs;int duæ guttulæ aquæ ABC, vna

vim motiuam habeat horizon­

ter non magis, quam priùs cen­

neque mos e&longs;t naturæ fru&longs;trà

læ tangat &longs;uperficiem dextram GH inferioris guttu­

&longs;tra Academia experimentali Medicea excogita­

v&longs;urpari enim &longs;olet phiala aliqua, cuius aluus par­

Sed quia aqua adhærens prædi­
cto collo fi&longs;tulæ, numquam explanatè eum &longs;ecat, &longs;ed
&longs;emper aut deprimitur in foueolam iam dictam, vel

cem de&longs;ignat, quæ tandem cùm in aqua vnum, vel al­

Ex dictis colligitur quod fi&longs;tula vitrea libellatoria
(quam hydro&longs;taticam libellam nonnulli vocant) non­
nullis difficultatibus ac fallacijs obnoxia &longs;it.

primò
quia &longs;i fi&longs;tulæ vitreæ erectæ perpendicularitèr ad pla­
num horizontis non fuerint præcisè æquè amplæ,
procùl dubio argines aqueos internos inæquales effi­
cient, ideoque planum per &longs;ummitates arginum aque­
orum exten&longs;um non erit horizonti æquidi&longs;tans, idip­
&longs;um continget &longs;i prædictæ duæ fi&longs;tulæ erectæ fuerint
æquales inter &longs;e, at non &longs;int omninò &longs;ordibus vnctuo­
&longs;is purgatæ, & ter&longs;æ, cùm pinguedo illa prohibeat ar­
ginis aquei eleuationem magis, aut minùs pro copi&atail;
aut defectu prædictæ pinguedinis.

præterea &longs;i vna fi­
&longs;tularum fuerit internè arida, reliqua verò madefacta,
argines quoque aquei in madida fi&longs;tula eleuantur, non
verò in arida.

Alio in&longs;uper nomine fallax e&longs;t prædictum in&longs;tru­
mentum, cùm enim aqua numquam pura, & &longs;incer&atail;
haberi po&longs;&longs;it, fit vt ni&longs;i bullulæ aereæ quibus num­
quam aqua &longs;poliatur, æquè di&longs;tributæ &longs;int in vtraque
fi&longs;tula, erunt moleculæ illæ aqueæ inæ qualitèr gra­
ues &longs;pecie, & ideò earum &longs;ummitates habebunt inæ-
quales eleuationes, proindeque non o&longs;tendent exa­
ctam libellam horizontalem.

Idip&longs;um continget quo­
tie&longs;cumque fi&longs;tulæ prædictæ non fuerint ab code&mtail;
gradu caliditatis rarefactæ, nempè &longs;i vna à &longs;olaribus
radijs illu&longs;tretur, reliqua verò in loco vmbro&longs;o, aut
magis frigido degat.

non &longs;ecùs &longs;i &longs;ordes terreæ, aut
&longs;ales inæqualitèr di&longs;tributi fuerint in vtroque canali­
culo, nunquam præcisè organum prædictum vera&mtail;
horizontalem libellam indicabit.

At &longs;i loco aquæ mer­
curium in prædicta fi&longs;tula inclu&longs;erimus, non effugie­

&longs;umus numquam in operationibus erra&longs;&longs;e quanta.

e&longs;t

&longs;cendere, propterea quod minimæ particulæ mate­
riales corporeæ æquè graues &longs;upponendæ &longs;unt, & hæ
&longs;ibi ip&longs;is &longs;uperadditæ minimè augere velocitate&mtail;
po&longs;&longs;unt cum vna alteram impellere nequeat, tùm quia
omnes habent æquales vires motiuas, cùm etiam quia
vis æqualis in ei æqualem agere non pote&longs;t, & ideò
eam non promouebit, proindeque velocitas non au­
gebitur &longs;icuti decem canes venatici &etail;què veloces in­
ter &longs;e connexi, & &longs;imùl currentes non percurrent ma­
ius &longs;patium, quàm vnus eorum eodem tempore, qua­
re licèt moles corporea augeatur, & tantumdem pon­
dus cre&longs;cat multipliceturque, non proindè vis moti­
ua inten&longs;iuè augetur, &longs;ed tantummodò exten&longs;iuè,
quatenùs expanditur vniformi di&longs;tributione in om­
nes materiæ grauis particulas, & &longs;ic velocitatem au­
gere nequeunt.

Præterea adeo fal&longs;um e&longs;t velocitates de&longs;cen&longs;uum
proportionales e&longs;&longs;e ponderibus corporum inæqua-
lium, vt ex hac hypothe&longs;i euidenter concludatur cor­
pus magis graue tardius de&longs;cendere quam minus graue.

Hoc eleganti&longs;&longs;imè demon&longs;tratum fuit à Galileo in

Nouæ ratio­
nes pro Ari­
&longs;totele ad­
ducuntur.

Sed licèt ea, quæ huc v&longs;que dicta &longs;unt, euidenti&longs;&longs;i­
mè &longs;uadeant non habere velocitates corporum de­
&longs;cendentium eamdem proportionem, quam habent
grauitates eorum, ade&longs;t tamen vir clari&longs;&longs;imus, qui sen­
tentiam peripateticam &longs;u&longs;tinere conatur.
ait eni&mtail;,

ratum e&longs;&longs;e virtutem grauitatis efficientem cau&longs;am eße de­
&longs;cen&longs;us corporum grauium, & quia impos&longs;ibile e&longs;t vt motus
de&longs;cen&longs;us ab&longs;que aliqua velocitate fiat, igitur eadem graui­
tas, quæ de&longs;cen&longs;um producit, erit quoque cau&longs;a effectiua il­
lius velocitatis, quæ naturali eius de&longs;cen&longs;ui competit, cùm­
que gradus grauitatis non &longs;it vnicus, &longs;ed augeri, & dimi­
nui in infinitum pos&longs;it, igitur est impos&longs;ibile vt gradus gra­
uitatis &longs;ummoperè diuer&longs;i inter &longs;e, & inæquales eumdem
effectum producant, &longs;cilicèt eamdem præcisè velocitatem,
neque videntur negari po&longs;&longs;e prima principia notis&longs;ima, quæ
&longs;uadent omnium virtutum, & facultatum, quæ effectus
aliquos producere po&longs;&longs;unt, illam, quæ maiorem vim habet,
maiorem effectum producere; &longs;ub&longs;equitur po&longs;tea:
I.
II.

Constat experientia ponderis in altera stateræ lance po&longs;i­
ti, illam, quæ ex aduer&longs;o e&longs;t, celeriùs attollere, quàm &longs;i in­
æqualitas minor foret.

aut verum celeriùs circumagi, vbi pon­
dus grauius machinæ illud vertenti appenditur: horologij
quoque cur&longs;um &longs;imili ponderis adiectione citatiorem fieri.
III.

Ait quòd ab experientia non docemur breuitatem vndu­
lationis in pendulo leuiori à &longs;olo medio, non autem à graui-

tatis defectu prouenire, neque &longs;olida huius a&longs;&longs;ertionis ratio
afferri potest.

Cap.
10. de
æquitempo­
ranea natu­
rali veloci­
tate grauium.
IV.

Quia facilius à grauiori corpore vinci pote&longs;t medij re&longs;i&longs;ten­
tia, ait, fore vt celerior ille grauioris corporis de&longs;cen&longs;us à ma­
iori eiu&longs;dem grauitate oriatur.
V.

Tandem Ari&longs;totelis argumentum validi&longs;&longs;imum e&longs;­
&longs;e probat, nam cùm grauitas in certa aliqua proportione
re&longs;istentiam medij &longs;uperet, &longs;equitur proportiones inter gra­
uitatem, & medium ab&longs;que fine multiplicari po&longs;&longs;e, quare &longs;i
&longs;upponatur corpus aliquod per &longs;patium imaginarium in cer­
to velocitatis gradu, impellente grauitate de&longs;cendere, pote­
rit vtique dari corpus, cui talis &longs;it re&longs;pectu medij realis pro­
portio, vt pari illud velocitate tran&longs;currat: infinita tamen
erit di&longs;tantia inter re&longs;istentiam medij realis huic corpori col­
lati, & re&longs;i&longs;tentiam &longs;patij imaginarij comparati cum al­
tero, quod ille æquali in eo velocitate moueri &longs;upponitur.

Id
verò ab&longs;urdis&longs;imum e&longs;&longs;e quilibet &longs;tatim pronunciabit.
VI.

Ver&longs;a igitur argumenti formula: quia re&longs;i&longs;tentia medij
grauitatem non nihil retardat celeriù&longs;que fertur graue vbi
minùs illi re&longs;istitur, cùm nulla &longs;it inter medium (plenu&mtail;
&longs;upple) &longs;patiumque vacuum proportio, &longs;equetur nece&longs;&longs;a­
riò neque vllam fore inter tempus in quo corpus graue de­
terminatam medij quantitatem emetitur; & tempus in
quo tantumdem &longs;patij vacui tran&longs;currit, quare &longs;patium il­
lud vacuum in momento conficiet.

Re&longs;ponde­
tur primæ
difficultati
ex &longs;uperiùs
adductis.

Ad primam ergo difficultatem re&longs;pondeo breui­
tèr verum non e&longs;&longs;e quod effectus maioris velocitatis
dependeat tamquàm à cau&longs;a efficiente à virtute ma­
ioris grauitatis in ip&longs;o actu de&longs;cen&longs;us.

Quia vt o&longs;ten-
dimus prop.
20. 21. & 204. partes æquales eiu&longs;dem
grauis ex &longs;ui natura eadem velocitate fluere deorsùm
debent, & deò &longs;uperior pari velocitate comprime­
re nitetur inferiorem, qua hæc ictum fugit, & proin­
de grauitas &longs;uperioris non augebit vim compre&longs;&longs;iuam,
&longs;eu grauitatem inferioris; perindè ergò operatur pon­
dus vnius partis ac &longs;r æquale e&longs;&longs;et ponderi aggregati
omnium partium.

ex quo fit vt in motu de&longs;cen&longs;us
quælibet corpora inæqualia æquè grauia cen&longs;eri po&longs;­
&longs;int; ideoque non de&longs;cendent in æqualibus veloci­
tatibus, neque nouum e&longs;t vim, & energiam decem
hominum &longs;u&longs;tinere po&longs;&longs;e maius pondus nempè decu­
plum, quàm vnus eorum, &longs;ed non indè &longs;equitur, quod
prædicti homines currere po&longs;&longs;int baiulando eade&mtail;
pondera velocitate decies maiori, quam vnus eorum
tantùm, itaque licèt velocitas cur&longs;us dependeat à vi,
& energia prædictorum hominum, non proindè ve­
locitas augetur multiplicaturque prout homines præ­
dicti multiplicantur.

Vnde patet infirmitas primæ
obiectionis.

Re&longs;pondetur
&longs;ecundæ.

Ad &longs;ecundam noto, nos quærere an duo corpor&atail;
grauia dum naturali, libero, & non impedito motu
feruntur inæqualibus velocitatibus de&longs;cendant, &longs;ci­
licèt in eadem proportione, quam grauitates habent.

ergo prauè, & contra logices præcepta aduer&longs;arius
permutat &longs;ubiectum problematis, cùm nempè a&longs;&longs;umit
non duo mobilia grauia, &longs;ed vnum, & in eo quærit
motus partium in &longs;uo toto, quæ nequeunt libero, &
non impedito motu de&longs;cendere ni&longs;i ex parte.
talis

In ijs planè concedimus pondera
inæqualia diuer&longs;imodè operari ob libræ naturam, quam
non videtur prædictus author benè percepi&longs;&longs;e.

Opor­
tet ergo vt &longs;umamus duos globos ferreos inæquales
&longs;olutos, &longs;eparato&longs;que qui in aere demittantur, vt li­
berè, & ab&longs;que impedimento de&longs;cendere po&longs;&longs;int per
rectas lineas ad centrum terræ tendentes, cùmque in
hac experientia velocitates de&longs;cen&longs;uum ferè æquales
&longs;int licèt pondera de&longs;cendentia &longs;int valdè inter &longs;&etail;
inæqualia, facilè &longs;uademur quod ab aliqua circum­
&longs;tantia in bilancibus, rotis, & veru impeditur, & per­
turbatur effectus ille, qui in &longs;implici&longs;&longs;ima operatio­
ne ob&longs;eruabatur, quod fu&longs;iùs in &longs;equenti capite de­
clarabitur.

10. de
æquitempo­

Re&longs;ponde­
tur tereiæ.

Ad tertiam nego Galileum deduxi&longs;&longs;e grauia inæ­
qualia de&longs;cendere velocitatibus æqualibus debere
ex hac experientia, quod funependula æquè longa,
& inæqualiter pondero&longs;a efficiunt vndulationes æ­
quitemporaneas; non enim ex hac operatione, quæ
difficilioris indaginis e&longs;t, &longs;ed ex libero de&longs;cen&longs;u duo­
rum inæqualium ponderum fal&longs;itatem peripatetici
pronunciati euidenti&longs;&longs;imè comprobauit.

Sed interim
aio, quod retardatio vibrationis leuioris funependu­
li producitur ab impedimento, & ob&longs;taculo aeris,
non autem à defectu ponderis eius.

Si enim &longs;u&longs;pen­
dantur ex filis æquè longis duæ pilæ vna plumbea,
altera verò lignea quarum quælibet vnam vncia&mtail;
pendat tunc &longs;i æquè à perpendiculo remoueantur, ef­
ficient vibrationes æquitemporaneas, at continen­
tèr vndulationes ligneæ pilæ breuiores fiunt, dù&mtail;
breuiora &longs;patia hinc inde, & diminuta percurriit, hìc
verò con&longs;tat tarditatem ligni non à defectu ponderis, cum
vnius quoque vnciæ &longs;it, &longs;ed ab amplitudine molis e­
ius, quatenùs &longs;ua dilatata &longs;uperficie cogitur expelle­
re ampliorem aeris molem è &longs;uo loco, quem euidenti&longs;­
&longs;imum e&longs;t re&longs;i&longs;tere expul&longs;ioni, vt flabello, & alijs in­
numeris modis experimur.

Sed præterea &longs;uademur,
quod non à pondere aucto celeritas eius motus in flui­
do augetur; &longs;i enim &longs;upponamus ingens nauigiu&mtail;
æquè velocitèr per maris &longs;uperficiem excurrere, ac
linter, manife&longs;tum e&longs;t ea nullam grauitatem exercere
tran&longs;uer&longs;aliter dum in aqua innatant.

adueniat po&longs;tea
impedimentum externum, v. g. plures homines &longs;uis
viribus conentur impedire, & firmare cur&longs;um prædi­
ctorum inæqualium nauigiorum, procùl dubio ener­
gia vnius hominis tantùm &longs;i&longs;tere, & ob firmare pote­
rit lintrem, cùm è contrà nauis illa ingens æquè velox,
ac nauicula non po&longs;&longs;it impediri, neque velocitas eius
omninò extingui ab ingenti conatu, & repul&longs;u centum
hominum: cau&longs;a huius diuer&longs;iratis o&longs;ten&longs;a fuit in no­
&longs;tro opere de vi percu&longs;s.

pendetque ab energia vir­
tutis motiuæ expan&longs;æ per vniuer&longs;am molem nauigij
prægrandis, quæ tam multiplex e&longs;t virtutis motiuæ
nauiculæ, quantò illius moles &longs;uperat huius molem,
& ideò vis percu&longs;&longs;iua à maiori vi motiua pendens mul­
tò maior e&longs;&longs;e debet, quàm illa, quæ à minori virtute
motiua producitur; nec mirum e&longs;t ad extinguendam
maiorem vim motiuam exigi validiorem vim re&longs;i&longs;ten­
tem; hinc fit vt virtus vnius hominis impedire, &
extinguere po&longs;&longs;it vim pu&longs;illam lintrem mouente&mtail;,
non verò va&longs;tam vim motiuam nauigij eodem prorsùs
modò in pendulis pila lignea, aut minoris ponderis,
licèt æquè velocitèr moueatur, ac pila grauis plum­
bear iila tamen à minori vi motiua transfertur, cui
aeris inertia, & corpulentia pote&longs;t eius impetum de­
bilitare, & extinguere, &longs;ed non pote&longs;t æquali re&longs;i­
&longs;tentia impedire energiam maioris virtutis motiuæ
grauioris pilæ plumbeæ.

10. de
æquitempo­
ranea natu­
rali veloci­
tate grauium.

Ad quartam re&longs;ponderi pote&longs;t, fal&longs;um e&longs;&longs;e à maio­
ri grauitate meliùs, & faciliùs vinci, & &longs;uperari me­
dij fluidi r &longs;i&longs;tentiam.

nam duo funependula æqua­
lia, & inæqualitèr grauia dum o&longs;cillationes &longs;uas confi­
ciunt nullam prorsùs grauitatem exercent perindè,
ac &longs;i grauia non e&longs;&longs;ent, propterea quod æquilibran­
tur à tenacitatibus funiculorum clauibus affixorum.

Similitèr libræ ferreæ horologiorum dum conuertun­
tur horizontalitèr grauitate carent, &longs;eù eam non e­
xercent, &longs;ic quoque inæqualia nauigia innatanti&atail;
dum horizontalitèr mouentur non agunt grauitate,
quæ ab aqua æquilibratur, & tandem pilæ plumbeæ,
& ligneæ &longs;ursùm perpendicularitèr proiectæ dum oc­
currunt, & percutiunt &longs;upremum fluidum, vel corpo-
ra &longs;u&longs;pen&longs;a, planè non agunt grauitate, quæ non &longs;ur­
sùm, &longs;ed deorsùm operari, & impellere valet; et ta­
men in ijs omnibus, quæ den&longs;iora &longs;unt, aut copio&longs;io­
ri &longs;ub&longs;tantia materiali donantur magis, & faciliùs
medij fluidi, & ob&longs;taculorum impedimenta &longs;uperant.

Non igitur à grauitate, quatenùs talis e&longs;t medij flui­
di re&longs;i&longs;tentia &longs;uperatur, &longs;ed ab alia cau&longs;alongè diuer&longs;a.

Cap.
10. de
æquitempo­
ranea natu­
rali veloci­
tate grauium.

Sed ponamus à maiori vi motiua grauiorum cor­
porum magis, & faciliùs medij fluidi re&longs;i&longs;tentiam &longs;u­
perari, non indè &longs;equetur, magis grauia celeriore&mtail;
motum de&longs;cen&longs;us producere ni&longs;i ex accidenti, nam &longs;i
reuera efficiens cau&longs;a velocitatis e&longs;&longs;et grauitas, ne­
ce&longs;&longs;ariò effectus velocitatum proportionales e&longs;&longs;ent
&longs;uis cau&longs;is, &longs;cilicèt grauitatibus, vti Aduer&longs;arius cum
Ari&longs;totele &longs;u&longs;tinere tenetur.

hoc autem fal&longs;um e&longs;&longs;&etail;
manife&longs;tum e&longs;t; nam duæ pilæ æquales vna aurea, al­
tera marmorea, quæ in fluidis cra&longs;&longs;ioribus feruntur
velocitatibus notabili exce&longs;&longs;u inter &longs;e differentibus,
in aere po&longs;tea æquè veloces e&longs;&longs;e videntur.

igitur illa
in&longs;ignis differentia velocitatum ab impedimento me­
dij fluidi cra&longs;&longs;ioris dependet non ab inæqualibus gra­
uitatibus, quæ æquè veloces in aere e&longs;&longs;e videntur.

Sed pro clariori huius rei euidentia &longs;upponamus
validum equum æquali velocitate currere, ac canis a­
liquis venaticus, &longs;ubmergantur po&longs;tea omninò am­
bo infra aquam, vel infra lutum, procùl dubio maior
vis, & robur equi minùs impediri poterit à den&longs;itate
aquæ, vel luti, quàm canis exigua vis impediatur,
& propterea equus demer&longs;us velociùs agitari, moue-
ri, & currere poterit; quàm canis; licèt ergo medium
luto&longs;um debilem canem magis impediat, quàm robu­
&longs;tum equum, non tamen licet inferre quòd maior vis
motiua equi celeriorem motum producat in aere ab­
lato impedimento luti, quàm canis, cùm æquè velo­
ces &longs;upponantur.

Cap.
10. de
æquitempo­
ranea natu­
rali veloci­
tate grauium.

Demùm notari debet quàm diuer&longs;a &longs;it con&longs;titutio
duorum corporum grauium in æqualium in medio flui­
do magis, aut minùs den&longs;o, & impediente quàm in
&longs;patio prorsùs inani; namibi vt dictum e&longs;t, graue vnà
cum medio fluido in quo immergitur, libram, quam­
dam, &longs;eù &longs;iphonem con&longs;tituit, & ideò prout efficitur
æquilibrium, vel mobile &longs;uperat, vel deficit, à gra­
uitate fluidi ambientis effici pote&longs;t quies, aut a&longs;cen­
&longs;us, vel de&longs;cen&longs;us; at in medio prorsùs inani vbi im­
pedimentum æquilibrij prorsùs tollitur non poterit
vlla ratione vnica illa naturalis velocitas corporis
mobilis alterari, retardarique.

Ad quintum argumentum nego primo loco repe­
riri vllum corpus po&longs;&longs;e quod in aliquo medio fluido
pleno, licèt tenui&longs;&longs;imo, & rari&longs;&longs;imo po&longs;&longs;it tanta velo­
citate moueri, quanta e&longs;t illa, quam aliud corpus in
vacuo habere po&longs;&longs;et; nam vniuersè omnia corpor&atail;
terrena æquè velocia &longs;unt in &longs;patio inani ablatis om­
nibus impedimentis, vt mox o&longs;tendemus, igitur quod­
libet eorum in medio pleno con&longs;titutum tardiori mo­
tu de&longs;cendet, quàm quodlibet aliud in medio inani,
tantum præcisè, quantum medium prædictum fluidum
&longs;ua den&longs;itate impedit eius naturalem motum, ergò
non poterit reperiri aliud corpus quod in vacuo æ­
quali tarditate feratur, ac illud in pleno excurrebat;
neque hoc incredibile alicui videri pote&longs;t, ni&longs;i ijs, qui
à fal&longs;a per&longs;ua&longs;ione præoccupati cen&longs;ent corpora in&etail;­
qualia in vacuo inæqualibus velocitatibus moueri
debere, quod fal&longs;um e&longs;&longs;e demon&longs;trabitur.

Quintum re­
&longs;pondetur.

Cap.
10. de
æquitempo­
ranea natu­
rali veloci­
tate grauium.

Ad &longs;extum, &longs;imilitèr aduer&longs;arij hallucinatio pendet
ex fal&longs;a &longs;uppo&longs;itione, quòd velocitates eiu&longs;dem mo­
bilis habeant proportionem contrario re&longs;pondentem
re&longs;i&longs;tentijs mediorum fluidorum, verum e&longs;t maiorem
medij re&longs;i&longs;tentiam magis velocitatem eiu&longs;dem gra­
uis retardare, &longs;ed non tamen proportionalitèr hu­
iu&longs;modi retardatio efficitur, vt &longs;upra demon&longs;traui­
mus; & hìc mirari licet, quòd aduer&longs;arius neglect&atail;
Galilei demon&longs;tratione tantummodò affert nouas
difficultates, qui tamen tenebatur demon&longs;trationem
adductam redarguere, & eius paralogi&longs;mum indica­
re, quod non præ&longs;titit.

Sexto argu­
mento re­
&longs;pondetur.

Ad argumentum verò dico quòd &longs;upponendo ple­
num den&longs;ius magis velocitatem mobilis retardar&etail;,
quàm plenum rarum, pariterque po&longs;ito, plenum ad
vacuum nullam proportionem habere, non indè &longs;e­
quitur velocitatem, quam &longs;axum in vacuo exercet,
e&longs;&longs;e infinitè maiorem illo impetu, quo in aqua moue­
retur, neque hanc velocitatem e&longs;&longs;e illa infinitè tar­
diorem, po&longs;&longs;et enim habere proportionem finitam,
propterea quod di&longs;tantia inter re&longs;i&longs;tentiam pleni, &
nullam vacui re&longs;i&longs;tentiam non e&longs;t quid infinitum, &longs;ed
men&longs;uratur ab entitate finita pleni re&longs;i&longs;tentis, qu&atail;
&longs;upra nihilum, &longs;eù &longs;upra vacuum eminet, eodem modo,
ac id, quod linea palmaris nihilum &longs;uperat, vel &longs;upra
id eminet, nil aliud planè e&longs;t, quàm entitas finit&atail;
eiu&longs;dem lineæ palmaris.

Cap.
10. de
æquitempo­
ranea natu­
rali veloci­
tate grauium.
PROP. CCV.

Hoc po&longs;ito ostendemus velocitatem cuiuslibet corporis gra­
uis in vacuo e&longs;&longs;e finitam, & in tempore ab&longs;olui.

SI enim fieri pote&longs;t mobile A in vacuo infinit&atail;
velocitate BC moueatur, & quia non alia de cau­
&longs;a in aere corpus A tardiùs mouetur,
ni&longs;i quia aer pro men&longs;ura eius den&longs;i­
tatis impedit, & retardat eam velo­
citatem, quam aptum natum e&longs;t exer­
cere idem corpus A, remotis omnibus
impedimentis; e&longs;tque aeris den&longs;itas
finita, ideoque re&longs;i&longs;tentia, & retar­
datio erit quid finitum; &longs;it illa BE,
ergo ab ab&longs;oluta, & totali velocita­
te BC ablata retardatione BE rema­
nebit velocitas EC, qua per aerem mouebitur corpus
prædictum; &longs;ed ab infinita velocitate BC ablata fini­
ta velocitate retardationis BE, remanebit adhùc infi­
nita velocitas EC, quare corpus A in aere mouebitur
infinita velocitate EC, quod e&longs;t ab&longs;urdum, con&longs;tat
enim per aerem velocitate finita, & temporanea mo­
ueri: qua propter in vacuo non mouebitur infinit&atail;,
&longs;eù in&longs;tantanea velocitate, quod fuerat o&longs;tendendum.

Cap.
10. de
æquitempo­
ranea natu­
rali veloci­
tate grauium.
PROP. CCVI.
Idem aliter confirmatur.

ET profectò cùm hìc non agatur de vacuo, & ple­
no, quatenùs vacuum, & plenum &longs;unt, &longs;ed qua­
tenùs motum impediunt; propterea re&longs;pectus, &longs;eù
proportio inter plenum, & vacuum con&longs;ideratur in
ordine ad impedimentum, quatenùs priuatio, & ca­
rentia impedimenti ip&longs;ius vacui nullam proportionem
habet ad verum, & reale impedimentum à medio ple­
no productum, &longs;icuti inter nihilum, & ens nulla da­
tur proportio.

Videamus modò an velocitas eiu&longs;dem mobilis tan­
topere variati debeat in vacuo, & in pleno, vt re&longs;ul­
tantes velocitates debeant infinitè inter &longs;e di&longs;tare, ac
differre, quem ad modum carentia impedimenti, &longs;eù
nihilum ad impedimentum ip&longs;um reale nullam pro­
portionem habet.

Et procùl dubio quoad carentiam,
& priuationem impedimenti pertinet, perindè e&longs;t &longs;i
mobile in vacuo feratur, ac &longs;i in aliquo fluido, quod
eius motum nil prorsùs impediat, nec retardet, & ve­
locitatem eius non imminuat præcisè, vt vacuum nil
ei ob&longs;i&longs;tit; hoc autem præ&longs;tat aer ip&longs;e motus, & à ven­
to agitatus ad ea&longs;dem partes, versùs quas mobile fer­
tur, qui præterea tanta velocitate ad ea&longs;dem partes
fugiat, quanta ab ip&longs;o mobile per&longs;equitur.

tunc qui­
dem, vt dictum e&longs;t, nil prorsùs ab aere fluente, &longs;eù
vento illo &longs;ecundo impeditur, vel retardatur fluxus
prædicti mobilis, & perindè &longs;e habet, ac &longs;i in vacuo
moueretur.

Cap.
10. de
æquitempo­
ranea natu­
rali veloci­
tate grauium.

Modò quia impedimentum reale, quod infert aer
quie&longs;cens &longs;ua den&longs;itate motui eiu&longs;dem corporis ad
nullum, &longs;eù ad priuationem impedimenti aeris fluen­
tis, &longs;eu venti &longs;ecundi, (qui in diminutam eius veloci­
tatem non minùs, ac vacuum excurrere &longs;init) habebit
eamdem proportionem infinitam, &longs;eù eumdem defe­
ctum proportionis, quam habet plenum ad vacuu&mtail;
(ex a&longs;&longs;umpto Peripatetico) ergo velocitas finita, &
temporanea eiu&longs;dem mobilis in aere quie&longs;cent&etail;
nullam quoque proportionem habebit ad velocitatem
eius in aere à vento &longs;ecundo agitato, ideoque in ip­
&longs;o infinita, & in&longs;tantanea velocitate moueretur, quod
e&longs;t fal&longs;um, & contra experientiam.

Hinc &longs;equitur,
quòd idem mobile quod in aere &longs;tagnante quatuor
gradibus velocitatis ferebatur, in vacuo po&longs;tea vbi
nullum impedimentum ade&longs;t non mouebitur infinitè
velociùs, & in in&longs;tanti.

Et ratio e&longs;t, quia impedimentum
medij fluidi retardans mobilis velocitatem non ha­
bet infinitam energiam, &longs;ed e&longs;t certi, ae finiti roboris,
& ideo infinitatem impetus, quam in vacuo exercere
deberet minimè de&longs;truere po&longs;&longs;et, nam eadem vis, &
energia infinita requiritur, vt quantitas finita in in­
finitum extendatur, ac è contrà requiritur vt line&atail;
verè infinita adeò decurtetur, vt exten&longs;ionem finitam
acquirat; in vtroque enim ca&longs;u tran&longs;itus, & intercape­
do infinita e&longs;t, & propterea exigit infinitam virtutem.

Præterea eadem infinita inter capedo, & carentia
proportionis reperitur inter totale motus impedi­
mentum, &longs;cilicèt inter quietem quam affert aqua de­
&longs;cen&longs;ui ligni, & impedimentum quod eidem affert
aer quie&longs;cens, in quo aliquo gradu velocitatis mo­
uetur; quia verò quam proportionem habent velo­
citates ex aduer&longs;ario, eamdem reciprocè habere de­
bent den&longs;itates mediorum fluidorum; di&longs;tat verò in­
finitè quies à motu, igitur infinitè quoque di&longs;tar&etail;
deberent inter &longs;e, reciprocè den&longs;itates fluidorum, &
proindè aqua infinitè den&longs;ior aere e&longs;&longs;et, &longs;ic enim nul­
lam proportionem eorum den&longs;itates haberent, quod
e&longs;t omninò ab&longs;urdum; ex quibus omnibus deducitur
fal&longs;um e&longs;&longs;e aduer&longs;arij ratiocinium.

Cap.
10. de
æquitempo­
ranea natu­
rali veloci­
tate grauium.

Po&longs;tquam o&longs;tendimus naturalia corpora in vacuo
moueri, non in in&longs;tanti, &longs;ed in tempore debere, &
præterea corpora inæqualitèr grauia non moueri &longs;e­
cundum proportionem, quam habent eorum graui­
tates, debemus po&longs;tremo loco o&longs;tendere, quod &longs;i om­
nia impedimenta, quæ dependent à medio fluido in
motionibus corporum grauium tolli po&longs;&longs;ent, quod in
&longs;patio inani verificari po&longs;&longs;et, tunc planè omnia cor­
pora inæqualitèr grauia &longs;pecie, & mole, quibu&longs;cum­
que figuris prædita, eodem tempore per idem &longs;patium
de&longs;cendere deberent.

Hanc | ad mirabilem propo&longs;itio­
nem Galileus omnium primus protulit dialogo pri­
mo de motu locali, & in &longs;uis po&longs;tillis non dum typis
excu&longs;is, eam tamen non demon&longs;trauit, &longs;ed coniectu­
ris, & probabilibus tantummodò rationibus confir­
mare conatus e&longs;t; quia verò huiu&longs;modi propo&longs;itio v-
&longs;um habet in hac phy&longs;ices parte, quam præ manibus
habemus; propterea operæpretium duxi firmis de­
mon&longs;trationibus eam confirmare; vt autem hoc cla­
rè, & per&longs;picuè o&longs;tendi po&longs;&longs;it, præmitti, & memorari
debent aliqua principia lumine naturæ nota, quorum
primum erit.

qua princi­

alibi o&longs;ten&longs;a.

Cuilibet corpori graui tributum, ac a&longs;&longs;ignatu&mtail;
fui&longs;&longs;e ab ip&longs;a natura gradum, & periodum determinatum,
præfixum, ac inuariabilem velocitatis, quo de&longs;cendere
deorsum valeat, quia nimirùm principia, & cau&longs;æ mo­
tuum naturalium in ij&longs;dem corporibus eædem omninò &longs;unt,

quæ &longs;uos effectus producere valent, qui non erunt
vagi, & indeterminati cum natura certa nece&longs;&longs;itate
operetur, ergo fieri non pote&longs;t, vt idem corpus ex
&longs;ui natura, ablatis omnibus externis impedimentis,
po&longs;&longs;it modò celeriùs, modò tardiùs, ab&longs;que vlla regu­

&longs;emper con&longs;tanti, ac inuariabili progre&longs;&longs;u vniformi­
ter accelerato migrabit.
I.
II.

Motus eiu&longs;dem corporis grauis à con&longs;i&longs;tentia me­
dij fluidi impeditur, & retardatur prout re&longs;i&longs;tenti&atail;
maior, vel minor fuerit, contingit tamen ex acciden­
ti, vt figura varia eiu&longs;dem corporis grauis maius, aut
minus impedimentum patiatur ab eodem fluido.

con­
&longs;tat enim experientia, quod aer, & aqua magis ob&longs;i­
&longs;tunt, impediuntque tran&longs;itum figuræ dilatatæ alicu­
ius laminæ, minùs verò refragantur migrationi cor­
poris acuminati.

propterea quòd vis motiua eius naturalis nullam me­
dij re&longs;i&longs;tentiam &longs;uperare debet, &longs;cilicèt neque medij
fluidi quie&longs;centis ibi non exi&longs;tentis, inertiam, aut
grauitatem, contiguitatem, aut glutem &longs;uperare de­
bet, &longs;cilicèt quando nihil ei ob&longs;i&longs;tit, nec eius impetum,
aut progre&longs;&longs;um impedire, & retardare pote&longs;t.
III.
IV.

E contrà figura obtu&longs;a, & ampla eiu&longs;dem corpo­
ris grauis nihil nocet, nec planè retardare pote&longs;t mo­
tum eiu&longs;dem corporis grauis in vacuo, quia nimirum
nihil ei re&longs;i&longs;tit, neque enim inertiam medij fluidi quie­
&longs;centis ibi non exi&longs;tentis &longs;uperare debet, id è &longs;uo lo­
co expellendo, neque eius grauitatem, contiguitatem,
aut gluten &longs;ua vi motiua vincere debet.
V.

Cùm velocitates grauium cadentium non &longs;int æqua­
biles, &longs;ed vniformiter acceleratæ, ideò quando com­
parantur inter &longs;e gradus velocitatum duorum corpo­
rum de&longs;cendentium, intelligi &longs;emper debent gradus
initiales, &longs;cilicèt illi, qui ab eodem termino quietis
temporibus æqualibus exercentur, & vniformi pro­
gre&longs;&longs;u cre&longs;cunt.

His præmi&longs;&longs;is demon&longs;trari po&longs;&longs;unt &longs;equentes pro­
po&longs;itiones.

PROP. CCIX.

Duo corpora heterogenea æquè grauia comprehen&longs;a ab æqua­
libus perimetris figurarum &longs;imilium, & æqualium; in eo­
dem medio fluido æquè velocitèr de&longs;cendent &longs;i in ip&longs;o mo­
tu &longs;imilitèr di&longs;po&longs;it a fuerint; idemque in vacuo continget.

SInt duo corpora heterogenea A, & B, æquè gra­
uia, comprehendanturque ambo ab æqualibus
&longs;uperficiebus &longs;phæricis, vt nimirum pila A &longs;it lignea,
& plena, altera verò B &longs;it phiala vitrea, cuius pars
extima CD &longs;olida &longs;it, comprehen&longs;a à duabus &longs;phæricis
figuris, pars verò inte&longs;tina B &longs;it excauata, & ab aere
repleta, dico, quod hæc duo corpora in eodem me­
dio fluido aereo v.g. æquali velocitate de&longs;cendent.

Quoniam, vt dictum e&longs;t cap.
2. huius operis, cor-
pus quod in fluido mouetur libram, vel &longs;iphonem con­
&longs;tituit cum ambiente fluido,
cuius moles æqualis &longs;it &longs;o­
lido demer&longs;o; igitur &longs;phæ­
ra lignea A, & vitrum ca­
uum B con&longs;tituunt æquales
libras in eodem fluido, prop­
terea quod eorum moles æquales &longs;unt, & ab æquali­
bus, & &longs;imilibus &longs;phæricis figuris comprehenduntur;
e&longs;t que exce&longs;&longs;us ponderis ligni A &longs;upra pondus fluidi
ambientis æqualis exce&longs;&longs;ui ponderis vitreæ phialæ
B &longs;upra pondus eiu&longs;dem ambientis fluidi, cuius mo­
les &longs;ibi ip&longs;i æqualis e&longs;t, igitur eodem exce&longs;&longs;u pondus
ligni A, atque vitri B &longs;uperant pondus ambientis flui­
di eiu&longs;dem molis, & proindè duo corpora A, & B,
æquè ponderantia in eodem fluido in quo feruntur,
&longs;unt; &longs;ed virtutes motiuæ quibus corpora A, & B de­
orsùm feruntur, nil aliud e&longs;&longs;e cen&longs;entur ab aduer&longs;a­
rijs quàm energiæ ponderum eorum.

motus deorsùm, porrò motus concipi non pote&longs;t,

au­

Videamus modò an figuræ varie­

Qua­

idem o&longs;tendetur.

Quoniam corpora homogenea, &
æqualia, &longs;ed diuer&longs;imodè figurata continent parti­

que accelerare, & proinde aggregata ip&longs;a vnà, & ca­

PROP. CCXI.

Si duo corpora æquè grauia ab&longs;olutè moles inæquales habue­
rint, in vacuo æquè velocitèr de&longs;cendent.

SInt duo corpora A, & B æquè grauia ab&longs;olutè, &
moles ip&longs;ius B maior &longs;it mole alterius A, &longs;cili­
cèt &longs;it ma&longs;&longs;a plumbea A vnius libræ, B verò &longs;it lignea
eiu&longs;dem ponderis, & proindè moles B maior erit, quam
A; dico, quod huiu&longs;modi corpora A, & B in vacuo ea­
dem velocitate de&longs;cendent.

Sumatur moles corpo­
rea E, quæ æquè grauis, & homogenea &longs;it ip&longs;i A, &longs;cili­
cèt &longs;it quoque plumbea, & ex ea fiat figura vnifor-
miter excauata, itaut externa eius &longs;uperficies &longs;it om­
ninò &longs;imilis, & æqualis figuræ externæ ip&longs;ius B; quo­
niam &longs;ub&longs;tantia corporea ple­
na ip&longs;ius E nedùm homogenea,
&longs;ed prorsùs æqualis e&longs;t ip&longs;i A,
&longs;cilicèt vniùs libræ, erunt duo
corpora A, & E æqualia inter
&longs;e, & æquè grauia, licèt diuer­
&longs;as, & inæquales figuras habe­
ant, igitur A, & E in vacuo æ­
quali velocitate de&longs;cendent.

po&longs;tea quia duorum corporum B, & E pondera ab&longs;o­
luta æquantur ponderi eiu&longs;dem A, igitur illa æqua­
lia sunt inter &longs;e grauitate ab&longs;oluta, & à &longs;imilibus, &etail;qua­
libus, & &longs;imiliter po&longs;itis figuris comprehenduntur, er­
go æqualibus velocitatibus, cum in pleno fluido, tum
in vacuo de&longs;cendent.

quare A, & B æquè velocia ip&longs;i
E erunt, & ideò inter&longs;e.

PROP. CCXII.

Quælibet duo corpora inæqualitèr grauia in vacuo æquè
velocitèr de&longs;cendent.

SInt duo corpora A, & B quorum A grauius &longs;it, quam
B; moles verò ip&longs;ius A ponatur, vel maior, aut
æqualis, vel minor mole alterius B, &longs;cilicèt &longs;int præ­
dicta corpora eiu&longs;dem grauitatis &longs;pecificæ, vel non,
dummodò eorum pondera ab&longs;oluta inæqualia &longs;int.
Dico in vacuo æquè velocia e&longs;&longs;e.

Si hoc verum no&ntail;
e&longs;t, de&longs;cendet grauius corpus A celeriùs, vel tardiùs,
quam B; & primò &longs;i fieri pote&longs;t moueatur grauius cor­
pus A in vacuo maiori celerita­
te, quàm B, &longs;cilicèt eodem tem­
pore G pertran&longs;eat graue A ma­
ius &longs;patium CD corpus verò B,
minùs ponderans, percurrat &longs;pa­
tium CE minùs, quàm CD, con­
cipiantur po&longs;tea duo corpora A,
& B &longs;imul colligata, aut coniun­
cta, vt nimirum vnum &longs;ine altero
moueri nequeat, & &longs;ic connex&atail;
percurrant eodem tempore G &longs;pa­
tium CF. quoniam tùm corpus A cùm B habent gra­
dus certos, ac determinatos velocitatum &longs;ibi à natu­
ra a&longs;&longs;ignatos, qui per &longs;e omninò inuariabiles &longs;unt, ni&longs;i
ab aliqua externa cau&longs;a &longs;uperueniente alterentur, &
ex hypothe&longs;i gradus naturalis velocitatis ip&longs;ius A
maior e&longs;t ea, quæ competit ip&longs;i B; igitur validior, &
vehementior gradus velocitatis ip&longs;ius A promouebit
vrgebitque tardigradum mobile B, quod proindè co­
gatur celeriùs excurrere, quàm per &longs;e, & ab&longs;que illa
violentia latum fui&longs;&longs;et.

E contra corpus tardius B re­
moram afferet velociori corpori A, quod proindè tar­
diùs in prædicto tempore mouebitur; quaproptèr
duo grauia A, & B &longs;imul connexa, &longs;cilicèt amborum
aggregatum percurret de&longs;cendendo eodem tempore
G &longs;patium CF, minus quidem, quàm CD, &longs;ed maius,
quàm CE, e&longs;tque aggregatum ex A, & B grauius, quam
corpus A &longs;olitarium, igitur grauius corpus nem pè ag­
gregatum ex A, & B percurret eodem tempore G &longs;pa­
tium CF minus quidem, quàm CD tran&longs;actum à &longs;oli­
tario corpore A minùs graui, quod repugnat hypo­
the&longs;i; grauius enim in vacuo de&longs;cendere debuerat
velociori motu, quàm minùs graue.

Non ergo fieri
pote&longs;t vt corpus grauius in vacuo celeriùs, quàm mi­
nùs graue feratur.

Secundo loco &longs;it grauius corpus A, &longs;i fieri pote&longs;t,
minùs velox, quàm B, &longs;cilicèt A percurrat minus &longs;pa­
tium CE, &longs;ed B maius &longs;patium CD eodem tempore G;
& &longs;i cutiant ea dictum e&longs;t, duo corpora A, & B &longs;imùl
connexa velociora erunt pigriore corpore A, & ideò
corpus grauius, &longs;cilicèt aggregatum ex A, & B velo­
ciùs de&longs;cendet, quàm minùs graue A, quod rursùs hy­
pothe &longs;i repugnat, non igitur e&longs;t po&longs;&longs;ibile vt corpus
magis pondero&longs;um in vacuo citiùs, aut tardiùs de&longs;cen­
dat, quàm minus graue; quare nece&longs;sè e&longs;t, vt ambo
æquali velocitate in vacuo ferantur, quod fuerat de­
mon&longs;trandum.
Ibidem.
PROP. CCXIII.
Idip&longs;um aliter demon&longs;trabitur.

SIt corpus BC grauius, quàm A; dico in vacuo ea­
dem velocitate ambo de&longs;cen&longs;ura.

Re&longs;ecetur ex
pondero&longs;iori BC portio aliqua B æquè ponderans, ac
A, igitur licèt æquiponderantia corpora B, & A inæ­
quales moles habebant &etail;què velocia erunt in vacuo;
præterea quia vniuer&longs;um corpus BC, eiu&longs;que portio
B &longs;unt &longs;imilia, & eiu&longs;dem grauitatis &longs;pecificæ, & &longs;o­
lummodò moles inæquales habent,
&longs;cilicèt eorum ab&longs;oluta pondera in­
æqualia &longs;unt, igitur ablatis om­
nibus impedimentis, &longs;cilicèt i&ntail;
vacuo, eadem velocitate de&longs;cen­
det integrum corpus BC atque eius
portio B: o&longs;ten&longs;a autem priùs fuere
duo corpora A, & B in vacuo æquè velocia, igitur cor­
pus BC, atque A, erunt quoque in vacuo æquè velo­
cia, quod erat demon&longs;trandum.

Ex hi&longs;ce propo&longs;itionibus deducitur, quod omni&atail;
corpora grauia, quomodocumque inter &longs;e differant
pondere, magnitudine, & figura, apta nata &longs;unt ex
&longs;ui natura deorsùm de&longs;cendere pari velocitate, & hoc
procùl dnbio contingeret, quando nil prorsùs à me­
dio fluido impedirentur, quod &longs;olummodò verifica­
ri po&longs;&longs;etin &longs;patio prorsùs inani, vbi &longs;i fe&longs;tuca, vel
pluma, & ingens ma&longs;&longs;a ferrea ab eodem termino de­
&longs;cen&longs;um inchoarent, &longs;emper pari pa&longs;&longs;u, & æquabili
motu excurrerent, neque aliquando ferrum fe&longs;tucam
anticiparet.

Propo&longs;itio profectò admirabilis, quæ
paradoxum cen&longs;eri potuerat cùm primùm à Galileo
coniecturalibus tantummodò rationibus prolata fuit,
quæ modò cum euidentia geometrica demon&longs;trat&atail;
fuerit, nullam an&longs;am dubitandi relinquit.

Qua ratione motus grauium à medijs fluidis plenis inæqua­
litèr veloces reddantur.
CAP. XI.

PO&longs;tquam o&longs;ten&longs;um e&longs;t corpora omnia grauia ex
&longs;ui natura æquè velocia e&longs;&longs;e, re&longs;tat modò vt in­
quiramus quomodò, & quare grauia, quæ in medijs
fluidis mouentur, habent velocitates inæquales; hanc
phy&longs;ices, & mechanices partem hactenus de&longs;ideratam
pro viribus &longs;upplere tentabimus.
PROP. CCXIV.

Fluida homogenoa è fistulis æquè latis, & perpendiculari­
tèr erectis ad horizontem fluunt velocitatibus in &longs;ubdu­
plicata proportione longitudinum fi&longs;tularum, &longs;i tamen
&longs;emper fi&longs;tulæ repletæ &longs;int eodem fluido.

Si enim &longs;uman­
tur duæ fi&longs;tulæ, quarum cauitates, & orificia æqua­
lia &longs;int, & in ambabus continenter repletis fluidu&mtail;
idem exeat aqua v.g. dum fi&longs;tulæ erectæ ad planu&mtail;
horizontale &longs;unt in quo orificia exi&longs;tunt; tunc ex v­
troque orificio defluunt aquæ moles, temporibus æ­
qualibus, non in eadem proportione, quam habent alti­
tudines, vt experientia docet, &longs;ed in &longs;ubduplicat&atail;,
nempè &longs;i altitudo longioris fi&longs;tulæ quadrupla fuerit
altitudinis alterius tunc velocitas, qua aqua defluit
ab orificio longioris non e&longs;t quadrupla, &longs;ed dupl&atail;
tantummodò eius velocitatis, qua aqua egreditur ex
infimo breuioris fi&longs;tulæ orificio.

Hinc deducitur
quod prædicta fluida in fi&longs;tulis erectis inæqualiu&mtail;
longitudinum, eandem prorsùs naturam habent, quam
fune pendula, quorum proprietates alibi expo&longs;uimus.
