PROP. CCXV.

Fluxus æquæ intra fistulam velocior e&longs;t circa axim, quam
propè internam cauam &longs;uperficiem eius.

SEd antequam vlteriùs procedamus, animaduer­
tendum e&longs;t, quod aqua velociùs fluit deorsù&mtail;
in medio cauitatis fi&longs;tulæ, &longs;eù circa eius axim, quàm
versùs &longs;uperficiem eius cauam; propterea quod, vt
&longs;upra dictum e&longs;t, gluten ip&longs;ius aquæ, quæ &longs;uperficiei
a&longs;peræ internæ fi&longs;tulæ adhæret magis retardat de­
fcen&longs;um, & fluxum aquæ, quàm in intermedia parte
cauitatis fi&longs;tulæ, vbi in&longs;en&longs;ibili tenacitate aquæ par­
ticulæ vici&longs;&longs;im impediuntur, & hoc euincitur duplici
experimento; primò quia in &longs;upremo &longs;trictæ fi&longs;tulæ
orificio excauatur eius &longs;uperficies ad modum &longs;cutel­
læ, è contra in egre&longs;&longs;u fluidi &longs;uperficies aquæ ad mo­
dum conoidis, &longs;eu monticuli turgidi deorsùm ex­
porrigitur, quod minimè fieri po&longs;&longs;et, ni&longs;i partes a­
quæ intermediæ faciliùs fluerent, quàm partes col­
laterales internæ &longs;uperficiei fi&longs;tulæ proxim&etail;, & adh&etail;­
rentes, quæ vt diximus, à &longs;tabilibus a&longs;peritatibus fi-
&longs;tulæ retinentur aliquo pacto, & &longs;u&longs;penduntur, ideo­
que impeditur fluxus earum.

PROP. CCXVI.

Quare æqua post egre&longs;&longs;um è fistula in aere &longs;ubiecto non dis&longs;i­
petur, &longs;ed &longs;en&longs;im re&longs;tringitur quou&longs;que di&longs;rumpatur ra­
tionem reddere.

PO&longs;tquam fluidum ab infimo orificio fi&longs;tulæ in ae­
re liberè effluere incipit, concipi debet, quod
quælibet &longs;uperficies, &longs;eu laminula prædicti fluidi
perducitur ad aerem liberum eo gradu velocitatis,
qui dependet à longitudine prædictæ fi&longs;tulæ, &longs;eù pen­
duli, idemque dicendum e&longs;t de reliquis omnibus &longs;ub­
&longs;equentibus aquæ laminulis, cum ad aeris confinium
perducuntur; deberet ergo integra laminula aquæ
egre&longs;&longs;a diuelli &longs;epararique à &longs;uperficie alterius aquæ
laminulæ, quæ eam &longs;ub&longs;equitur, & &longs;ecundo loco è fi­
&longs;tula egreditur in aere libero; ratio e&longs;t quia prima la­
minula dum excurrit pertran&longs;itque in aere &longs;patiu&mtail;
æquale cra&longs;&longs;itiei eius in dato aliquo tempore, nece&longs;­
&longs;ariò gradum aliquem velocitatis maiorem acquiret,
corre&longs;pondentem motui, & tempori prædicto; &longs;ed
in &longs;imili con&longs;titutione &longs;ecunda aquæ laminula in e­
gre&longs;&longs;u è fi&longs;tula caret illo gradu velocitatis, quem ac­
qui&longs;iuit prima laminula, igitur in &longs;ecundo tempore
illi æquale prior laminula percurret &longs;patium triplum
eius, quod priùs pertran&longs;ierat, & eius quod &longs;ecunda
laminula excurrere debet, quia nimirùm in &longs;ecundo
illo tempore mouetur duplo vehementiori gradu ve­
locitatis, quàm &longs;ub&longs;equens laminula de&longs;cendit; &longs;ed
ab initio prædictæ duæ laminulæ contiguæ inter &longs;&etail;
erant, igitur in &longs;ecundo tempore diuelli, ac &longs;eparari
ab inuicem deberent; quod cum non contingat, pro­
cùl dubio ad erit aliqua cau&longs;a, à qua colligatæ reti­
nentur; & hæc profectò erit gluten, & vi&longs;co&longs;itas illa
exigua &longs;uperiùs declarata, qua partes eiu&longs;dem fluidi
adinuicem adhærent, & vinciuntur.

Cum verò præ­
dictæ partes aquæ effluxæ à fi&longs;tula inæqualibus velo­
citatibus moueantur, & nihilominùs non po&longs;&longs;int ab
inuicem diuelli, &longs;epararique, &longs;equitur illa attenua­
tio, & gracilitas, quæ in aqua po&longs;t egre&longs;&longs;um fi&longs;tulæ
ob&longs;eruatur, & propterea prædicta aqua magis, &
magis acuminatur, gracile&longs;citque.

Sed hìc iam reddi
debet ratio, quare in progre&longs;&longs;u prædicta aqua fluens,
po&longs;tquam ad aliquam exiguam gracilitatem redacta
e&longs;t, po&longs;tea di&longs;rumpitur in plures partes, & guttulas;
& hic dicendum e&longs;t, quod vis, & energia prædicti glu­
tinis cum fit exigua non pote&longs;t tandem re&longs;i&longs;tere ve­
hementiæ velocitatis continuò auctæ in ip&longs;o aquæ
de&longs;cen&longs;u, & hæc proindè poterit di&longs;rumpere vnio­
nem illam aquæ, qua priùs ferebatur, eo in loco v­
bi glutem ab aliqua cau&longs;a externa debilitatum fue­
rit, aut cur&longs;us velocitas variatur, retardaturque ab
externo impedimento.

PROP. CCXVII.

E fi&longs;tulis inæqualitèr amplis, & æquè altis quarum infima
ostiola horizont alia æqualia &longs;int, æquè velocitèr aquæ mo­
les æquales effluunt.

ET primò animaduertendum e&longs;t, quòd in prædi­
ctis fi&longs;tulis orificia infima perpendicularia ad di­
rectionem fluxus liquoris è fi&longs;tula egredientis tantunm
modò con&longs;ideranda veniunt, & nil refert an internæ
cauitates ampliores &longs;int orificijs ip&longs;is (non enim hìc
agimus de fi&longs;tulis infernè dilatatis ad in&longs;tar coni);
quandoquidem ratio haberi debet illius portionis a­
quæ, quæ deorsùm fluit, non verò illius, quæ in quiete
con&longs;i&longs;tit, vt v.g. &longs;i fuerit fi&longs;tula aliqua vitrea ad hori­
zontem perpendicularis, & puteus æquè altus, i&ntail;
cuius fundo aperiatur foramen prorsùs æquale infi­
mo fi&longs;tulæ foramini, tunc aqua ab orificio putei pro­
fluit eadem ferè velocitate, & æquali mole, ac ex il­
la fi&longs;tula vitrea æquè plena egreditur, proptere&atail;
quòd in aqua putei concipi debet fi&longs;tula perpendi­
culariter horizonti erecta ab infimo foramine v&longs;que
ad &longs;ummitatem aquæ, & &longs;olummodò prædicta aqua
in fi&longs;tula imaginaria contenta fluit, reliqua verò col­
lateralis innititur &longs;uftentaturque à fundo impenetra­
bili, & firmo ip&longs;ius putei, à quo aquæ fluxus perpen­
dicularis impeditur, & ideò perindè aqua excurrit
perpendicularitèr, ac &longs;i in fi&longs;tula vitrea contineretur.

Verum tamen e&longs;t, quòd &longs;uperficies dura interna fi­
&longs;tulæ vitreæ magis &longs;uis a&longs;peritatibus impedit efflu­
uium aquæ, quàm parietes aquei in imaginaria ílla
fi&longs;tula putei, & hæc e&longs;t ratio quare in angu&longs;ti&longs;&longs;imis fi­
&longs;tulis, & canalibus tenui&longs;&longs;imis aqua nedùm tardè de­
fluit, &longs;ed aliquando omninò eius motus, & ca&longs;us im­
peditur, vt &longs;uperiùs declarauimus.

PROP. CCXVIII.

In ei&longs;dem fi&longs;tulis inæqualitèr ad horizontem inclinatis velo­
citates aquæ fluentis &longs;ubduplicatam proportionem habent,
non longitudinum, &longs;ed &longs;ublimitatum perpendicularium
carum.

PO&longs;tea &longs;i eædem duæ fi&longs;tulæ inæqualitèr ad hori­
zontem fuerint inclinatæ, fluxus eiu&longs;dem fluidi
in eis fient velocitatibus &longs;ubduplicatè proportiona­
libus, non quidem longitudinibus earum, &longs;ed vertica­
libus altitudinibus; propterea quod demon&longs;trarunt
Galileus, & Torricellius, quòd &longs;i idem mobile fera­
tur per planum inclinatum, & verticale, itaut ambo
eamdem eleuationem habeant, &longs;i tamen initium vtriu&longs;­
que motus à quiete fiat, in fine vtriu&longs;que de&longs;cen&longs;us,
acquiret mobile eumdem gradum velocitatis.

PROP. CCXIX.

Velocitates quibus aqua egreditur ab infimis fi&longs;tularum ori­
ficijs illæ eædem &longs;unt, quibus eadem aqua intra cauitates
canalium mouetur.

OVia &longs;emper æqualibus temporibus æquales a-
quæ moles ab infimo eiu&longs;dem fi&longs;tulæ orificio egredi­
untur, & propterea vna, & eadem velocitate deter­
minata ab eius &longs;umma altitudine aqua fluit, (&longs;i tamen
&longs;emper fi&longs;tula repleta &longs;upponatur); ergo æqualibus
temporibus tanta aquæ moles &longs;upernè infunditur,
quanta inferiùs ab eadem fi&longs;tula egreditur, quare in
progre&longs;&longs;u motus intra fi&longs;tulam eadem velocitate à qua
excurrit, qua infernè egreditur, cùmque hæc veloci­
tas ab altitudine ca&longs;us, &longs;eu longitudine penduli, vel
fi&longs;tulæ determinetur, igitur velocitas aquæ intra ca­
nalem fi&longs;tulæ &longs;emper eumdem gradum habet, æqua­
lem &longs;cilicèt ei, qui fi&longs;tulæ longitudini competit.

po­
&longs;tea, vt &longs;ub&longs;equentes propo&longs;itiones demon&longs;trari com­
modiùs po&longs;&longs;int; Primò &longs;upponendum e&longs;t vt euidens,
quòd ab eodem fi&longs;tulæ orificio, perpendicularitèr ta­
men erecto ad directionem aquæ fluentis, duæ moles
æquales aquæ æqualibus temporibus egre&longs;&longs;æ nece&longs;­
&longs;ariò æqualibus velocitatibus egredi debent; & è con­
uer&longs;o &longs;i velocitates æquales fuerint, paritèr moles a­
quæ æqualibus temporibus effluxæ erunt quoque in­
ter &longs;e æquales.

Vnde colligitur, quòd velocitat&etail;
dupla eodem tempore paritèr dupla moles aquæ ab
æquali foramine egreditur, idemque dicendum e&longs;t
de qualibet æquè multiplici proportione: paritèrque

PROP. CCXX.

Si ex æqualibus fistularum orificijs temporibus æqualibus duæ
aquæ moles defluant inæqualibus velocitatibus, erunt
aquæ moles proportionales velocitatibus.

SInt fi&longs;tulæ AB, & CD, quarum orificia infima B,
& D &longs;int æqualia, & eorum plana non &longs;it obliquè
inclinata ad directionem motus, quo aqua ab eis de­
fluit, &longs;ed ei&longs;dem directionibus perpendiculares &longs;int,
(& hoc intelligatur in omnibus &longs;ub&longs;equentibus pro­
po&longs;itionibus), defluat po&longs;tea moles aquæ R ex AB
velocitate M tempore T, & eodem
tempore minor moles aquæ S deci­
dat ex CD velocitate N. o&longs;tenden­
dum e&longs;t molem aquæ R ad S eamdem
proportionem habere quam velo­
citas M ad N.

Sumantur alia velo­
citas H, & altera moles aqu&etail; O, hac
lege, vt H ip&longs;ius N, nec non O alte­
rius S quælibet, & eædem partes
&longs;int.

Patet, quòd eodem tempor&etail;
T ex foramine æquali ip&longs;i B velocitate H fluet moles
aquæ O dum ex D velocitate N fuit aquæ moles S; &
&longs;iquidem velocitas H æqualis e&longs;t velocitati M egre-
dientur eodem tempore ex B prædictis duabus velo­
citatibus H, & M duæ æquales moles aquæ O, & R;
&longs;i verò moles O fluat eodem tempore velocitate H
maiori, quam M, erit quoque aqua O maior, quà&mtail;
R, & &longs;i velocitas H minor fuerit quàm M, erit etiam
moles aquæ O minor quàm R, cùm eodem tempore
ex foramine B fluant; quia verò &longs;unt quatuor quanti­
tates M, N, R, S, & &longs;umuntur duæ aliæ quantitates H,
& O habentes quamlibet, & eamdem commen&longs;ura­
bilem proportionem con&longs;equentibus N, & S; &longs;untque
vnà æquales, vel vnà maiores, aut minores antece­
dentibus ordinatæ, igitur M ad N eamdem propor­
tionem habebit, quam R ad S.

PROP. CCXXI.

Ex ei&longs;dem fistulis temporibus æqualibus fluent aquæ moles
&longs;ubduplicatam proportionem habentes altitudinum earum.

SInt du&etail; inæquales fi&longs;tulæ AB maior, & CD minor
perpendicularitèr ad horizontem erectæ, eorum
foramina infima B, & D æqualia &longs;int inter &longs;e, & &longs;em­
per fi&longs;tularum plenitudine per&longs;eue­
rante, eodem tempore T egrediatur
ex foramine B moles aquæ R, at ex
foramine D alia moles aquæ S, & &longs;e­
cetur altitudo EB media proportio­
nalis inter altitudines AB, & CD;
patet AB ad EB proportionem &longs;ub­
duplicatam habere eius, quam ha­
bet AB ad CD; dico, quòd moles a­
quæ R ad molem S eodem tempore
T dilapsam eamdem proportionem habebit, quam al­
titudo AB habet ad BE. &longs;it M velocitas, quæ compe­
tit longitudini fi&longs;tulæ AB, & &longs;it N velocitas fi&longs;tulæ
CD; quoniam velocitas M aquæ fluentis per orifi­
cium B, plenitudine eius per&longs;euerante, ad velocitatem
N aquæ fluentis per orificium D, æquale ip&longs;i B, &longs;ub­
duplicata e&longs;t eius, quam habent fi&longs;tularum altitudi­
nes AB, & CD, ideoque velocitas M ad N erit vt AB
ad BE, &longs;ed moles aquæ fluentes eodem tempore per
orificia æqualia B, D eamdem proportionem habent,
quàm eorum velocitates, ergo moles aquæ efflux&atail;
R, ad molem S, eodem tempore T, eamdem propor­
tionem habebit, quam altitudo AB ad EB, quod fue­
rat o&longs;tendendum.

aquæ R tempore T, ex D verò profluat moles aquæ

CD; dico tempus V ad T ean­
dem proportionem haber&etail;,
quam EB ad CD, &longs;it moles aquæ
X illa, quæ defluit ab orificio
D eodem tempore T, igitur
vt moles aquæ R ad X, ita erit
altitudo EB ad CD, po&longs;te&atail;
quia ab eodem ori&longs;icio D fi­

aqueæ X, & S temporibus T,
& V, igitur vt tempus V ad T, ita &longs;e habet moles aquæ

æquales, igitur ad eamdem molem X eamdem pro­
portionem habent; e&longs;t verò EB ad CD vt R ad X;
atque V ad T vt S ad X; igitur altitudo EB ad CD ean­
dem proportionem habebit, quam tempus V ad T.

ET procedendo ad libræ, &longs;en &longs;iphonis in corpori­

& quia prædictum &longs;olidum non pote&longs;t &longs;ur­

loco expellatur, & infernè recurrat ad replendum lo­

Et licèt
pateat &longs;en&longs;u, in va&longs;is amplis, non totam aquam colla­

cium va&longs;is &longs;uppleat, non tamen euidens e&longs;t tubu&mtail;
aqueum AFCH &longs;iphonem con&longs;tituentem præcisè æ­
qualem e&longs;&longs;e ligneo cylindro AC; ideò hoc ration&etail;

Quia tantumdem &longs;olidum AC
&longs;ursùm a&longs;cendit, quanta e&longs;t moles aquæ, quæ è &longs;upre­

antecedentem vrgendo fertur ad replendum &longs;patium

at aqua AKLD di&longs;ce­

G versùs FB non videtur ferri debere minori, aut ma­

Si igi­
tur eodem tempore fluidum, & &longs;olidum &etail;qualia &longs;pa­

quod ba&longs;is circulus AD maior e&longs;t
zona circulari KLDA, & propterea

minor erit amplitudine cylindri &longs;o­

è &longs;upremo loco expul&longs;a, igitur vt
&longs;ummitas cylindri AD perpendicu­

LD, cumque prædictus tubus aqueus æqualis &longs;it præ­

Patet ergo, quod
angu&longs;tia va&longs;is talis e&longs;&longs;e pote&longs;t vt velocitas fluxus a­

Ex quo proindè &longs;equi­

Si fuerint duo cylindri homogenei in aqua demer&longs;i æqualium

SInt ergo duo cylindri homogenei primò aqu&atail;
leuiores ABC, & DEF, &longs;cilicèt ex eodem ligno
facti, quorum ba&longs;es BC, & EF æquales &longs;int, altitudo
verò AB maior &longs;it, quàm DE, & inter AB, & DE fiat

per cylindri infra aquam demer&longs;i retineant eoru&mtail;
latera perpendicularitèr ad horizontem erecta, (&
hoc in &longs;equentibus quoque &longs;upponatur) &longs;i &longs;patia æ­
qualia X, & Z &longs;ursùm a&longs;cendendo percurrerint AC
quidem tempore T, & DF tempore V; dico tempus
V ad T e&longs;&longs;e vt AB ad GB; quia per æqualia &longs;patia X,
& Z in aqua eleuantur &longs;olida AC, & DF, ergo &longs;uis æ­
qualibus ba&longs;ibus expellunt è locis &longs;upremis æquales
cylindros aqueos, & hæ æquales aquæ moles deor­
sùm fluunt per &longs;iphones tubicos excauatos æquè cra&longs;­
&longs;os, &longs;cilicèt æqualium ba&longs;ium, propterea quod ba&longs;es
BC, & EF æquales &longs;unt inter &longs;e, igitur ex &longs;iphonibus
tubicis inæqualium altitudinum ha­
bentibus orificia, &longs;eu ba&longs;es æqua­
les defluunt duæ aquæ moles inter
&longs;e æquales, &longs;ed natura prædictorum
&longs;iphonum exigit, vt tempus V, quo
data moles aquæ profluit ab orifi­
cio infimo &longs;iphonis ambientis cy­
lindrum DF ad tempus T, quo mo­
les aquæ illi æqualis defluit ex æ­
quali orificio &longs;iphonis ambientis
cylindrum AC, eamdem proportionem habeat, quam
altitudo GB ad DE, & in prædictis temporibus tan­
tumdem eleuantur cylindri, quantæ &longs;unt moles aquæ
ex vtri&longs;que &longs;iphonibus effluxæ: igitur tempus V, quo
&longs;olidum DF eleuatur ad tempus T &longs;ublimationis &longs;o­
lidi AC eamdem proportionem habebit, quam altitu­
do GC ad altitudinem DE.

Secundò &longs;int ijdem cylindri aqua grauiores; &longs;imi­

tubicos æquè cra&longs;&longs;os, & de&longs;cendunt cylindri AC, &
DF; ergo (ex prop.
223) tempus V ad tempus T e­

PROP. CCXXVIII.

Ii&longs;dem datis, &longs;i a&longs;cen&longs;us, vel de&longs;cen&longs;us fiant æqualibus tem­
poribus, &longs;patia ab eis exacta habebunt &longs;ubduplicatam
proportionem altitudinum.

EOdem tempore T primo &longs;olidum AC a&longs;cenden­
do percurrat &longs;patium X, atque &longs;olidum DF per­
tran&longs;eat &longs;patium Z; dico, quod &longs;patium X ad Z eam­
dem proportionem habebit, quam
GB ad DE; quia eodem tempore T
per orificium &longs;iphonis ambientis cy­
lindrum AC cuius foramen æquale
e&longs;t ba&longs;i BC, defluit cylindrus aqueus
cuius ba&longs;is æqualis e&longs;t ip&longs;i BC, alti­
tudo verò X, quantum &longs;cilicèt a&longs;cen­
dit prædictus cylindrus, atque tem­
pore T per &longs;iphonem ambientem cy­
lindrum DF, cuius foramen æquale e&longs;t EF, &longs;eu BC,
defluit cylindrus aqueus &longs;ub eadem ba&longs;i, & altitudi­
ne Z contentus; igitur moles aquæ defluxa ex priori
cylindro altiori ad molem aquæ egre&longs;&longs;am ex minori
cylindro, &longs;cilicèt altitudo X ad Z &longs;ubduplicata&mtail;
proportionem habebit altitudinis AB ad DE, & proin­
de &longs;patium X a&longs;cen&longs;us cylindri AC ad &longs;patium Z ele­
uationis cylindri DF eodem tempore T eamdem pro­
portionem habet, quam altitudo GB ad DE; quod
erat &c.
Prop. 221.

Secundò &longs;int cylindri AC, DF aqua grauiores; o­
&longs;tendetur (ex prop.
221.) quod de&longs;cen&longs;us X ad de­
&longs;cen&longs;um Z, eodem tempore T factum, e&longs;t &longs;icuti altitu­
do GB ad DE, & hoc erat, &c.
PROP. CCXXIX.

Po&longs;tea &longs;i duo coni homogenei ba&longs;es æquales, & inæquales al­
titudines habuerint, & verticibus &longs;ursùm vergentibus,
itaut axes eorum &longs;emper inter &longs;e æquidistantes &longs;int, &
infra aquam exi&longs;tentibus percurrant a&longs;cendendo, vel
de&longs;cendendo &longs;patia æqualia; tempora contrario ordine re­
&longs;pondebunt &longs;ubduplicatæ proportioni altitudinum.

SInt duo coni eiu&longs;dem materiei ABC, DEF, &longs;ed
primò aqua leuiores, eorum ba&longs;es BC, & EF æ­
quales &longs;int, altitudo verò illius maior &longs;it huius altitu­
dine, inter quas ponatur GB media proportionalis;
tendant verò ambo &longs;ursùm præcedendo vertices A,
& D, vt eorum axes paralleli &longs;int, percurrantque a&longs;cen­
dendo &longs;patia æqualia AH, & DN
nempe ABC tempore T, at DEF
tempore V; dico tempus V ad ten­
pus T e&longs;&longs;e vt GB ad DE; quia æ­
qualia &longs;patia percurrunt &longs;ursù&mtail;
a&longs;cendendo &longs;olida ABC, DEF,
ergo &longs;uis ba&longs;ibus æqualibus dere­
linquunt &longs;patia æqualia, & æquè
alta IBCK, & OEFP, & ibide&mtail;
fluere debent æquales aquæ moles
conos ambientes, quæ è &longs;upremis locis expelli de­
bent, excurrunt verò prædictæ aquæ moles per &longs;i-
phones, non quidem ad horizontem perpendiculares,
&longs;ed inclinatos, prout &longs;uperficies conorum inclinantur,
habentque &longs;iphones ori&longs;icia ferè æqualia IL OM, &
eorum altitudines inæquales, ergo duæ moles aquæ
æquales de&longs;luunt temporibus reciprocè proportio­
nalibus &longs;ubduplicatæ rationi altitudinum; quare ten­
pus V, quo &longs;olidum DEF a&longs;cendit &longs;patium DN, ad tem­
pus T, quo &longs;olidum ABC percurrit &longs;patium AH æ­
quale ip&longs;i DN, eamdem proportionem habebit, quam
altitudo GB ad altitudinem DE.

Prop. 223.

Ij&longs;dem po&longs;itis &longs;i a&longs;cen&longs;us fiant æqualibus tempo­
ribus (&longs;emper tamen infra aquæ libellam), &longs;patia ab
eis exacta habebunt &longs;ubduplicatam proportione&mtail;
altitudinum.

Hoc profectò facilè o&longs;tendetur eadem methodo
&longs;uperiùs expo&longs;ita.

Idemque concludetur in conorum
de&longs;cen&longs;u.
PROP. CCXXX.

Ii&longs;dem datis &longs;i tantummodò conorum ba&longs;es præcedant, &
&longs;ursùm re&longs;piciant, & æquidi&longs;tantes horizonti, & &longs;upre­
mæ aquæ libellæ; idem prorsùs concludetur.

NAm &longs;emper aqua è &longs;uperno loco expelli debet
ad occupanda infima &longs;patia à conis derelicta,
neque hoc fieri pote&longs;t ab&longs;que eo quòd aqua circum­
circa per &longs;iphones rotundos, cauos, inclinato&longs;qu&etail;
defluat, & quia celeritates fluxus aquæ in prædictis
&longs;i phonibus determinant velocitates a&longs;cen&longs;uum; hinc
&longs;equitur vt motus &longs;ursùm conorum legibus &longs;iphonum
&longs;ubijciantur, &longs;cilicèt a&longs;cen&longs;us conorum eodem tem-
pore facti &longs;ubduplicatam proportionem habeant al­
titudinum eorum.

PROP. CCXXXI.

Eorumdem conorum æquè altorum &longs;i vnius vertex, & al­
terius ba&longs;is &longs;ursùm ambo, vel deorsùm re&longs;piciont; parum
celeriùs feretur is, qui mucrone præcedente fertur.

COmparari modò debent inter &longs;e duo coni æqua­
les, &longs;imiles, & homogenei aqua leuiores, vel gra
uiores, &longs;ed contrario ordine di&longs;po&longs;iti, &longs;cilicèt &longs;i vnius
ba&longs;is deorsum re&longs;piciat, alterius ba&longs;is &longs;ursùm vergat,
&longs;ed ambo horizonti æquidi&longs;tantes, atque temporibus
æqualibus &longs;emper infra aquæ libellam a&longs;cendendo,
vel de&longs;cendendo ferantur; aliquantum celeriùs mo­
uebitur is, qui vertice præcedente mouetur; quia li­
cet expul&longs;io &longs;upremæ aquæ efficiatur ab exce&longs;&longs;u pon­
deris aquæ &longs;iphonis &longs;upra pondus ligni a&longs;cendentis,
& ab illius motu, cui veluti appendix &longs;ub&longs;equitur a­
quæ &longs;upernæ migratio, nihilominus illa moueri de­
bet, ergo &longs;i eius motus impedimentum patietur, con­
&longs;equenter retardabitur a&longs;cen&longs;us ligni: modo negari
non pote&longs;t re&longs;i&longs;tentia pendens ab ampla translatione,
& di&longs;tractione lanuginis partium aquæ, & à confri­
catione cum a&longs;peritatibus ligni a&longs;cendentis; hæc pro­
fectò magis retardare po&longs;&longs;e videtur ba&longs;im coni &longs;ursum
vergentem, quàm eius apicem, & hac de cau&longs;a veri­
&longs;imile videtur vt celeriùs conus &longs;ursùm feratur quan­
do eius vertex &longs;ursùm re&longs;picit, quàm &longs;i inuer&longs;o ordi­
ne di&longs;ponatur, idemque in de&longs;cen&longs;u o&longs;tendetur.

Id quod dictum e&longs;t de conis, verificatur etiam d&etail;
quibuslibet alijs figuris curuis habentibus ba&longs;es pla­
nas & æquales, dummodò moles eamdem propor­
tionem habeant, quam earum altitudines, vt &longs;i vna
e&longs;&longs;et hemi&longs;phærium, reliqua verò, &longs;emi&longs;phæroidalem
figuram æmularetur; tunc quoque &longs;i materiæ fuerint
homogeneæ, & aqua leuiores, intra ip&longs;am a&longs;cendunt
velocitatibus, ferè in &longs;ubduplicata proportione al­
titudinum earumdem vt facilè ex dictis colligi pote&longs;t.

PROP. CCXXXII.

Si cylindri partim in aqua, partim in aere existentes &longs;ursùm,
vel deorsùm excurrerint; prædictæ proportiones velocita­
tum valdè alterantur.

ET hactenùs con&longs;iderauimus a&longs;cen&longs;us, vel de&longs;cen­
&longs;us corporum dum eorum motus omninò fiunt
intra aquam, at quamprimùm &longs;upremam libellam at­
tingunt, tunc progre&longs;&longs;us velocitatum valdè alteran­
tur, debilitanturque; & ratio e&longs;t, quia quando aliqua
pars ligni &longs;upra aqu&etail; libellam eminet tunc non compa­
rantur amplius inter &longs;e duæ moles æquales aquæ, &
ligni, nec per&longs;euerat &longs;ipho integer vt priùs, &longs;ed aliam
longè diuer&longs;am naturam &longs;ortitur, illius, inquam, cu­
ius ex vna parte fluidum eminens continenter de&longs;cen­
dit quou&longs;que ad æquilibrium perducatur, & in hoc
ca&longs;u centrum communis grauitatis &longs;emper magis, ac
magis ad libræ fulcimentum accedit, motu illo curuo,
vt dictum e&longs;t; & tunc propemodum ce&longs;&longs;at motus cum
centrum communis grauitatis ligni, & fluidi non am­
plius de&longs;cendere valet, quia nempè ad ip&longs;um fulci­
mentum libræ perductum e&longs;t.

cap.
2. prop. 4.
& 11.

Sed hoc verum e&longs;t de æquilibrio, & de vi motiua qua
corpus in aqua a&longs;cendit, vel de&longs;cendit, non verò de
celeritate motus eius, non enim motus eius retarda­
tur omninò, &longs;ed &longs;olummodò non augetur eodem pro­
gre&longs;&longs;u quo dum infra aquam po&longs;itum ferebatur.

Et
hoc pendet ab impetu acqui&longs;ito in præcedenti motu,
qui impetus per&longs;euerans ex &longs;ui natura &longs;uum effectum
velocitatis producit, licet cau&longs;a impul&longs;iua non per­
&longs;eueret eiu&longs;dem gradus, &longs;ed continentèr debilitetur;
& hæc e&longs;t ratio quare lignum a&longs;cendens non quie&longs;cit
præcisè in eo &longs;itu in quo æquilibratur cum aqua col­
laterali, &longs;ed altiùs ab impetu præconcepto impelli­
tur, & indè deorsùm decidendo repetitis aliquibus
vibrationibus, tandem in &longs;itu æquilibrij quie&longs;cit.
Et hic patet quo &longs;en&longs;u intelligi debeat propo&longs;itio

Archimedea, quæ habet quod tanta vi leue corpus
infra medium fluidum demer&longs;um &longs;ursùm a&longs;cendat, quan­
tum e&longs;t pondus, quo fluidum æquale ip&longs;i &longs;olido idip­
&longs;um &longs;uperat.

Hoc profectò verum e&longs;t non de motu,
atque celeritate qua lignum ex.

gr. &longs;ursùm a&longs;cendit,
&longs;ed de energia, qua lignum in &longs;tatu quietis &longs;ursùm ni­
titur a&longs;cendere, &longs;cilicèt &longs;i impediatur eius motus, vt
in bilanci contingit, tunc quidem propo&longs;itio verifi­
catur, non verò in actu motionis eius, nam tunc im­
petus quo &longs;ursùm a&longs;cendit, auctus à præcedenti mo­
tu &longs;uperabit quamcumque immen&longs;am vim compre&longs;&longs;
&longs;iuam cuiuslibet va&longs;ti&longs;&longs;imi ponderis incumbentis, vt
in no&longs;tro Opere de vi percu&longs;s.
o&longs;ten&longs;um e&longs;t.

Incidenter
verus &longs;en&longs;uæ
Archimedis
declaratur.

De in&longs;idem hu­
mido lib.
1.
pr. 6.

Præterea altera Archimedis propo&longs;itio, quod ni­
mirùm moles fluidi æqualis &longs;olidi natantis parti de­
mer&longs;æ æquè ponderet, ac &longs;olidum ip&longs;um, vera e&longs;t,
ni&longs;i hypothe&longs;is varietur, oportet enim ex vi hypo­
the&longs;is vt &longs;olidum innatet &longs;upra vnum fluidum, nam &longs;i
omninò &longs;it demer&longs;um intra rarius, & innatet &longs;upr&atail;
aliud den&longs;iùs fluidum propo&longs;itio alteratur, vt docuit
præceptor meus Benedictus Ca&longs;tellus, qui demon­
&longs;trauit, quod ferrum &longs;upra mercurium natans &longs;i aqua
quoque cooperiatur, tunc quidem altiùs eleuabitur,
quàm priùs; propterea quod pondus aquæ collate­
ralis auget magis hydrargyri compre&longs;&longs;ionem, quam
ferri pondus augeat proindeque ferrum aliquanti&longs;­
per altiùs eleuat.
Idem pr. 5.

Cap.
11. gra­
uia in fluido
velocitati­

Sed præterea animaduerti, quod alia de cau&longs;&atail;
prædictum æquilibrium alterari pote&longs;t, nempè ex eo
quod aquæ libella circa &longs;olidum in ea natans, num­
quam præcisè explanatur, vt docuimus cap.
9. prop.

Porrò vt a&longs;cen&longs;us, vel de&longs;cen&longs;us cylindrorum in­
æqualium ba&longs;ium symptomata exponamus aliquæ
propo&longs;itiones præmitti debent.
PROP. CCXXXIII.

Si duo pondera inæqualia &longs;u&longs;penduntur in extremitatibus dua­
rum librarum inæqualium, &longs;ed æqualium radiorum, ve­
locitates reuolutionum earum &longs;ubduplicatam proportio­
nem habebunt radiorum.

SInt duæ libræ inæquales CD, & FG, quarum cen­
tra bifariam eas &longs;ecantia &longs;int E, & H, & idem ma­
ius pondus A &longs;u&longs;pendatur primò in C, &longs;ecundò in F,
minus verò pondus B pendeat nedùm ex D, &longs;ed etiam
ex G; & vt A ad B, ita fiat DI ad IC, nec non GL ad
LF, erunt I, & L centra grauitatum librarum, fiat po­
&longs;tea HN media proportionalis inter HL, & EI; pa­
riterque ponatur HO media proportionalis inter HG,
& ED; patet HG ad HO &longs;ubduplicatam proportio­
nem habere radij HG ad ED; dico velocitatem reuo­
lutionis libræ FG ad velocitatem vertiginis libræ CD
eamdem proportionem habe­
re, quam HG ad HO; quia vt
A ad B, ita erat GL ad LF, atque
DI ad IC, ergo componendo
GF ad FL erit vt DC ad CI, &
antecedentium &longs;emi&longs;&longs;es HF ad
FL, atque EC ad CI proporti­
onales erunt, & per conuer&longs;io­
nem rationis HF ad HL erit vt CE ad EI, & permu­
tando FH ad CE, &longs;eu HG ad ED erit vt LH ad IE, &
earum &longs;ubduplicatæ proportiones eædem quoqu&etail;
erunt, nimirùm HG ad HO, vt HL ad HN; po&longs;te&atail;
quia duo pondera A, & B exercent eorum vim in cen­
tris grauitat ullibrarum L, & I, & &longs;u&longs;penduntur ex pun­
ctis H, & E, ergo efficiunt duo funependula HL, &
EI, quæ conantur de&longs;cendere per arcus LM, IK, &longs;ed
pendulorum velocitates &longs;ubduplicatam proportio­
nem habent longitudinum eorum, igitur velocitas
de&longs;cen&longs;us libræ FG ad velocitatem de&longs;cen&longs;us libræ
CD eamdem proportionem habebit, quam LH ad
HN, &longs;eu quam habet HG ad HO, quod erat primum.

PROP. CCXXXIV.

Si duo &longs;iphones ex directis æquè altis, & contiguis fi&longs;tulis
compo&longs;iti fuerint, & in vnoquoque eorum duæ collatera­
les fistulæ æquales &longs;int inter &longs;e, atque in &longs;inistris &longs;iphonum
fi&longs;tulis ponantur duo fluidi cylindruli æquè alti leuiores,
vel grauiores aqua, re&longs;iduæ verò &longs;iphonum capacitates
aqua repleantur; aliquantulum tardiùs feretur cylinder
in &longs;iphone latiori, quàm in &longs;trictiori.

SInt duo &longs;iphones ABCD capaciores quàm PQRS
æquè alti, quorum fi&longs;tulæ vnius AB, & CD &longs;int
æquales, & contiguæ, pariterque duæ fi&longs;tule PQ, & SF
&longs;int æquales, contiguæque, ponanturque primo duæ olei
portiones EF, & KY æquè altæ, & proindè latitu­
dinibus fi&longs;tularum proportionales, reliquæ verò
&longs;iphonum capacitates aqua repleantur; dico, quod
oleum EF parùm tardiùs a&longs;cendet, quàm KY. &longs;e­
centur è regione, & in ei&longs;dem planis horizonta­
libus duæ aquæ portiones
FM, & YO, quæ æquales e­
runt olei portionibus EF &
KY, & eorum centra graui­
tatum coniungantur à rectis
GH, & TV, quæ bifaria&mtail;
&longs;ectæ erunt in I, & X, atque
vt pondus olei EF ad pondus
aquæ FM, velut pondus olei
KY ad aquæ pondus YO, ita fiat HL ad LG, nec non
VZ ad ZT; patet perindè operari, ac premere prædi­
cta fluida, ac &longs;i in libris radiorum æqualium HG, &
TV &longs;u&longs;pen&longs;a fui&longs;&longs;ent, pariterque con&longs;tat vim exerce­
re in eorum centris grauitatum L, & Z, quæ propor­
tionaliter libras diuidunt, & ideò in maiori libra GH
penduli longitudo IL maior erit longitudine penduli
XZ, quare impetus de&longs;cen&longs;us libræ & eleuatio olei
EF maiori velocitate fiet, quàm flexio alterius libræ
cum oleo KY, &longs;cilicèt in &longs;ubduplicata proportion&etail;
pendulorum; &longs;ed quia hoc experientiæ repugnat, fa­
tendum e&longs;t ab aliquo impedimento retardari a&longs;censum
olei EF, & profectò nedùm ratio habenda e&longs;t ponde­
rum EF, FM, nec non KY, YO, quia hæc corpora in
libra appen&longs;a moueri non po&longs;&longs;unt, quin etiam motu
tran&longs;uer&longs;ali fluidum in fimum, ac &longs;upremum in fi&longs;tulis
contentum impellant quoque motu tran&longs;uer&longs;ali: igi­
tur videndum quoque e&longs;t quibus velocitatibus a­
qua tran&longs;uer&longs;alitèr in vtroque &longs;iphone impul&longs;a mo­
ueri debeat; & primo quia &longs;patium tran&longs;uer&longs;ale AD
ad &longs;patium PS duplicatam proportionem habet eius
quam vis motiua penduli IL ad vim motiuam pendu­
li XZ, ergo hoc nomine retardatur velocitas a&longs;cen&longs;us
fluidi EF: præterea tran&longs;uer&longs;alis fluxus aquæ in &longs;i­
phone impeditur, quia non pote&longs;t oleum EF a&longs;cen­
dere v&longs;que ad 6, 7, ni&longs;i incumbens aqua E 7 &longs;ur&longs;u&mtail;
expellatur, colloceturque in &longs;patio 6 N, & hinc aqua
expul&longs;a reponatur in loco AN, & hinc exclu&longs;a aqua &longs;i­
tuationem acquirat ND & h&etail;c in N 8 transferatur, itaut
omnes partes aquæ AND &longs;imul tempore motu &longs;ucce&longs;
&longs;iuo amplitudinem va&longs;is excurrant: huiu&longs;modi verò
tran&longs;itus fieri non pote&longs;t ab&longs;que eo, quòd machinulæ
particularum fluidi non incidant in a&longs;peritates &longs;uper­
ficiei va&longs;is, vel fluidi quie&longs;centis, vnde &longs;ub&longs;equitur
confricatio, & repercu&longs;&longs;io partium fluidi per tota&mtail;
longitudinem canalis AD; & hac de cau&longs;a impetus
fluentis aquæ tranfuer&longs;ali motu retardatur exten&longs;iuè,
& inten&longs;iuè; & quoad exten&longs;ionem pertinet, patet
quòd quam proportionem habet &longs;uperficies interna
va&longs;is AD ad &longs;uperficiem PS, eamdem habebit impe­
dimentum retardans impetum fluidi AND ad impe­
dimentum impetus fluidi P 3 S, & habet AD ad PS
duplicatam proportionem eius, quam habet impetus
aquæ fluentis AND ad impetum fluentis aquæ P 3 S.
verùm quoad inten&longs;ionem, patet quòd machinulæ
ambientes particulas fluidorum magis flectuntur, &
vehementiùs di&longs;trahuntur, quando maiori vi intra ali­
as den&longs;as, vel fluidas particulas agitantur, & propte­
rea multò magis eorum impetus retardatur; Hinc fit
vt maior naturalis vis motiua libræ GH & ideò impe­
tus aquæ fluentis AND magis, & inten&longs;iuè retarde­
tur quàm naturalis languidior impetus aquæ P 3 S, &
propterea oleum EF nedùm celeriùs non a&longs;cendet,
quàm oleum KY, &longs;ed præterea nece&longs;&longs;e e&longs;t (vt docet ex­
perientia) vt aliquanti&longs;per tardius, quàm illud eleue­
tur.
idem de mercurij de&longs;cen&longs;u concludetur.

Si fuerint duo cylindri homogenei, æquè alti, quorum ba&longs;es
inæquales, cylinder &longs;trictior aliquantùm celerius a&longs;cendet,
vel de&longs;cendet, quàm latior.

SInt duo cylindri homogenei, primò aqua leuiores
ABC, & DEF, quorum altitudines AB, DE æqua­
les &longs;int, ba&longs;is verò BC maior &longs;it, quàm EF, & semper in­
fra aquam demer&longs;i in va&longs;is amplis a&longs;­
cendendo percurrant &longs;patia æqualia
X & Z, AC quidem tempore T, & DF
tempore V: dico quòd tempus T pa­
rùm maius erit quàm V. quia dum in
aqua eleuantur &longs;olida AC & DF con­
&longs;tituunt cum ambiente contigua aqua
duos &longs;iphones excauatos, æquè altos,

quorum fi&longs;tulæ inæquales &longs;unt, na&mtail;
cra&longs;&longs;ities fluentis aquæ circa cylindrum AC æqualis
e&longs;t ba&longs;i cylindri BC, pariterque cra&longs;&longs;ities fluentis a­
quæ circa cylindrum DF æqualis e&longs;t cra&longs;&longs;itiei EF: erunt
igitur duo &longs;iphones ex directis, æquè altis, & conti­
guis fi&longs;tulis compo&longs;iti, & in vnoquoque eorum duæ
collaterales fi&longs;tulæ æquales &longs;unt, atque duæ internæ
&longs;iphonum fi&longs;tulæ occupantur à cylindris AC, & DF ho­
mogeneis, & aqua leuioribus, & æquè altis, ergo pa­
rùm tardiùs a&longs;cendet cra&longs;&longs;ior cylinder AC, quàm DF,
&longs;upponuntur autem a&longs;cendi&longs;&longs;e &longs;patia æqualia X & Z
temporibus T, & V; igitur tempus T maius erit tem­
pore V. &longs;i verò a&longs;cen&longs;us fiant æqualibus temporibus,
&longs;patium a&longs;cen&longs;us latioris cylindri minus erit &longs;patio
tran&longs;acto à cylindro &longs;trictiori: Quia cùm parum tar­
diùs a&longs;cendat cylinder AC quàm DF, ergo æqualibus
temporibus T & V percurret AC minus &longs;patium X
dum DF maius &longs;patium Z pertran&longs;it.

&longs;ecundò &longs;int ijdem
cylindri aqua grauiores, patet non minus &longs;iphones
con&longs;titui, vt in prop.
234 dictum e&longs;t, quare eode&mtail;
modo concludetur, quòd cylinder &longs;trictior parum ce­
lerius de&longs;cendet quàm latior, quod erat &c.

non &longs;ecus
in a&longs;cen&longs;u vel de&longs;cen&longs;u prædictorum cylindroru&mtail;
non facilè determinari pote&longs;t men&longs;ura exce&longs;&longs;us velo­
citatis cylindri DF &longs;upra velocitatem cylindri AC,
quare recurrendum e&longs;t ad experientiam, in qua reue­
ra ob&longs;eruatur exce&longs;&longs;us minimus velocitatis in cylin­
dro DF &longs;upra velocitatem alterius cylindri AC; &longs;ed
procùl dubio velocitas cylindri DF minorem, quàm
&longs;ubduplicatam proportionem habere videtur ad ve­
locitatem alterius cylindri AC eius quam habet ba&longs;is
BC ad ba&longs;im EF.

Si duo quælibet &longs;olida homogenea, & à &longs;imilibus figuris con­

tur, maius celeriùs a&longs;cendet vel de&longs;cendet, quàm minus,
&longs;ed in minori proportione quàm &longs;ubduplicata altitudinum.

SInt duo &longs;olida homogenea pri­
mò aqua leuiora AC, & DF, quo­
rum figuræ &longs;imiles &longs;int inter &longs;e, & in
va&longs;is amplis &longs;emper infra aquam de­
mer&longs;a &longs;imiliter po&longs;ita &longs;int dum a&longs;cen­
dunt per &longs;patia, primo æqualia X &
Z, &longs;cilicèt dum &longs;ursùm feruntur &longs;em­
per axes eorum, &longs;int paralleli, & æ­
què inclinati ad planum horizontis,
atque AC tempore T pertran&longs;eat &longs;patium X, & DF
tempore V percurrat &longs;patium Z, & fiat IB medi&atail;
proportionalis inter altitudines AB, & DE. dico tem
pus T minus e&longs;&longs;e tempore V, &longs;ed tempus V ad T minorem
proportionem habere, quam IB habet ad DE; fiat vel in­
telligatur figura GBC æquè alta, ac e&longs;t DEF eiu&longs;dem­
que materiei habens eandem ba&longs;im BC, hac lege vt mo­
les ABC ad GBC eamdem proportionem habeat, quam
altitudo AB ad GB, &longs;itque Y tempus, quo GBC &longs;ur­
&longs;um infra aquam a&longs;cendendo percurrit idem &longs;patium
X. quoniam &longs;unt duo folida homogenea ABC, & GB
C eamdem ba&longs;im BC habentia, quorum moles eam­
dem proportionem habent, quam altitudo AB ad G
B, &longs;eù ad DE, & &longs;imiliter po&longs;ita &longs;unt dum a&longs;cendunt
per &longs;patia æqualia X, X; igitur tempus T, quo ABC
pertran&longs;it &longs;patium X ad tempus Y, quo GBC idip&longs;um
&longs;patium percurrit, eamdem proportionem habet, quam
DE ad IB. po&longs;tea quia &longs;unt duo alia &longs;olida homogenea
æquè alta GBC, & DEF quorum ba&longs;es planæ BC, &
EF eamdem proportionem habent, quam moles eo­
rum, ergo tempora Y, & V, quibus in eodem fluido
aqueo a&longs;cendendo percurrunt &longs;patia æqualia X, & Z
parùm inter &longs;e differunt, eritque tempus V minus quam
Y, &longs;ed maiorem proportionem ad ip&longs;um habet, quàm
DE ad IB, ac proindè tempus V maius erit, quàm T,
& ideò celeriùs a&longs;cendet ABC, quàm DEF, &longs;ed i&ntail;
minori proportione, quam habet IB ad DE, idemque
concludetur in de&longs;cen&longs;u, quod erat &c.

Ii&longs;dem po&longs;itis &longs;i a&longs;cen&longs;us vel de&longs;cen&longs;us fiant æqualibus tem­
poribus, &longs;patium ex actum à maiori &longs;olido maius erit &longs;pa­
tio tran&longs;acto à &longs;olido minori, &longs;ed ad ipsum habebit minorem
proportionem, quàm &longs;it &longs;ubduplicata altitudinem.

AScendat primò &longs;olidum ABC &longs;patium X tempo­
re T, atque DEF percurrat &longs;patium Z eode&mtail;
tempore T. dico &longs;patium X maius
e&longs;&longs;e, quàm Z, &longs;ed minorem propor­
tionem ad ip&longs;um habere, quàm &longs;it
&longs;ubduplicata altitudinis AB ad D
E; quia velocitates &longs;olidorum AB
C, & DEF eamdem proportionem
habent, quam &longs;patia X, & Z eodem
tempore exacta, ergo patet propo­
&longs;itum.

Non exiguum tempus in&longs;ump­
&longs;i vt experimentis expenderem &longs;uperiorem theori­
am, &longs;ed exactam præci&longs;ionem nulla diligentia, aut
labore adhibito a&longs;&longs;equi potui, hocque pendet ex
quamplurimis difficultatibus, &longs;i enim cylindrulorum
in fi&longs;tulis vitreis aqua plenis a&longs;cen&longs;us, vel de&longs;cen­
&longs;us, ob&longs;eruentur, tunc varietates in&longs;ignes contin­
gunt, quæ procùl dubio producuntur à vario contactu,
vel ab inæquali di&longs;tantia cylindrorum à &longs;uperfici&etail;
interna vitri, quæ liberè aquam interceptam fluere
non &longs;init.

Si po&longs;tea va&longs;a ampla v&longs;urpentur, tunc li­
cèt infimæ partes cylindrorum plumbo, vel alio pon­
dere grauiores reddantur iuxtà proportionem altitu-
dinum earumdem, numquam tamen cuitari pote&longs;t
cylindrorum agitatio, & o&longs;cillatio lateralis dum a­

&longs;imili po&longs;itione moueri po&longs;&longs;unt, & hinc enormes va­
rietates oriuntur; officit quoque agitatio partiu&mtail;
eiu&longs;dem aquæ quæ euitari ne quit, dum manus infr&atail;
aquam immer&longs;æ emittere cylindros debent.

Hi&longs;c&etail;
difficultatibus territus, vt quam maximè ob&longs;tacula ef­
fugerem, elegi &longs;phærulas ex eodem ligno, aut ex plum­
bo confectas, in quibus ob &longs;imilitudinem figuraru&mtail;
in qualibet earum circumuolutione o&longs;cillationes non
impediunt quin &longs;emper &longs;imili po&longs;itione pilæ a&longs;cen­
dant, vel de&longs;cendant, & tunc ex repetitis ex perimen­
tis con&longs;tat quod velocitates earum reuera inæquales
&longs;unt, celeriorique motu maior pila fertur, quàm mi­
nor, &longs;ed in minori proportione, quàm &longs;it &longs;ubduplica­
ta altitudinum, vt no&longs;tra theoria &longs;uadere videtur.

Quia difficul­
tèr hæc i&ntail;
cylindris ex­

&longs;ed faciliùs,
& rariùs in
&longs;phæris i&ntail;
ijs no&longs;tra sen­

Si in libra radiorum æqualium duo pondera in æqualia &longs;u&longs;pen­

rentiam eamdem proportionem habebit, quam libræ ra­

ATerminis eiu&longs;dem libræ AB &longs;u&longs;pen&longs;æ in puncto

D maius, & E minus, &longs;it­
que F centrum grauita­
tis libræ cum ponderi­
bus appen&longs;is, patet CF
e&longs;&longs;e longitudinem pen­
duli.

dico D plus, E ad D minus E eamdem propor­
tionem habere, quam libræ radius AC ad penduli
longitudinem CF. quia F e&longs;t centrum grauitatis libr&etail;
cum ponderibus &longs;u&longs;pen&longs;is D & E, ergo D ad E eamdem
proportionem habet (ex mechanicis) quàm BF ad FA,
& componendo D plus E ad E, pariterque duplu&mtail;
&longs;ummæ D & E ad duplum E eamdem proportionem
habebit, quàm BA ad AF, igitur antecedentium &longs;e­
mi&longs;&longs;es ad con&longs;equentes eamdem proportionem ha­
bebunt, &longs;cilicèt D plus E ad duplum E erit vt &longs;emi
BA, &longs;eu CA ad AF, & per conuer&longs;ionem rationis D
plus E ad D minus E eamdem proportionem habebit,
quàm CA, ad CF, quod erat, &c.

Si à terminis duarum librarum æqualium, & æqualium
radiorum duo pondera æqualia pendeant, &longs;ed oppo&longs;itis
minora, pendulum prioris libræ ad pendulum po&longs;terioris
proportionem compo&longs;itam habebit ex ratione differentiæ
priorum ponderum ad eorum &longs;ummam, & ex ratione
&longs;ummæ posteriorum ad differentiam eorumdem ponderum.

SInt duæ libræ æquales AB, & NO bifariàm &longs;ectæ
in fulci mentis C, & K, atque ex A pendeat ma­
ius pondus D, ex N verò minus pondus G, atque i&ntail;
B, & O &longs;u&longs;pendantur duo pon­
dera æqualia E, & M, quorum
&longs;ingula minora &longs;int quàm D,
vel G; reperianturque duo ea­
rum centra grauitatum F, &
H; dico pendulum CF ad K
H proportionem compo&longs;itam
habere ex ratione ponderis D minus E ad D plus E,
& ex ratione G plus M ad G minus M; quoniam AC ad
CF e&longs;t vt D plus E ad D minus E (ex præcedenti) er­
go inuertendo FC ad CA, &longs;eu ad ei æqualem KN ean­
dem proportionem habet quam D minus E ad D plus
E, & NK ad KH eamdem proportionem habet, quam
G plus M ad G minus M; habet verò FC ad HK pro­
portionem compo&longs;itam ex ratione FC ad CA, &longs;eu ad
NK, & ex ratione KN ad KH, ergo FC ad KH com­
po&longs;itam proportionem habebit ex ij&longs;dem proportio­
nibus D minus E ad D plus E, & ex G plus M ad G
minus M.

IN eadem figura &longs;int data pondera inæqualia D, &
G, nec non præcognita &longs;int pondera æqualia E,
& M, quæ minora prioribus &longs;int: reperiri debet pro­
portio velocitatum qui­
bus prædictæ libræ reuol­
uuntur; fiat CI media pro­
portionalis inter CF, &
KH; quia duo pondera D,
& E &longs;uam vim compre&longs;&longs;i­
uam exercent in F centro
grauitatis communis eo­
rumdem ponderum, ergo ea velocitate flectetur li­
bra AB circa centrum fixum C, quæ competit longi­
tudini penduli CF; eadem ratione ea velocitate fle­
ctetur libra NO cum ponderibus G, M circa centrum
K, quæ competit longitudini penduli KH; & qui&atail;

dem rationem habet quam CF ad CI; & CF ad KH
compo&longs;itam proportionem habet ex ratione diffe­
rentiæ ponderum D, & E ad eorum &longs;ummam, & ex
ratione &longs;ummæ ponderum G, M ad eorum differen­
tiam, ergo reperire debemus &longs;ubduplicatam propor­
tionem prædictæ compo&longs;itæ proportionis, vt quæ&longs;i­
to &longs;atisfaciamus.

Fiat modò &longs;umma ponderum D, &
E ad R, vt &longs;umma ponderum G, & M ad eorumde&mtail;
differentiam; & quia proportio FC ad KH compo­
nitur ex proportione D minus E ad D plus E, & ex
ratione G plus M ad G minus M, &longs;eu ex ratione D
plus E ad R, ergo FC ad KH eamdem rationem ha­
bet quam D minus E ad R, & reperta S media pro­
portionali inter D minus E, & R erit FC ad CI, vt D
minus E ad S, quare factum e&longs;t, quod propo&longs;itu&mtail;
fuerat.

PROP. CCXLI.

Datis duobus &longs;olidis æqualibus, eiu&longs;demque figuræ, &longs;ed inæ­
qualium grauitatum, præcognitarum, & dato quoque
pondere molis fluidi leuioris æqualis &longs;olidis demer&longs;is: re­
perire proportionem velocitatum quibus de&longs;cendunt in
eodem fluido.

SInt duæ moles &longs;olidæ æquales eiu&longs;demque figu­
ræ AC, & GI, &longs;ed inæqualiter graues, v. g. AC
&longs;it aurum, GI verò &longs;tannum, & facilitatis gratia in­
telligantur e&longs;&longs;e parallelepipeda æquè alta, & æqua­
lium ba&longs;ium, & ambo in aqua EHLX demer&longs;a com­
parentur cum æqualibus, &longs;imilibu&longs;que parallelepipe­
dis aqueis collateralibus DF, & KM cum quibus &longs;i­
phones con&longs;tituere intelligantur, tunc recta NO con­
iungens centra grauitatum auri AC, & aquæ DF li­
bram con&longs;tituet, quæ bifariam &longs;ecta erit in centro,
&longs;eu fulcimento P, propter æqualitatem, & &longs;imilitudi­
nem prædictorum corporum AC, DF ab ei&longs;dem pla­
nis horizontalibus comprehen&longs;orum, eiu&longs;demqu&etail;
libræ centrum grauitatis &longs;it T, vnde patet, quod PT
e&longs;t longitudo penduli à quo oritur impetus de&longs;cen-
&longs;us auri in aqua.

Non &longs;ecus &longs;tannum GI, & aqua KM
ei æqualis con&longs;tituent libram QR radiorum æqualium
cuius centrum grauitatis &longs;it V, vnde SV erit longitu­
do penduli, quod determinat impetum de&longs;cen&longs;us
&longs;tanni in aqua; & quia quatuor parallelepipeda AC,
DF, GI, KM æqualia &longs;unt inter &longs;e, &etail;què alta, &longs;uper æ­
qualibus ba&longs;ibus, ergo duæ libræ NO, & QR æqua­
les &longs;unt, & radiorum æqualium, atque in eorum ter­
minis N, & Q &longs;u&longs;penduntur duo inæqualia pondera
aurum &longs;cilicèt AC, & &longs;tannum GI, atque in terminis
O, R &longs;u&longs;penduntur duo alia pondera &etail;qualia inter &longs;e,
&longs;ed prioribus leuiora, &longs;cilicèt duæ
aquæ moles DF, & KM, & cognita
&longs;upponuntur quatuor prædicta pon­
dera; modò vt &longs;umma ponderum GI,
& KM ad eorum differentiam ita fi­
at &longs;umma ponderum AC, & DF ad
pondus Z, reperiaturque pondus Y
medium proportionale inter diffe­
rentiam ponderum AC, DF, & pon­
dus Z; tunc patet, quod impetus
quo libra NO flecti debet ad impetum quo reuolui­
tur libra QR eamdem proportionem habebit, quam
differentia ponderum AC, & DF ad pondus Y; & quia
prædicta corpora con&longs;tituunt &longs;iphones æquè altos, &
æquè amplos, propterea quod prædicta corpora æ­
qualia, & &longs;imilia &longs;unt inter &longs;e, ergo nulla alia de cau­
&longs;a velocitas in prædictis &longs;iphonibus variari pote&longs;t
præterquam à natura ip&longs;orum pendulorum PT, & SV;
quare manife&longs;tum e&longs;t, quod velocitas de&longs;cen&longs;us auri

Si comparentur velocitates corporum æqualium, & inæ­
qualitèr grauium propè principium de&longs;cen&longs;us in fluido,
minori inæqualitate feruntur, quàm in progre&longs;&longs;u, & con­
tinuatione motus.

SInt eadem corpora æqualia, & inæqualitèr gra­
uia A, & B; procùl dubio ambo per aliquod tenm
pus mouentur accelerato motu, nempè eorum ve­
locitates &longs;ucce&longs;&longs;iuè augentur, & po&longs;tea ad æquabi­
litatem reducuntur: in illo ergo exiguo tempore i&ntail;
quo amborum velocitates à quiete &longs;ucce&longs;&longs;iuè cre&longs;cunt,
&longs;i progre&longs;&longs;us incrementorum non differant in&longs;igni in­
æqualitate, ferè eadem velocitate de&longs;cendent, &longs;cilicèt
percurrent temporibus æqualibus penè &longs;patia æqua­
lia; at quia leuioris corporis B impetus facilius, &
magis debilitatur, retunditurque, quàm impetus
grauioris A, igitur propè initium motus exigua dif­
ferentia velocitatum reperitur, non &longs;ic in progre&longs;&longs;u
motus, nam po&longs;tquam leuius corpus B ad æquabili­
tatem redigitur, continuatur adhuc incrementum im­
petus in grauiori &longs;olido A; totum ergo id, quod au­
getur gradus impetus ip&longs;ius A creat notabilem ex­
ce&longs;&longs;um &longs;upra illum gradum debilem corporis B eodem,
& vniformi gradu impetus excurrentis, quare nece&longs;­
sè e&longs;t, vt propè initium motus parùm differant velo­
citates grauium A, & B, &longs;cilicèt fiant &longs;ecundùm pro­
portiones &longs;uperiùs expo&longs;itas, & po&longs;tea in progre&longs;&longs;u
motus multò magis inter &longs;e differant.

quod profectò

Hinc quoque deducitur imperitia eorum, qui dum

bere non in exiguis, &longs;ed in prolixis de&longs;cen&longs;ibus, &
ideò ob&longs;eruant inæqualitates velocitatum corporum
in aere de&longs;cendentium ab alti&longs;&longs;imis turribus vbi ve­
locitates plumbi, & argillæ valdè differunt inter &longs;e,
cùm tamen in breuioribus altitudinibus nullo &longs;en&longs;u
di&longs;tingui po&longs;&longs;int eorum inæqualitates, cùm ambo eodem
tempore ferri videantur.

Et antequam vlterius pro­
cedamus, afferemus duas experientias contra negan­

quam; & primò in de&longs;cen&longs;u pilam plumbeam feta e­
quina &longs;u&longs;pendi, habentem infernè acum infixam, eamque
demi&longs;i intra aquam in diuer&longs;is altitudinibus à fundo
cera incru&longs;tato, tunc vidi acum profundius ceram pe­
netrare quò à &longs;ublimiori altitudine pila decidebat.

in a&longs;cen&longs;u verò &longs;ump&longs;i leui&longs;&longs;imum calamum an&longs;erinum,
eiu&longs;que infimum orificium fru&longs;to plumbi perfectè
obturaui, atque bacillo demer&longs;i calamum directè in­
fra aquam, in maiori tamen profunditate, quàm eius
naturalis grauitas exigebat, tunc amoto bacillo ca­

&longs;altus, po&longs;tea profundiùs calamum infra a quam de­

&longs;altum &longs;upra aquam calamum effeci&longs;&longs;e, prout à maio­

quia non alia de cau&longs;a calamus &longs;upra aquam po&longs;ilie­

De Vacui Neces&longs;itate.
CAP. XII.

PRæclarè mihi Ari&longs;toteles dixi&longs;&longs;e videtur, Phy&longs;icum
de vacuo agere debere, quia nempè nè dum &longs;citu
iucundum e&longs;t, an detur, & quomodo, & quid &longs;it va­
cuum, &longs;ed etiam vtilis e&longs;t huiu&longs;modi cognitio, vt in­
telligantur innumeræ naturales operationes, & vt
percipiatur quomodo fiant motus nedùm quos in va­
cuo fieri po&longs;&longs;e &longs;uppo&longs;uimus, &longs;ed etiam eos, qui i&ntail;
fluido fiunt.

Vt verò methodicè procedamus, primò declaran­
dum e&longs;t, quid nomine vacui, & inanis intelligamus, &longs;e­
cundò quot modis v&longs;urpari, & concedi po&longs;&longs;it, tertiò
examinabimus ratiocinia, & argumenta eorum, qui
vacuum è rerum natura omninò tollunt, & rande&mtail;
propriam &longs;ententiam pro viribus confirmare nitemur.

PROP. CCXLVII.

Si vacuum &longs;patium ponatur entitas exten&longs;a, & incorpo­
rea debet concedi infinita æterna, & increata.

EVidenti&longs;&longs;ima profectò e&longs;t nedum exi&longs;tentia na­
turæ corporeæ, &longs;ed etiam præcipua eius affectio
in definitione tradita.

Dicimus enim corpus e&longs;&longs;&etail;
&longs;ub&longs;tantiam triplicem exten&longs;ionem, &longs;eu dimen&longs;ionem
habentem, & &longs;patium, quod à prædicto corpore oc­
cupatur plenum vocare &longs;olemus, hoc porrò præiu­
dicium pendet ex eo, quod in interna alicuius va&longs;is
capacitate poni pote&longs;t modò terra, modò aqua, aut
aliud corpus fluidum, &longs;iue den&longs;um, & dicimus prædi­
ctam capacitatem va&longs;is repleri modò ab vno, modo
ab altero corporum prædictorum.

Hinc concipimus
capacitatem illam va&longs;is e&longs;&longs;e quid di&longs;tinctum, & diuer­
&longs;um à corporibus id continentèr replentibus.

Iam ex præ concepta pleni natura, & a&longs;&longs;ection&etail;
&longs;tatim percipimus vacui, &longs;eu inanis naturam in eo con­
&longs;i&longs;tere, vt pr&etail;dicta va&longs;is capacitas careat omninò cor­
pore quolibet à quo repleri poterat.

Hoc verò va­
cuum duplici modo concipi pote&longs;t, aut enim &longs;uppo­
nitur entitas quædam incorporea non tamen indiui­
&longs;ibilis, &longs;ed exten&longs;a, & occupans triplici dimen&longs;ione
vniuer&longs;am va&longs;is pr&etail;dicti capacitatem.

Alio modo con­
cipi pote&longs;t vt mera priuatio corporum, & ab&longs;olutè
nihilum.

priori modo conceditur à Pythagoricis, De­
mocrito, Epicuro, & ab alijs, ratio verò quæ hanc
&longs;ententiam &longs;uadere, & confirmare videtur, e&longs;t qui&atail;
capacitas illa va&longs;is per &longs;e &longs;umpta, à qua &longs;iue re ip&longs;a,
&longs;iue mente remoueatur corpus, idip&longs;um replens, &
occupans, retinere quoque videtur ea&longs;dem dimen­
&longs;iones, &longs;eu potius æquales dimen&longs;ionibus corporis id
replentis, & &longs;ic verificari aiunt corporeas dimen&longs;i­
ones præcisè congruere &longs;patij illius dimen&longs;ionibus;
quia verò concipere &longs;e non po&longs;&longs;e profitentur capaci­
tatem illam, &longs;eu &longs;patium dimen&longs;ionibus omninò pri­
uatum, propterea ip&longs;um entitatem aliquam haber&etail;
licet incorpoream concedunt; con&longs;equenter admit­
tunt nedùm &longs;patiola illa à particulis corporum com­
prehen&longs;a, &longs;ed etiam integra &longs;patia &longs;e parata extra hunc
mundum &longs;en&longs;ibilem.

Sed animaduer&longs;ione dignum e&longs;t
prædictum &longs;patium inane &longs;eparatum admitti debe­
re vndique infinitè expan&longs;um, & exten&longs;um, quia non
e&longs;t maior ratio quare propè extimam mundi corpo­
ream &longs;uperficiem concedatur, & non vlterius in lo­
cis magis, ac magis à prædicta mundi &longs;uperficie &longs;e­
paratis, di&longs;tantibu&longs;que.

Præterea concedenda quo­
que e&longs;t huiu&longs;modi natura, &longs;eu entitas incorporea &longs;pa­
tialis nedum infinita, &longs;ed etiam increata, & æterna;
quandoquidem ante mundi creationem exi&longs;tebant
prædictæ dimen&longs;iones &longs;patiales, &longs;cilicèt olim adhùc
exi&longs;tebat longitudo, latitudo, & profunditas incor­
porea, quod quidem libenti&longs;&longs;imè ab&longs;que vlla repu­
gnantia Antiqui concedebant, vnà cum totius mundi
exi&longs;tentia ab æterno; hoc verò mirum quantum or­
thodoxos huius &longs;ententiæ a&longs;&longs;ertores torqueat, cù&mtail;
cogantur &longs;u&longs;tinere entitatem realem, qualis e&longs;t ill&atail;
&longs;patialis, nedùm in&longs;initè exten&longs;am, &longs;ed etiam ab &etail;ter-
no præexi&longs;tentem, & independentem à Deo Crea­
tore.

Ideò alij cautiores non verentur concedere en­
titatem illam &longs;patialem nedùm finitam, &longs;ed etiam à
Deo ab initio mundi creatam.

Ijs verò opponi &longs;olet,
quod vltra confinium mundi, eiu&longs;que &longs;patij incorpo­
rei, & ante mundum conditum remoueri nequit con­
ceptus exten&longs;ionis incorporeæ intra, & extra &longs;itu&mtail;
in quo modò mundus cum eius &longs;patio conditus e&longs;t,
cumque prædict&etail; dimen&longs;iones non e&longs;&longs;e nihilum fate­
antur, igitur nece&longs;&longs;ariò admitti debet ante mundum
conditum ab æterno, & extra mundum &longs;en&longs;ibile&mtail;
vbique eadem entitas &longs;patialis.

Ex quo proindè &longs;it,
vt &longs;patium inane nullo modo admittendum &longs;it, vel &longs;i
concedatur, nullam entitatem incorpoream haber&etail;
fatendum e&longs;t.

Eatenùs igitur admitti vacuum pote­
rit, quatenùs ab&longs;oluta priuatio, & nihilum concedi­
tur.

Et in hoc &longs;e u&longs;u an reuera admitti po&longs;&longs;it, & de­
beat in natura videbimus.

Cap.
12. d&etail;
vacui nece&longs;­
&longs;itate.

Cap.
12. d&etail;
vacui nece&longs;­
&longs;itate.

Et primò examinari debent rationes Ari&longs;totelis
contra vacui po&longs;itionem, & pro pleni exi&longs;tentia, quæ
habentur 4. phy&longs;ic.
PROP. CCXLVIII.
Soluuntur argumenta Ari&longs;totelis contra vacuum adducta.

COntra Antiquos, qui ponebant vacuum, vt cor­
porum motus in natura fieri po&longs;&longs;ent, ait Ari&longs;t.
Etiam &longs;i nullum &longs;it &longs;patium &longs;eparabile præter corpora, quæ
mouentur motus fieri poterit, quod in continuorum &longs;icut, &
humidorum conuer&longs;ionibus patet.

At huiu&longs;modi in&longs;tantia videtur nedùm in&longs;ufficiens,
&longs;ed etiam nullius roboris, quia licet in motu circu­
lari Rotæ &longs;olidæ non appareat nece&longs;&longs;itas vacui, nihilo­
minus præcipua difficultas e&longs;t non de motu circula­
ri, &longs;ed de motu directo, vel per lineas curuas irregu­
lares in fluido, in quo &longs;en&longs;u non con&longs;tat, neque de­
mon&longs;tratur partes fluidi excurrere intra alias po&longs;&longs;e,
ab&longs;que eo quod mutuò &longs;e &longs;e confricent, inuertantur,
& inter &longs;e innumeras exiguas vacuitates admittant.

imò in po&longs;trema parte huius capitis o&longs;tendemus ne­
ce&longs;&longs;ariam e&longs;&longs;e vacui admi&longs;&longs;ionem, ad hoc, vt fluidum,
vel den&longs;um corpus per fluidum moueri queat; &longs;ed mo­
dò &longs;atis e&longs;t o&longs;tendi&longs;&longs;e non e&longs;&longs;e euidens, nec demon­
&longs;tratum fui&longs;&longs;e, quod in motu facto in fluidis vacuum
nece&longs;&longs;ario non exigatur.

Cap.
12. d&etail;
vacui nece&longs;­
&longs;itate.

Secundò, Vacuum non e&longs;t cau&longs;a motus, &longs;ed Natura, ergo
vacuum non datur.

Cui re&longs;ponderi pote&longs;t, neminem,
ni&longs;i planè delirum, ac &longs;tolidum, &longs;omnia&longs;&longs;e vacuum, &longs;ci­
licèt nihilum, cau&longs;am po&longs;itiuam efficientem motus e&longs;­
&longs;e.

Dixerunt certè Antiqui motum produci à natura,
&longs;iue à qualibet cau&longs;a externa impul&longs;iua, &longs;ed requiri
vacuum veluti locus in quo motus fieri po&longs;&longs;it, igitur
Ari&longs;totelis argumentum nil officit vacui a&longs;&longs;ertoribus.

Tertiò ait: quod accidit dicentibus vacuum e&longs;&longs;e nece&longs;-
&longs;arium, vt motus &longs;it contrarium potiùs, nam dato vacuo nil
in eo moueri po&longs;&longs;et, quia non e&longs;t quo magis, aut minus mouea­
tur, quod namque vacuum e&longs;t, caret omni differentia, &longs;cili­
cèt non habet &longs;ursùm, neque deorsùm, nec ante, nec
retro, &c.

Cui re&longs;ponderi pote&longs;t, quod motus, quate­
nus talis e&longs;t, dicit &longs;olummodò migrationem, & tran-
&longs;itum, qui fieri pote&longs;t nedum in fluido, &longs;ed etiam in
&longs;patio inani, per quamlibet directionem, quam im­
pre&longs;&longs;a vis motiua de&longs;ignauerit, ergo licèt in vacuo di­
rectiones infinit&etail; in eo de&longs;ignabiles non &longs;int deter­
minatæ, nec habeant nomina propria, non proindè
&longs;equitur non po&longs;&longs;e in eo de&longs;ignari, & &longs;ic effici motus
per quamcumque directionem.
Cap. 8.

Cap.
12. d&etail;
vacui nece&longs;­
&longs;itate.

Quartò &longs;ic ait, mouentur proiecta ex eo quod quando non
tanguntur, tunc ob anthipresta&longs;im, aut quia pul&longs;us aer mo­
tu pellit celeriori, quàm &longs;it ea latio pul&longs;i, at in vacuo nihil
horum e&longs;&longs;e potest, neque fit vt quicquam feratur ni&longs;i vt
quod vehitur.

Vt pateat in efficacia argumenti Ari&longs;to­
telis, concedatur, quod in vacuo ob carentiam medij
fluidi proiectio fieri non po&longs;&longs;it, non inde &longs;equitur va­
cuum minimè dari po&longs;&longs;e, nam remaneret &longs;olummodò
motus naturalis in vacuo, & hic vnam cum proiectitio
in pleno fluido fieri po&longs;&longs;et, neque Ari&longs;tot. o&longs;tendit
hoc e&longs;&longs;e ab&longs;urdum.

Omitto fal&longs;i&longs;&longs;imum e&longs;&longs;e proiecta
moueri à medio fluido po&longs;tquam à proijciente de&longs;e­
runtur, &longs;ed à vi motiua ip&longs;is communicata promoue­
ri, vnde &longs;equitur, quòd benè in &longs;patio vacuo proie­
ctio fieri po&longs;&longs;et multò meliùs quàm in &longs;patio pleno
fluido, cum vis motiua proiecto impre&longs;&longs;a nullo pacto
impediatur ab inani &longs;patio, &longs;icuti à medio fluido sun­
mopere impeditur retardaturque.

De vi per­
cu&longs;s.

Quintò, nemo dicere potest propter quid quod mouetur
stabit alicubi, cur enim magis hic, quam alibi; quare aut quie­
&longs;cat, aut in infinitum feratur nece&longs;sè e&longs;t, &longs;i non potentius quic­
piam impedierit.

Re&longs;ponderi pote&longs;t optimè procede-
re argumentum ex eo quod non datur cau&longs;a, nec ra­
tio quare impetus &longs;emel impre&longs;&longs;us mobili retarde­
tur, extinguaturque, & &longs;ic &longs;equitur, quod nullibi &longs;ta­
bit, aut quie&longs;cet, &longs;ed in infinitum mouebitur in va­
cuo, ni&longs;i aliud corpus externum motum eius impe­
diat.

nec video quid incommodi ex hoc &longs;equatur,
vt proinde hac de cau&longs;a &longs;patium vacuum negari de­
beat.

Cap.
12. d&etail;
vacui nece&longs;­
&longs;itate.

Sextò: In vacuo propterea corpora ferri cen&longs;entur, quia
cedit, at vacuum omni ex parte cedit, quare ad omnem par­
tem feretur.

Si h&etail;c ratio valeret, procul dubio, quia aqua maris
æquali facilitate cedit virtuti motiu&etail; pi&longs;cis omni ex
parte, hinc inferre liceret, ergo pi&longs;cis fertur eodem
tempore ad omnem partem, &longs;cilicèt &longs;ursùm, deorsùm,
ante, retro, ad dextram, &longs;ini&longs;tram, &c.

Legitima igi­
tur illatio e&longs;t, quod ex eo quod &longs;patium omni ex par­
te cedit liberum e&longs;t vt mobile per vnamquamlibet
directionem feratur, per eam, &longs;cilicèt per quam im­
pellitur ab eius vi motiua, & &longs;ic nil incommodi &longs;equi­
tur, proindeque vacuum non tollitur.

Reliquis Ari­
&longs;tot. rationibus partim cap.
10. &longs;atisfecimus, partim
verò inferiùs re&longs;pondebimus.

Interim libet mirari, quomodo ex huius farinæ ar­
gumentis tam fixè per&longs;ua&longs;i &longs;int Ari&longs;totelis &longs;ectatores,
vt eorum nonnulli au&longs;i &longs;int a&longs;&longs;erere Deum O. M. &longs;ua
infinita virtute non po&longs;&longs;e in rerum natura &longs;patiolum
aliquod vacuum coaceruare.

Sed procedamus ad argumentum, quod in ore om-
nium recentiorum ver&longs;atur, ex quo euidenti&longs;&longs;imè pa­
tere aiunt vacuum non dari in rerum natura, hoc de­
&longs;umitur ab innumeris experimentis, quibus con&longs;tat
multa corpora moueri contra propriam, & naturalem
inclinationem ad impediendum vacuum, & quando
non ade&longs;t corpus, quod accurrere po&longs;&longs;it ad replendam
&longs;ci&longs;&longs;uram, &longs;iue &longs;patium quod inane remanere debe­
ret, tunc adhibita quacumque vi externa prædict&atail;
di&longs;&longs;olutio, & &longs;ci&longs;&longs;ura vacua creari non pote&longs;t.

Cap.
12. d&etail;
vacui nece&longs;­
&longs;itate.

Vulgaria ex­
perimenta
naturam va­
cuum abhor­
rere proban­
tia.

Et primò &longs;i follium tabellæ comprimantur, aut diabetis,
&longs;eu syringæ embolum v&longs;que ad fundum impellatur,
tunc retrahi non poterunt clau&longs;o infimo orificio, vel
aqua &longs;ubiecta, & contigua contra eius naturam a&longs;cen­
det, ne interceptum &longs;patium inane remaneat.

Id ip&longs;um contingit in antlijs, & machinis cte&longs;ibia­
nis, quæ vulgò Trom bæ &longs;piritales vocantur, in ijs pari­
tèr attracto embolo &longs;imul aqua &longs;ubiecta &longs;ubleuatur.

Secundò in elepsy dra irrigatoria aqua oppleta, &
obturato &longs;uperno ore non defluit aqua per infima a­
perta foraminula, ob vacui timorem, quod intra ca­
uitatem va&longs;is remanere deberet.

Tertiò paritèr è cucurbitula medica &longs;i flamma, vel
alio modo aer excludatur, carnibu&longs;que applicetur,
caro ip&longs;a, & &longs;anguis accurrunt ad replendum illud
&longs;patium.

Ex hi&longs;ce, & alijs huius generis experimentis, pu­
tant euidenti&longs;&longs;imè comprobari, naturam vacuum ab­
hortere, & tantummodò &longs;olliciti &longs;unt de cau&longs;a illius
motus, quo partes vniuer&longs;i accurrunt ad impediendum
vacuum; & in hoc mirum quantum cruciantur, alij
enim aiunt, Deum immediatè, alij Naturam impellere
corpora grauia contra eorum in&longs;itam virtutem ad im­
pediendum vacuum; alij po&longs;tea aiunt partes vni­
uer&longs;i præter propriam vim natiuam habere noua&mtail;
facultatem mouendi &longs;e quoties occa&longs;io exigit, prop­
ter bonum vniuer&longs;i, &longs;cilicèt aqua habet in&longs;itum prin­
cipium grauitatis, quo perpetuò operatur premendo,
& de&longs;cendendo deorsùm, at quotie&longs;cumque nece&longs;­
&longs;itas vrget, vt nimirum contingat periculum &longs;ci&longs;&longs;uræ,
& plagæ vacuæ in vniuer&longs;o, tunc quidem alia nou&atail;
virtus pariter aquæ in&longs;ita eam &longs;ursùm impellit ad hoc,
vt malo vniuer&longs;ali medeatur.

Cap.
12. d&etail;
vacui nece&longs;­
&longs;itate.
PROP. CCXLIX.

Cau&longs;a impellens grauia &longs;ursùm ad replendum vacuum non
e&longs;t Diuina facultas, neque intrin&longs;eca vis anima&longs;tica, vel
naturalis eorumdem corporum.

SI actio immediata Dei admittatur in hoc ca&longs;u, e­
rit procùl dubio operatio miraculo&longs;a non natu­
ralis, nam omnes naturales actiones licet diuinum v­
niuer&longs;al&etail; concur&longs;um exigant, nihilominùs exercen­
tur phy&longs;icis, ac naturalibus in&longs;trumentis, ac organis;
&longs;i verò prædictanoua virtus omnibus corporibus na­
turalibus in&longs;ita cen&longs;eatur, erit profectò facultas non
di&longs;&longs;imilis ei, quæ in animalibus reperitur quandoqui­
dem tanta prudentia medicinam afferre malo vniuer­
&longs;i concipi non pote&longs;t ab&longs;que eo quòd aqua v. g. per­
cipiat, & &longs;entiat malum illud, & deindè moueatur,
conetur que illud impedire; in hoc enim di&longs;&longs;erunt o-
perationes naturales ab anima&longs;ticis, quod illæ cæc&atail;
quadam nece&longs;&longs;itate perpetuò, & ince&longs;&longs;antèr fiunt, non
verò quando nece&longs;&longs;itas exigit, vt compre&longs;&longs;io, & mo­
tus deorsùm grauium &longs;emper exercetur, nec quando
ignis v. g. aquam de&longs;truere conatur, quia vrget ne­
ce&longs;&longs;itas, aqua vnquam aufugit, & periculum euitare
conatur: & in &longs;umma non pote&longs;t excogitari modus
quomodo aqua tunc &longs;olummodo obliui&longs;catur pro­
priæ naturæ, & &longs;ursùm a&longs;cendat quando periculu&mtail;
imminet ne vacuum detur, quod nec aqua percipit,
nec habet organa, aut in&longs;trumenta apta ad exerendam
hanc nouam operationem in illo ca&longs;u tantùm nece&longs;&longs;i­
tatis, & toto reliquo tempore id non curet, & &longs;uam
propriam grauitatem exerceat.

Cap.
12. d&etail;
vacui nece&longs;­
&longs;itate.
PROP. CCL.

O&longs;tenditur fallacia argumenti in&longs;inuantis naturam vacuum
abhorrere.

VIdendum modò e&longs;t in quonam con&longs;i&longs;tat defe­
ctus ratiocinij peripatetici, cùm aiunt, &longs;e vi­
dere &longs;emper corpora naturalia accurrere ad impedi­
endum vacuum, etiam&longs;i oporteat, contra eorum natu­
ram moueri, ergo vacuum ab ip&longs;a natura abhorretur.

Non negatur, id, quod &longs;en&longs;ibus patet, nempè aquam
a&longs;cendere quotie&longs;cumque &longs;patium &longs;upremum exi­
nanitur, &longs;ed negatur aquam &longs;ponte &longs;ua &longs;ursùm a&longs;cen­
dere propter illum finem, &longs;cilicèt vt vacuum impedi­
at.

& profectò numquam certi e&longs;&longs;e po&longs;&longs;umus, an aqua
&longs;ponte &longs;ursùm feratur in illo ca&longs;u nece&longs;&longs;itatis, ni&longs;i con­
&longs;tet tunc eam ab alia cau&longs;a externa non impelli &longs;ursùm,
hoc autem Peripatetici numquam probarunt.

& &longs;i re­
uerà aqua in tali ca&longs;u impelleretur ab aliqua cau&longs;&atail;
phy&longs;ica &longs;ursùm, tunc non per &longs;e, &longs;ed per accidens
accurreret ad replendam illam inanitatem; per &longs;e ve­
rò moueretur ob nece&longs;&longs;itatem violentiæ, & impul&longs;us,
quem ei infert cau&longs;a impellens.

Cap.
12. d&etail;
vacui nece&longs;­
&longs;itate.

Quod, vt clariùs percipiatur, in bilance apponantur
duo pondera inæqualia, & minori ponderi &longs;uperpo­
natur palma manus à qua flexio libræ prohibeatur,
procùl dubio &longs;en&longs;im &longs;ubleuata manu minus pondus
pariter &longs;ubleuabitur manui adhærendo; tunc &longs;i ex eo
quod minus pondus a&longs;cendere videtur, quis inferret
proptèr bonum vniuer&longs;i idip&longs;um graue obliui&longs;ci pro­
pri&etail; natur&etail;, & &longs;ursùm accurrere ad replendum &longs;pa­
tium, prauè profectò, & peruersè ratiocinaretur,
propterea quòd a&longs;cen&longs;us producitur à cau&longs;a phy&longs;ica,
& nece&longs;&longs;aria, nempè à maiori pondere contrapo&longs;ito;
finge modò maius pondus in prædicta bilance obue­
latum e&longs;&longs;e, tunc &longs;i aliundè con&longs;tet euidentèr ibi ope­
rari maius pondus, licèt incon&longs;picuum &longs;it, nonne ridiculum
e&longs;&longs;et confugere ad miracula, & ad machinas, tribuen­
do | &longs;en&longs;um, & perceptionem prudentem minori pon­
deri &longs;ubleuato, vt velit medicinam afferre imminenti
malo vniuer&longs;i; igitur tota va&longs;ta moles horum argumen­
torum in nihilum abibit, &longs;i o&longs;tenderimus aquam, &
cætera grauia quando a&longs;cendunt ad replendum vacuum
verè, & realitèr impelli in bilance, vel &longs;iphone à maiori
pondere contrapo&longs;ito, quod &longs;emper ade&longs;t, & opera­
tur in tali ca&longs;u, & &longs;ic a&longs;cen&longs;us cum habeat causam nece&longs;-
&longs;ariam, non poterit tribui prudenti illi cognitioni, &longs;eù
potiùs chimæricæ.

Cap.
12. d&etail;
vacui nece&longs;­
&longs;itate.
PROP. CCLI.

In &longs;iphone inuer&longs;o retracto embolo aqua a&longs;cendit non &longs;pontè,
&longs;ed impul&longs;a à maiori pondere, vel momento aquæ alteri­
us brachij &longs;iphonis.

VT que hoc quanta fieri pote&longs;t per&longs;picuitate
o&longs;tendamus, intelligatur &longs;ipho ABCD aqua
repletus, cuius crura AB, & DC perpendicularitèr ad
horizontem erecta &longs;int, tunc embolum cum &longs;uo a&longs;&longs;ario
EFG, & cum fi&longs;tula DC &longs;yringam compleat, & immi&longs;&longs;o
embolo intra fi&longs;tulam quou&longs;que eius ba&longs;is FG fundum
fi&longs;tulæ C attingat, tunc patet, quòd aqua BC officium
bilancis &longs;upplet, in cuius extremo B &longs;uperponitur mo­
les aquæ grauis AB, alteri ve­
rò extremitati C exigua aquæ
laminula FC imminet, & pro­
indè &longs;i reliqua eius portio FD
v&longs;que ad horizontalem AD,
e&longs;&longs;et vel aere repleta, vel om­
ninò exinanita, & vacua, pro­
cùl dubio aqua FC &longs;ursum a&longs;cen­
deret versùs D, non quidem &longs;ponte &longs;ua, &longs;ed impul&longs;a à
maiori contrapo&longs;ito pondere aquæ AB; propterea
quod in libra imaginaria fluida BC pars B magis pre&longs;­
&longs;a à maiori pondere imminentis aquæ AB expellere
&longs;ursùm debet minùs grauem aquæ molem FC, quou&longs;­
que ad æquilibrium in plano horizontali AD perdu­
catur; his præmi&longs;&longs;is retrahatur embolum EFG &longs;ursùm
vt nimirùm eius ba&longs;is FG perducatur ad summitatem fi­
&longs;tulæ D, ita tamen vt perfectè a&longs;&longs;arium FG contingat
internam fi&longs;tulæ &longs;uperficiem, vt ne rimula quidem re­
maneat per quam aeri &longs;upremo ingre&longs;&longs;us pateat; tunc
in &longs;patio FD, neque aer, neque aliud corpus remane­
ret, dum contrapo&longs;ita fi&longs;tula AB e&longs;t plena aquæ, & hæc
procùl dubio &longs;ua naturali grauitate impellet &longs;ursùm
aquam ab F v&longs;que ad D, nulla alia de cau&longs;a, ni&longs;i quia
in bilance BC maius pondus aquæ AB impellere &longs;ur­
sùm debet contrapo&longs;itum minus pondus.

& ratio e&longs;t quia non pote&longs;t in
dubium reuocari cau&longs;a phy&longs;ica, & realis, quæ author
e&longs;t huius operationis, nempè maius pondus contra­
po&longs;itæ aquæ AB, quæ in &longs;iphone, & bilance nece&longs;&longs;ita­
te mechanica apta nata e&longs;t impellere &longs;ursùm aquam
FC v&longs;que ad D.
Cor. pro.

Cap.
12. d&etail;
vacui nece&longs;­
&longs;itate.
PROP. CCLII.

Si in syringa intra puteum demer&longs;a embolum ab eius fundo
&longs;ursùm retrahatur, aqua &longs;ubiecta a&longs;cendet, non quidem
ob metum vacui, &longs;ed neces&longs;itate mechanica à pondere co­
lumnæ aquæ collateralis impul&longs;a.

SI po&longs;tea non v&longs;urpetur &longs;ipho &longs;olidus ABCD, &longs;ed
tantummodò ænea syringa EDC, & hæc intra pu­
teum RSTV perpendicularitèr ad horizontem or&etail;
deorsùm vergente immittatur, quou&longs;que infimu&mtail;
eius orificium C propè fundum putei perducatur, tunc
quia aqua intra cauitatem syringæ CF non pote&longs;t e­
leuari, ni&longs;i aqua collateralis IB de­
&longs;cendat ad replendum &longs;patium &longs;ub­
iectum ab aqua FC relictum; nec
&longs;ieri pote&longs;t, vt illa portio aqu&etail; col­
lateralis fundo syringæ proxim&atail;
IB deprimatur quin &longs;ub&longs;equentes
partes ei perpendicularitèr immi­
nentes AI con&longs;e quutiuo motu om­
nes vna po&longs;t aliam deprimantur,
quou&longs;que ad &longs;upremam libella&mtail;
aquæ RV perueniatur: itaque in hoc ca&longs;u ad&longs;unt ve­
luti duæ columnæ, vna aquea AIB, quæ deor&longs;um pre­
mit, ac fertur, reliqua verò e&longs;t portio aquæ CF vnà
cum embolo FE, & aqua imminente EH, quæ contra­
rio motu &longs;ursùm &longs;upponitur ferri; ambæ verò prædi­
ctæ columnæ innituntur, &longs;u&longs;tentanturque ab infima la­
mina aquea BC, quæ officium libræ &longs;applet; & &longs;iqui­
dem momenta quibus extremitates fluidæ libræ BC
premuntur à prædictis columnis AB, & HC fuerint
inter &longs;e æqualia, tunc procul dubio fiet æquilibrium,
& quies, nec vna earum à reliqua columna &longs;ursùm ex­
pelletur; at &longs;i è fundo syringæ embolum EFG retra­
hatur &longs;ursùm v&longs;que ad D, procùl dubio nece&longs;&longs;itat&etail;
mechanica aqua &longs;ubiecta CF &longs;ursùm per syringæ ca­
uitatem a&longs;cendet, &longs;emper a&longs;&longs;ario FG adhærendo, non
quidem ob vacui metum, &longs;ed quia impellitur à con­
trapo&longs;ito maiori pondere columnæ aqueæ AB.

PROP. CCLIII.

Ii&longs;dem po&longs;itis &longs;i præterea infimum syringæ orificium infra
mercurium in catino contentum mergatur, retracto em­
bolo mercurius a&longs;cendet non ob vacui metum, &longs;cd impul­
&longs;us à pondere columnæ aquæ collateralis.

SI deinde in fundo putei RSTV ponatur catinum
MNO hydrargyro plenum, infra cuius libellam
MO orificium infimum C &longs;yrin­
gæ immittatur, tunc paritèr re­
tracto embolo EFG mercurius
in &longs;yringa CD a&longs;cendet, non qui­
dem &longs;ponte ad replendum va­
cuum, &longs;ed impul&longs;us à maiori pon­
dere columnæ aqueæ AB, & eò
v&longs;que mercurij eleuatio per&longs;e­
uerabit, quou&longs;que fiat æquili­
brium inter momentum aquæ, &
mercurium, &longs;cilicèt &longs;i altitudo columnæ aqueæ AB
fuerit 18. cubitorum, oportet, vt altitudo æquè am­
plæ columnæ mercurij &longs;it cubitorum duorum, & &longs;e­
mis proximè, & hæc e&longs;t &longs;umma altitudo ad qua&mtail;
mercurius in prædicta syringa eleuari pote&longs;t, at &longs;i vl­
terius vi manus embolum &longs;ubleuetur, per&longs;i&longs;tet tamen
per&longs;euerabitque mercurius in priori illa altitudine,
& potius &longs;patium exinanitum, ide&longs;t ab&longs;que mercurio, &
ab&longs;que aqua, & aere relinquet, quàm mercurius pilum
fubleuetur.

& hinc nedum deducitur, quod mercurius
a&longs;cendit quatenus, & quou&longs;que impellitur ab oppo­
&longs;ito pondere fluidi AB, &longs;ed præterea con&longs;tat, quòd non
a&longs;cendit &longs;ponte ad replendum &longs;patium priuatum, &longs;eu
vacuum mercurio, cùm prædictum limitem cubitorum
duorum, & &longs;emis non prætergrediatur, nec &longs;ollicitus
&longs;it, quòd &longs;uperius &longs;patium mercurio vacuum remaneat.

PROP. CCLIV.

In omnibus experimentis aduer&longs;ariorum o&longs;tenditur violentèr
impelli fluidum &longs;ursùm, & per accidens accurrere ad re­
plendum vacuum.

ID quod diximus de aqua, verificari quoque in aere
&longs;atis &longs;uperque con&longs;tat ex &longs;uperiùs dictis.

Propte­
rea quòd aer non minus, quàm aqua grauis e&longs;t, & in
&longs;uamet regione pondus, & grauitatem exercet &longs;upra
fluida corpora &longs;ubiecta; proindeque in aere non minùs
quàm in aqua libra, & &longs;ipho exercentur, in quo æqui­
librium effici pote&longs;t; quare retracto embolo in &longs;yrin­
ga aqua &longs;ubiecta non attrahitur, neque &longs;ugitur, neque
ip&longs;a &longs;ponte eleuatur a&longs;&longs;ario adhærendo, ob vacui me­
tum, &longs;ed quia à maiori pondere colúmnæ aereæ infimo
fluido incumbentis eumque prementis, nece&longs;&longs;itate me­
chanica, aqua intra &longs;yringam in&longs;inuatur, & per accidens
contingit, vt aqua accurrere videatur ad replendum
&longs;patium inane.

Idemque prorsùs dicendum e&longs;t de an­
tlijs, ac machinis Cte&longs;ibianis, & de medicis cucurbi­
tulis, vt cap.
6. &longs;atis &longs;uperque declarauimus.

Quòd verò tabellæ follium po&longs;t compre&longs;&longs;ionem ob­
turato foramine difficile di&longs;trahantur, & &longs;ic du&etail; la­
min&etail; vitre&etail; &longs;e tangentes, non inde &longs;equitur timor, &
ab ominium vacui, nam hoc contingit ex eo quòd gra­
uitas aeris ambientis, premendo &longs;ubiectam partem
fluidi, qu&etail; libram con&longs;tituit, non permittit, vt tabellæ
facilè di&longs;trahantur, nam in earum &longs;eparatione creari
debet &longs;patium inane, & ideò minoris ponderis quàm
&longs;it illud quo columna fluidi collateralis premit &longs;ub­
iectam libram fluidam, & proinde infima tabella im­
pellitur &longs;ursùm versùs &longs;upremam, vt ei adhæreat.

non
tamen prædicta adhæ&longs;io, & vnio tabellarum e&longs;t im­
men&longs;æ energiæ, vt inexperti Peripatetici cen&longs;ent,
præcisè enim æquat vim ponderis columnæ fluidæ
collateralis &longs;ua pre&longs;&longs;ione infimam tabellam &longs;ubleuan­
tis, & tunc &longs;i maiori vi, quàm &longs;it prædictum pondus
fluidæ columnæ vrgeas retrahendo tabellas, procùl
dubio ab inuicem &longs;eparantur, vt experientia docet.
