12. d&etail;
vacui nece&longs;­
&longs;itate.

Argumentum
Ari&longs;totel. &
Carte&longs;ij con­
tra vacuum.

O&longs;ten&longs;a nullitate præcipuorum argumentorum,
quæ à Peripateticis afferri &longs;olent contra vacui exi&longs;ten­
tiam, debet tandem ad examen reuocari argumentum
valdè exaggeratum ab aliquibus recentioribus, quod
tamen antiquitùs leui&longs;&longs;imè Ari&longs;toteles innuerat, &
&longs;aniores Peripatetici non valdè ip&longs;um exaggerarunt,
for&longs;an exi&longs;timantes non e&longs;&longs;e tanti roboris, vt compa­
rari po&longs;&longs;it rationibus &longs;uperiùs adductis.

Dixerat Ari­
&longs;toteles cubum intra aquam immi&longs;&longs;um expellere &longs;ibi

æqualem molem aquæ ab eo loco in quo cubus repo­
ni debet, in vacuo autem id non contingere, proinde­
que &longs;patium vacuum non dari, quandoquidem trinam
dimen&longs;ionem haberet, ideoquè corpus e&longs;&longs;et, & &longs;ic pe­
netraretur à corpore ip&longs;ius cubi, quod e&longs;t impo&longs;&longs;ibi­
le.

Hanc ratiunculam in angulo phy&longs;ices Ari&longs;totelis
repo&longs;itam ad auras reuocauit Renatus Carte&longs;ius, eiu&longs;-
que a&longs;&longs;eclæ.

Inquiunt enim corpus e&longs;&longs;e rem exten&longs;am, &longs;ci­
licèt præditam longitudine, latitudine, & profundi­
tate, vnde vbicumque ponitur exten&longs;io, nece&longs;&longs;ariò
corpus &longs;ub&longs;tantiale admitti debere: hinc &longs;equitur
nullo pacto concedi po&longs;&longs;e &longs;patium denudatum priua­
tumque corpore &longs;ub&longs;tantiali, cùm dari non po&longs;&longs;it ex­
ten&longs;io &longs;eparata à corporibus phy&longs;icis, & ideò aiunt,
quòd quicumque &longs;patium vacuum admittit nece&longs;&longs;a­
riò in eodem vacuo conce&longs;&longs;o rem, &longs;eu &longs;ub&longs;tantiam ex­
ten&longs;am, &longs;cilicèt corpus concedat nece&longs;sè e&longs;t, propte­
rea adeò verum e&longs;t vacuum e&longs;&longs;e impo&longs;&longs;ibile, vt is, qui
ip&longs;um admittit eodem &longs;piritu idip&longs;um neget.

Hoc
porrò argumentum tantæ energiæ, & tanti robo­
ris e&longs;&longs;e prædicti Authores cen&longs;ent, vt mirentur, mi&longs;e­
reanturque debilitatem intellectus eorum, qui huic
argumento non acquie&longs;cunt, & manus non dant.

vacui nece&longs;­

PROP. CCLV.

Dimen&longs;iones, quæ &longs;patio vacuo tribuuntur, non &longs;unt reales,
&longs;ed meræ negationes, & priuationes.

HVic obiectioni re&longs;ponderi po&longs;&longs;e mihi videtur,
quod ill&etail;, quæ dimen&longs;iones vocantur in va­
cuo non &longs;unt, neque reales, neque po&longs;itiuæ, &longs;ed me­
ræ priuationes, & negationes, &longs;cilicèt deficit in tali
loco tanta longitudo, tanta latitudo, & tanta profun­
ditas, quandoquidem ibidem deficit corpus, quod
rem, &longs;eu &longs;ub&longs;tantiam exten&longs;am e&longs;&longs;e de finitum e&longs;t: pa­
ritèr fal&longs;um e&longs;t prædictum vacuum men&longs;urari po&longs;&longs;e,
cùm nihilum nullam dimen&longs;ionem men&longs;urabilem ha­
beat, &longs;ed tantummodò intellectus no&longs;ter fictione
quadam, & fallaci imaginatione applicat, tribuit­
que conceptum plenitudinis ip&longs;i vacuo, &longs;cilicèt ap­
plicat conceptum, & imaginationem dimen&longs;ionum
eorumque men&longs;uram vbi reuera deficit prædicta men­
&longs;ura; ex quo deducitur e&longs;&longs;e merum figmentum, & me­
ram deceptionem, & fallaciam intellectus, qui nullo
pacto &longs;poliari pote&longs;t idea, & conceptu plenitudinis,
& corporis, & quantumcumque nitatur eam remo­
uere, &longs;emper in eius idea, & imaginatione ver&longs;atur
phanta&longs;ia, & imago entitatis cuiu&longs;dam omni ex parte ex­
ten&longs;æ.

Quod porrò nece&longs;&longs;arium e&longs;&longs;e videtur, nam cùm
nihil in intellectu concipi, aut exi&longs;tere po&longs;&longs;it, quod
priùs à &longs;en&longs;ibus non hau&longs;tum &longs;it; &longs;en&longs;us verò nonni&longs;i
res vndequa que exten&longs;as, & corporeas ab ip&longs;o ortu
per totam ætatem percipiat; hinc e&longs;t quòd nunquam
intellectus quantumcumque nitatur, ideam, &longs;eu ima­
ginem incorpoream, & dimen&longs;ionibus carentem &longs;ibi
effingere queat; quia nimirum quando per illationem
quamdam nititur ab imagine, & phanta&longs;ia corporea
progredi ad ideam incorporei, & vacui, tunc conatur
eam quodammodò extenuare, expandere, ac rarefa­
cere, vt &longs;ic per gradus ad conceptum vacui incorpo­
rei perueniat; at hoc numquam a&longs;&longs;e qui pote&longs;t, qui&atail;
&longs;emper eius conceptus &longs;i&longs;titur in aliqua imagine, &longs;eù
phanta&longs;ia nebulæ, &longs;eu auræ rari&longs;&longs;imæ, & valdè expan­
&longs;æ, nunquam autem vltra limites exten&longs;ionis corpo­
reæ tran&longs;cendere valet.

& hinc fit vt quotie&longs;cumque
&longs;ub&longs;tantiam quamdam &longs;piritualem, veluti anima e&longs;t,
vel Angelus, contemplari conamur, tunc quidem per-
petuo menti obuer&longs;atur phanta&longs;ia quædam tenui&longs;&longs;i­
mæ auræ, aut alterius &longs;imilis rei, quæ limites corpo­
reos numquam progreditur.

Nec &longs;olummodò in hoc
percipitur humanæ imaginationis imbecillitas, &longs;ed
etiam in comprehen&longs;ione infiniti, & indiui&longs;ibilis.

Itaque quando vacuum cogitamus id quod verè con­
cipimus ab&longs;que hallucinatione, e&longs;t, quod &longs;i &longs;patiu&mtail;
vacuum e&longs;&longs;et plenum haberet profectò tantam dimen­
&longs;ionem longitudinis, latitudinis, atque profundita­
tis, & hoc patet ex eò quòd non pote&longs;t concipi men­
&longs;ura &longs;patij alicuius vacui ab&longs;que eo quòd intellectus
ibidem concipiat, vel filum, vel virgam, vel rem ali­
quam corpoream, quæ quatenus corpus e&longs;t, habet ve­
ram dimen&longs;ionem; at &longs;i loquamur de vacuo quatenùs
tale e&longs;t, in eo prorsùs negari debent, & tolli omnes
dimen&longs;iones, per&longs;uaderique debemur prædictu&mtail;
&longs;patium inane carere, &longs;eu non habere longitudinem
viginti cubitorum v. g. &longs;cilicèt e&longs;&longs;e prorsùs nihilum.

12. d&etail;
vacui nece&longs;­
&longs;itate.

Cap.
12. d&etail;
vacui nece&longs;­
&longs;itate.

Neque nouum e&longs;t in phy&longs;icis, ac mathematicis con­
&longs;iderare naturas, & proprietates quantitatum, &
numerorum defectiuorum, qui vulgò vocantur, mi­
nus nihilo; hos profectò ne dum men&longs;urari, &longs;ed etiam di­
uidi, & multiplicari po&longs;&longs;e certum e&longs;t, nihilominùs con­
&longs;tat meras priuationes, & negationes e&longs;&longs;e, nec vllam
entitatem habere.

Præterea vulgatum e&longs;t, quòd dimen&longs;iones pur&etail;, &
ab&longs;que &longs;ubiecto nullam exi&longs;tentiam in natura habent
ni&longs;i in imaginatione, & phanta&longs;ia no&longs;tra, &longs;ed tantum­
modò reperiuntur in natura res exten&longs;æ &longs;cilicèt &longs;ub-
&longs;tantiæ corporeæ; qua proptèr in vacuo vbi, ope intel­
lectus, vel à potentia Diuina, tollitur corpus, &longs;cilicèt
res exten&longs;a remanere non po&longs;&longs;unt exten&longs;iones ill&etail;, &longs;ci­
licet longitudo, latitudo, & profunditas, &longs;ed &longs;olum­
modò priuatio, & negatio earumdem, quæ tolluntur
vnà cum re exten&longs;a, nempè cum corpore.

Cap.
12. d&etail;
vacui nece&longs;­
&longs;itate.
PROP. CCLVI.

Dimen&longs;iones &longs;patij &longs;eparati, quæ extra mundum concipiendæ
&longs;unt, meræ priuationes poni debent.

HÆc eadem doctrina attentè con&longs;iderata non vi­
detur recedere à communi Peripatetico con­
ceptu; immò expre&longs;sè eam'affirmare tenentur, nam ex
Ari&longs;totele mundus finitus e&longs;t, comprehenditurque à
perfecti&longs;&longs;ima figura &longs;phærica; igitur extra mundum
vacuum concedant nece&longs;sè e&longs;t, quandoquidem ibi
deficit corpus, nempè res exten&longs;a, e&longs;tque tale &longs;patium
extra mundum men&longs;urabile cubitis, & palmis, cum ne­
dum Intellectu, &longs;ed etiam Author naturæ pote&longs;t ibidem
reponere virgam quatuor cubitorum longitudinem
habentem, igitur prædictum &longs;patium &longs;eparatum extra
mundum, & omninò corpore priuatum, &longs;cilicèt ab&longs;que
re exten&longs;a men&longs;urari nihilominùs pote&longs;t.

quid ergo
prohibet, & quare tantoperè horrent, vt &longs;i ab hac aula
omninò corpus tolleretur prædictum &longs;patium vacuum
cubitis, & palmis men&longs;urari po&longs;&longs;et?

Immò contra ip&longs;os
retorquere argumentum po&longs;&longs;em dicendo, illa longitudo
quatuor cubitorum extra mundum e&longs;tne vera dimen­
&longs;io an non?

&longs;i negant, potero ego quoque de hac aula,
&longs;i e&longs;&longs;et vacua, eodem modo affirmare eius longitudinem
men&longs;urabilem non e&longs;&longs;e veram dimen&longs;ionem, &longs;ed tan­
tummodò eius priuationem, & negationem, &longs;eù ni­
hilum.

At &longs;i dicent illam longitudinem 4. cubitorum
extra mundum e&longs;&longs;e verè dimen&longs;ionem, dicam ego: igi­
tur vos quoque admittitis accidens nempè quantitatem
&longs;ine &longs;ubiecto, &longs;cilicèt ab&longs;que &longs;ub&longs;tantia corporea,
quod &longs;i ab &longs;ur dum e&longs;t, debent quoque eadem mea re­
&longs;pon&longs;ione difficultati occurrere.

Et hoc profectò
videtur expre&longs;sè ab Ari&longs;totele concedi, cum ait extra
mundum non dari nec locum, nec tempus, &longs;cilicèt ibidem
non reperiri dimen&longs;iones, præter eas quas intellectus
fal&longs;a imaginatione ibi fingit, quod perinde e&longs;t, ac af­
firmare prædictas dimen&longs;iones extra mundum e&longs;&longs;e
meras priuationes, & negationes, &longs;cilicèt ibidem de­
ficere tantam longitudinem, quantam haberet cor­
pus aliquod &longs;ub&longs;tantiale, quod ibidem collocatum
fui&longs;&longs;et, & modò ibi dee&longs;t.

Cap.
12. d&etail;
vacui nece&longs;­
&longs;itate.

Po&longs;trema in&longs;tantia, quæ &longs;olet afferri contra vacuum
talis e&longs;t, tam impo&longs;&longs;ibile e&longs;t concipere aulam hanc
vacuam, & prorsùs corpore priuatam, vt nece&longs;sè &longs;it
concedere eius parietes oppo&longs;itos, & di&longs;cretos &longs;e &longs;e
mutuo tangere, propterea quod ea dicuntur &longs;e &longs;&etail;
tangere, inter quæ nil intermediat, cumque inter pa­
rietes oppo&longs;itos prædictæ aulæ nihil intercedat, &longs;pa­
tium enim vacuum nullam entitatem habere &longs;uppo­
nitur; igitur parietes huius aulæ &longs;e mutuò tangerent,
quod e&longs;t fal&longs;um.

Econtra ea corpora dicimus inter &longs;e di&longs;tare inter
quæ aliquid intermediat, cum igitur parietes prædi-
ctæ aulæ inanis concedantur inter &longs;e di&longs;tare, igitur
nece&longs;&longs;ariò inter eos aliquid intermediet nece&longs;sè e&longs;t,
proindeque &longs;patium interceptum non erit vacuum.

Cap.
12. d&etail;
vacui nece&longs;­
&longs;itate.
PROP. CCLVII.

Fal&longs;um est &longs;olummodò ea &longs;e tangere, inter quæ nihil inter­
mediat, ni&longs;i eorum extremitates coniunctæ fuerint.

HVic argumento re&longs;pondetur, verum non e&longs;&longs;&etail;,
quòd ea &longs;e mutuò tangant, inter quæ nihil in­
termediat, &longs;ed requiritur altera conditio ad hoc vt
contactus fiat, &longs;cilicèt vt extrema corporum, quæ &longs;e
mutuò tangere debent, &longs;int &longs;imul vnita, & coniuncta,
ide&longs;t eorum extremitates in eodem &longs;itu &longs;patij mun­
dani exi&longs;tant, quando verò hæc conditio deficit, &longs;ci­
licèt quando exi&longs;tunt in diuer&longs;is locis, & eorum ex­
tremitates non &longs;unt &longs;imul, tunc non &longs;e tangunt du­
plici de cau&longs;a, aut quia inter ea intercipitur aliud
corpus, nempè aer, aut aqua, aut quia &longs;eparantur ab
ip&longs;omet nihilo, &longs;eù vacuo, & in vtroque ca&longs;u ratio
quare non tanguntur e&longs;t quia termini eorum non sunt
coniuncti, atque vniti.

Vnde patet nullitas huius ar­
gumenti.
PROP. CCLVIII.

Nulla ratio &longs;uadet mundum corporeum infinitum ponere,
vt vacuum omninò reijciatur.

SAtis &longs;uperque percipio ante præmi&longs;&longs;am propo&longs;i­
tionem conuincere nedùm Peripateticos, &longs;ed
etiam eos omnes, qui mundum finitum e&longs;&longs;e concedunt,
non verò eos qui mundi vniuer&longs;itatem corporea&mtail;
infinitam, & vndique exten&longs;am e&longs;&longs;e &longs;ibi &longs;ua&longs;erunt,
inter quos recen&longs;eri videtur Carte&longs;ius, qui ait &longs;ub­
&longs;tantiam corpoream indefinitè exten&longs;am mundu&mtail;
habere, & licèt non vtatur voce, infiniti, idem nihi­
lominùs dicere videtur, ni&longs;i nos ludit, aut decipit;
nam inter finitum, & infinitum medium non datur,
quòd nimirùm maius &longs;it finito, & minus infinito, cùm
quicquid infinitum non e&longs;t nece&longs;&longs;ariò terminos ha­
bere debeat; præterea idip&longs;um ex eius verbis elici­
tur, nullos enim exten&longs;ionis fines habere, idem e&longs;t
prorsùs, ac infinitum e&longs;&longs;e, vtraque enim phra&longs;i nega­
tur vniuer&longs;itati corporeæ finis, aut terminus.

& licèt
&longs;e excu&longs;ent dicendo &longs;e non percipere mundum cor­
poreum finitum e&longs;&longs;e po&longs;&longs;e, in hoc iterum nos deci­
piunt, nam e&longs;t prorsùs impo&longs;&longs;ibile vt intellectus
humanus percipiat, & capiat entitatem infinitam, quan­
doquidem imagines, &longs;eùideas corporum finitas quas
&longs;en&longs;ibus hau&longs;it licèt conetur ampliare, augere, & ex­
tendere quocumque conatu, &longs;emper tamen concep­
tus, & phanta&longs;ia in aliqua idæa vndique terminis clau­
&longs;a permanet, & in &longs;umma limites infinitatis ne per
&longs;omnium quidem attingere pote&longs;t.

veri&longs;&longs;imumqu&etail;
e&longs;t, quod dici &longs;olet, quod quotie&longs;cumque infinitum
affirmamus, tunc quidem rei quam non capimus no­
men ob&longs;curum, & incompertæ &longs;ignificationis tribui­
mus; verum vt proferam id, quod &longs;entio videtur Car­
te&longs;ius a&longs;&longs;erui&longs;&longs;e mundi corporei infinitatem non ab
aliqua firma ratione ductus, &longs;ed ne di&longs;&longs;entiret à præ­
iudicio facto, quod &longs;patium inane dari non po&longs;&longs;et,
propterea quod &longs;patium, &longs;cilicèt dimen&longs;iones nece&longs;-
&longs;ariò exi&longs;tentiam &longs;ub&longs;tantiæ corporeæ includere, &
indicare credebat, neque &longs;uaderi potuit fieri po&longs;&longs;e,
vt dimen&longs;iones quas in &longs;patio inani imaginamur &longs;int
non quid reale, & &longs;ub&longs;tantiale, &longs;ed merè ens fictum,
& verè nihilum.

Cap.
12. d&etail;
vacui nece&longs;­
&longs;itate.

Cap.
12. d&etail;
vacui nece&longs;­
&longs;itate.

Alij aiunt à vacuo impediri diffu&longs;ionem lucis, &
influxuum cele&longs;tium: præterea partes vniuer&longs;i null&atail;
alia de cau&longs;a partes eius cen&longs;eri, ni&longs;i quia vnitatem, &
perfectionem mundi con&longs;tituunt, hæ verò &longs;i diui&longs;æ
e&longs;&longs;ent per vacuum partes eius non e&longs;&longs;ent, quare va­
cuum quatenus mundi vnitatem perfectionemqu&etail;
di&longs;&longs;oluit, dari non po&longs;&longs;e concludunt.

Nona argu­
menta con­
tra vacuum

Re&longs;ponderi pote&longs;t benè in vacuo diffu&longs;ionem lu­
cis, & influxuum fieri po&longs;&longs;e; nam per vacuum motus
corporum fieri diximus, quibus prædictæ actiones
perfici queunt; præterea nego mundi vniuer&longs;itatem
continuam partium vnionem habere nece&longs;&longs;ariò de­
bere, poterit enim vocari mundus perfectus, & vnus
licet plures porulos vacuos habeat, &longs;icuti animal per­
fectum, & vnum dicimus licet non &longs;it omninò conti­
nuum, & habeat innumeras poro&longs;itates.

Tandem recentiores aliqui ad hominem contr&atail;
vacui a&longs;&longs;ertores &longs;ic arguunt.

Si aer nulla alia de cau&longs;a
conden&longs;atur, & rarefit, ni&longs;i quia vacua intercepta,
aut &longs;trictiora, aut ampliora efficiuntur, cum aer inef­
fabilem rarefactionem, & conden&longs;ationem patiatur,
eo quod in &longs;tatu rari&longs;&longs;imo occupet &longs;patium ferè bis
millies maius quam in &longs;tatu maximæ conden&longs;ationis,
&longs;equitur quod pars &longs;olida, & plena aeris &longs;it vna pars
bis mille&longs;ima &longs;patij vacui ab eo occupati, hoc autem
videtur impo&longs;&longs;ibile.

Cap.
12. d&etail;
vacui nece&longs;­
&longs;itate.
PROP. CCLIX.

Ex ingenti &longs;patio inani in particulis aeris contento non euin­
citur vacui impos&longs;ibilitas.

RE&longs;pondetur primò non e&longs;&longs;e nece&longs;&longs;arium vt vni­
uer&longs;um &longs;patium intra aeris particulas conten­
tum &longs;it prorsùs inane, po&longs;&longs;unt enim ibidem innume­
ræ particulæ corporeæ ramo&longs;æ, & &longs;olutæ exi&longs;tere, &
vagari, vt &longs;unt exhalationes aqueæ, terreæ, igneæ,
& innumeræ aliæ.

Secundò licèt prædictæ corporeæ particulæ, &
exhalationes in aere non ade&longs;&longs;ent, non proinde e&longs;­
&longs;et impo&longs;&longs;ibilis exce&longs;&longs;us ille &longs;patij vacui &longs;upra plenam
aeris partem; nam, vt &longs;upra dictum e&longs;t, valdè proba­
bile e&longs;t aeris particulas habere figuram tubi, &longs;eu &longs;pi­
ræ ramo&longs;æ, quæ nedùm bis mille&longs;imum &longs;oliditatis,
&longs;ed multò maius &longs;patium comprehendere queant,
cuius rei non de&longs;unt exempla in natura, ampullæ e­
nim aqueæ, quas pueri efformare &longs;olent incompara­
bile maius &longs;patium cauum comprehendunt, qua&mtail;
&longs;it &longs;olida aquæ pars.

Idip&longs;um in ampullis vitreis con­
tingit, igitur non videtur tam ab&longs;urda, & impo&longs;&longs;ibi­
lis illa aeris figura, quæ po&longs;&longs;it prædictum grande &longs;pa­
tium continere; quare nil probat hoc argumentu&mtail;
contra vacui po&longs;itionem.

Ex his omnibus concludere licet rationes hacte­
nus excogitatas contra vacui po&longs;itionem conuincen­
tes non e&longs;&longs;e.

Re&longs;tat modò vt directè o&longs;tendamus ne-
ce&longs;&longs;ariò vacuum admitti debere, ad hoc autem o&longs;ten­
dendum repetenda &longs;unt aliqua priùs expo&longs;ita, & af­
ferenda alia &longs;unt, quæ ad no&longs;trum in&longs;titutum condu­
cunt.

Cap.
12. d&etail;
vacui nece&longs;­
&longs;itate.

Directè de­
mon&longs;tratur
vacui exi&longs;ten­
tia.

Et primò ni fallor &longs;atis apertè o&longs;tendimus fluida
corpora diuidi non po&longs;&longs;e &longs;emper in partes, quæ pari­
tèr fluidæ &longs;int, &longs;ed nece&longs;&longs;ariò deueniendum e&longs;&longs;e ad

particulas quantas, & figuratas; hæ verò nece&longs;sè e&longs;t,
vt vel molles, & flexibiles, aut omninò rigidæ, & du­
ræ &longs;int.

Igitur &longs;i o&longs;tenderimus, quod corpora mollia,
& flexibilia nece&longs;&longs;ariò componuntur ex particulis
quantis figurati&longs;que non mollibus, nec flexibilibus,
procùl dubio duræ con&longs;i&longs;tentes, & rigidæ erunt, &
proinde fluidum re&longs;olui tandem debet in particulas
prorsùs duras.

Cap.
7. prop.
PROP. CCLX.

Et primò o&longs;tendendum e&longs;t, quod minimæ particulæ corpus
molle componentes non po&longs;&longs;unt e&longs;&longs;e molles.

SI enim hoc verum non e&longs;t, &longs;int particulæ primum
molle corpus componentes non duræ, &longs;ed mol­
les; ergo diuidendo corpus molle numquam deue­
niemus ad aliquam minimam eius particulam duram,
&longs;ed &longs;emper mollis erit, (nam &longs;i ad rigidas perueniri
po&longs;&longs;et ex his profectò componeretur, quod non po­
nitur) & quia eatenus tale corpus cedit mollitiem­
que habet, quatenùs aliquæ eius partes quie&longs;cunt
reliquis ab vno ad alium locum translatis, vel d&etail;
ver&longs;o, & inæquali motu agitantur ab eo, quo reliqu&etail;
eius partes mouentur, &longs;ed in maiori, aut minori pro-
portione, quam partes rotæ &longs;olid&etail; agitantur, vt dictum
e&longs;t; vt autem verum &longs;it nullam particulam corporis mollis
carere hac pa&longs;&longs;ione mollitiei, nece&longs;sè e&longs;t, vt &longs;emper
ei conueniat mollitiei definitio, &longs;cilicèt &longs;emper qu&etail;­
libet eius partes moueri queant, illo inæquali, & di­
uer&longs;o motu à cæteris contiguis; cumque contiguæ e­
iu&longs;dem concreti partes non po&longs;&longs;int diuer&longs;is, & omni­
bus inæqualibus motionibus agitari, ni&longs;i &longs;int di&longs;&longs;ect&etail;,
& inter &longs;e diui&longs;æ actu; ergo nulla particula mollis
corporis a&longs;&longs;ignari pote&longs;t, quæ non &longs;it &longs;ubdiui&longs;a actu
in plures alias particulas, quare numquam perueniri
poterit ad finem enumerationis multitudinis parti­
cularum actu diui&longs;arum in prædicto compo&longs;ito molli,
& ideò talis multitudo maior erit quocunque numero,
&longs;cilicèt maior erit quacumque finita quantitate: igi­
tur infinita erit.

At infinitæ partes &longs;i e&longs;&longs;ent quantæ
actu diui&longs;æ componerent exten&longs;ionem infinitam; ergo
quodlibet exiguum corpus e&longs;&longs;et infinitum, quod &longs;en­
&longs;us euidentiæ repugnat, &longs;equitur ergo, quod prædict&etail;
particulæ infinitæ non quantæ, & proinde puncta
indiui&longs;ibilia &longs;int, hoc verò e&longs;t impo&longs;&longs;ibile, vt priùs
o&longs;ten&longs;um e&longs;t; igitur partes molle corpus primum con­
ponentes non &longs;unt molles, &longs;ed aut flexibiles, aut om­
ninò duræ, & rigidæ erunt.

De vi per­
cu&longs;s.

cap.
26.

Cap.
12. d&etail;
vacui nece&longs;­
&longs;itate.
Prop.
PROP. CCLXI.

Eodem progre&longs;&longs;u o&longs;tendemus, quod minimæ partes flexibile
corpus primum componentes omninò inflexibiles,
rigidæ, & duræ e&longs;&longs;e debent.

NAm &longs;i hoc verum non e&longs;t, &longs;int prædictæ primæ
particulæ componentes corpus flexibile non duræ,
&longs;ed flexibiles; ergo diuidendo prædictum corpus fle­
xibile numquam deueniemus ad particulam eius,
quæ rigida &longs;it, &longs;ed &longs;emper flecti poterit; & quia cau­
&longs;a, quare prædictum corpus flectitur, e&longs;t quia aliqu&etail;
eius partes mouentur reliquis quie&longs;centibus, vel di­
uer&longs;o, & inæquali motu, continuo corpori non com­
petenti, ab eo quo reliquæ contiguæ partes agitan­
tur; nec concipi po&longs;&longs;it nullam particulam flexibilis
corporis carere hac pa&longs;&longs;ione flexibilitatis, ni&longs;i &longs;em­
per ei flexibilitatis definitio competat, &longs;cilicèt ni&longs;i
&longs;emper quælibet eius particulæ moueri queant inæ­
quali motu diuer&longs;o (& non proprio corporis conti­
nui, & vniti) à cæteris contiguis; & partes contiguæ
eiu&longs;dem concreti non po&longs;&longs;unt prædictis motibus di­
uer&longs;is agitari, ni&longs;i actu diui&longs;æ inter &longs;e &longs;int, ergo nul­
la particula flexibilis corporis a&longs;&longs;ignari pote&longs;t, quæ
actu non &longs;it &longs;ubdiui&longs;a in plures alias particulas; qua­
re numquam perueniri poterit ad finem enumerati­
onis multitudinis particularum actu diui&longs;arum, qua­
propter talis multitudo maior erit quocumque nu­
mero, ideoque infinita erit.

Verùm prædictæ partes
infinitæ &longs;i e&longs;&longs;ent quantæ, actu inter &longs;e diui&longs;æ compo­
nerent exten&longs;ionem infinitam, ergo corpus aliquod
palmare v.g. infinitam exten&longs;ionem haberet, quod
e&longs;t fal&longs;um; non igitur quantæ, &longs;ed puncta indiui&longs;ibi­
lia erunt, quod cum &longs;it impo&longs;&longs;ibile, vt dictum e&longs;t, &longs;e­
quitur, quod partes flexibile corpus componentes
non &longs;int flexibiles, proindeque duræ, & rigidæ e&longs;&longs;e
debent, quod fuerat o&longs;tendendum.

Cap.
12. d&etail;
vacui nece&longs;­
&longs;itate.

De vi per­
cu&longs;s.

cap.
26.

Cap.
12. d&etail;
vacui nece&longs;­
&longs;itate.

Pr&etail;terea deducitur, quòd in flexibili corpore flexio
eius fieri, continuarique pote&longs;t, quou&longs;que ad parti­
culas omninò duras perueniatur, quæ po&longs;tea nullo
pacto flecti po&longs;&longs;unt; quia quodlibet corpus durum,
quantum &longs;uos fines, ac terminos habere debet, igi­
tur nece&longs;&longs;ariò aliqua figura comprehenditur, ac ter­
minatur, & ideò aut habebit figuram curuam, & ro­
tundam, aut polihedram, aut mixtam, neque ab&longs;que
aliqua ex his concipi pote&longs;t.

His præmi&longs;&longs;is vlteriùs procedendo examinemus
quænam figuræ &longs;patium implere po&longs;&longs;unt, & quæ non.

Vulgare e&longs;t, angulos, qui ab vno puncto plani &longs;ub­
iecti circumcirca effici po&longs;&longs;unt, æquales e&longs;&longs;e quatuor
rectis angulis planis, &longs;i verò prædicti anguli minores
quatuor rectis fuerint, nece&longs;&longs;ariò hiatum, & &longs;patium
aliquod relinqui debere ab ij&longs;dem angulis non re­
pletum.

De figuris
&longs;patium im­
plentibus
hypothe&longs;es.
PROP. CCLXII.

Quænam figuræ planæ, & &longs;olidæ &longs;uis angulis &longs;patium implere
pos&longs;int.

Cap.
12. d&etail;
vacui nece&longs;­
&longs;itate.

HInc deducitur, quòd &longs;i concurrant apices angu­
lorum plurium figurarum planarum ad vnum
punctum plani &longs;ubiecti, ill&etail; &longs;patium omninò com­
plebunt, quotie&longs;cumque æquales quatuor angulis
rectis fuerint, &longs;in minùs aut penetratio in exce&longs;&longs;u, aut
inter&longs;titia inania in defectu relinquere debent.

Quia
verò figurarum planarum aliæ regulares &longs;unt, &longs;cilicèt
æquiangulæ, & æquilater&etail;, aliæ irregulares, con&longs;tat
ex Theone, Pappo, Maurolico, & alijs, &longs;ex angulos
regularium triangulorum ad vnum punctum plani
&longs;ubiecti concurrentes &longs;patium implere, eò quòd sum­
mam quatuor rectorum adæquant, &longs;ic etiam apices
quatuor angulorum quadratarum figurarum ad vnum
punctum eiu&longs;dem plani concurrentes &longs;patium com­
plent, non &longs;ecùs apices trium angulorum hexagona­
lium figurarum, paritèr &longs;patium adimplent, & nullæ
aliæ; figurarum verò irregularium anguli ad vnu&mtail;
punctum &longs;patij plani concurrentes, qui &longs;patium con­
plere po&longs;&longs;unt propemodum infinit&etail; &longs;unt, &longs;cilicèt om­
nes illæ, quorum anguli conuenientes &longs;ummam qua­
tuor rectorum æquant.

Ea&longs;dem proprietates habent anguli &longs;olidi, qui in
vno plano &longs;uis faciebus adaptari po&longs;&longs;unt, vt &longs;unt pri&longs;­
mata rectangula, & nonnulla alia, quorum ba&longs;es, aut
&longs;unt poligona regularia, aut non, & quando anguli
ba&longs;ium ad vnum punctum plani &longs;ubiecti concurren­
tes &longs;patium prædictum planum complent, etiam &longs;u­
perficies planæ laterales in communi latere erecto
conueniunt, & tunc componunt, veluti pauimentum,

aut opus te&longs;&longs;ellatum, vel mu&longs;iuum, itaque &longs;ex pri&longs;­
mata rectangula triangularia, & æquilatera ad vnum
punctum plani &longs;ubiecti ad aptata &longs;patium omninò con­
plent; &longs;ic quoque quatuor pri&longs;mata quadrata, & non
minùs tria pri&longs;mata hexagonalia, & nulla alia præ­
ter hæc, ni&longs;i ba&longs;es irregulares fuerint.

Cap.
12. d&etail;
vacui nece&longs;­
&longs;itate.

Si verò con&longs;iderentur corpora, quæ regularia ap­
pellantur; patet, quod octo cubi &longs;uis angulis ad vnum
punctum conuenientibus &longs;patium complent, & nullæ
aliæ figuræ, qu&etail; regulares &longs;int, & eiu&longs;dem generis id­
ip&longs;um efficere po&longs;&longs;unt, hoc autem ingenio&longs;i&longs;&longs;imè Mau­
rolicus demon&longs;trauit, in &longs;uo Opu&longs;culo nondùm edito
de figuris &longs;patium implentibus, qui præterea hallu­
cinationem Ari&longs;totelis, & Auerrois patefecit, no&ntail;
enim duodecim anguli pyramidum &longs;patium implere
po&longs;&longs;unt, &longs;ed oportet vt octo anguli pyramidum &longs;ex
angulis octahedrorum aptè vniantur ad vnum pun­
ctum, vt &longs;patium omninò expleant, & nullæ aliæ figu­
ræ præter iam dictas.

His præmi&longs;&longs;is con&longs;iderari debent motus earumdem
figurarum, & &longs;ymptomata, quæ in earum agitatione
contingunt.
PROP. CCLXIII.

Enumerantur figuræ &longs;olidæ, quæ intra alias agitatæ &longs;patium
implere, aut non implere po&longs;&longs;unt.

ET primò facilè con&longs;tat, quod pri&longs;mata, & Cylin­
dri moueri po&longs;&longs;unt motu directo axi &etail;quidi&longs;tan­
ti intra cauitatem alterius corporis ab&longs;que pertur­
batione figuræ ambientis corporis, vt gladius intra
vaginam extrahi, & immitti pote&longs;t; vnde patet, quod
in tali motu &longs;patia inania non admittuntur.

Cap.
12. d&etail;
vacui nece&longs;­
&longs;itate.

Præterea &longs;phæræ, coni, conoides, & cæteræ re­
gulares figuræ curuæ motu vertiginis circa proprium
axem rotari po&longs;&longs;unt, ab&longs;que perturbatione figuræ am­
bientis corporis, & proinde ab&longs;que vacui admixtione.

At figuræ polihedræ non pri&longs;maticæ directè mo­
ueri non po&longs;&longs;unt ab&longs;que perturbatione figuræ, &longs;itua­
tionis, & di&longs;po&longs;itionis ambientium corporum; & prop­
terea nece&longs;sè e&longs;t vt non permaneat illa con&longs;tipat&atail;
vnio &longs;olidorum angulorum, quæ nece&longs;&longs;aria e&longs;t ad &longs;pa­
tium omninò replendum.

Pri&longs;mata, cylindri, &longs;phæræ, coni, & nonnullæ aliæ
transferri tran&longs;uersè motu directo, & inclinato ad a­
xim non po&longs;&longs;unt, ni&longs;i figura, quam anguli &longs;olidi cor­
porum ambientium repletam, & con&longs;tipatam con&longs;ti­
tuebant omninò perturbetur, admi&longs;ceaturque no&ntail;
nihil vacui.

| Præterea figuræ polihedræ circa aliquam lineam
tamquam axim circumduci nequeunt, ni&longs;i perturbetur
di&longs;po&longs;itio con&longs;tipata corporum ambientium, vt i&ntail;
pauimento non pote&longs;t vnum laterculum rotari ni&longs;i am­
bientes laterculi &longs;itum, & ordinem con&longs;tipatum mu­
tando &longs;patia inania admittant.

Alia symptomata o­
mittuntur, cùm hæc tantummodò in ca&longs;u no&longs;tro &longs;uf­
ficiant.

Po&longs;tea in ijs motibus in quibus inania &longs;patia crea­
ri debent videndum re&longs;tat an po&longs;&longs;int, & quomodotan­
ta celeritate prædicta inania &longs;patia repleri, vt nunquam
vacuum admittant.

Cap.
12. d&etail;
vacui nece&longs;­
&longs;itate.
PROP. CCLXIV.

Primò &longs;i duæ &longs;uperficies planæ duorum corporum inflexibi
lium &longs;e&longs;e tangant, & po&longs;tea &longs;eparari debeant, aut illo
motu, quo plana &longs;emper ad inuicem æquidi&longs;tant, aut an­
gularitèr inclinentur, nece&longs;&longs;ariò vacuum admitti debet.

SInt duæ laminæ omninò duræ, & inflexibiles AB
C, & FEH, quæ &longs;uis planis &longs;uperficiebus ADC,
& GEH &longs;e mutuo tangant.

aio,
quod &longs;i &longs;uprema lamina &longs;ubleue­
tur, aut flectendo angularitèr, aut
transferendo &longs;ursùm &longs;uperficiem
GEH motu &longs;ibi ip&longs;i æquidi&longs;tanti,
nece&longs;&longs;ariò vacuum admitti debet;
quia ob rigidam inflexibilemque
duritiem corporum ABC, & FEH &longs;uperficies ADC,
& GEH &longs;emper eamdem directam planitiem retinent,
&longs;iuè quie&longs;cant, &longs;iuè moueantur, ergo in actu &longs;epara­
tionis fieri non pote&longs;t vt pars plani GEH diuellatur,
&longs;epareturque à &longs;ubiecto plano per&longs;euerante contactu
reliquæ partis, aliàs duo plana haberent &longs;egmentum
commune, quod e&longs;t impo&longs;&longs;ibile.

Hinc &longs;equitur, quod
diuul&longs;io, & &longs;eparatio planarum &longs;uperficierum ADC,
& GEH fieri debeat non &longs;ucce&longs;&longs;iuè, & in tempore, v­
na pars po&longs;t aliam, &longs;ed tota &longs;imùl in vnico in&longs;tanti,
itaut omnes partes &longs;upremæ &longs;uperficiei &longs;imul diuelli,
&longs;epararique debeant ab omnibus partibus &longs;uperfi­
ciei infimæ; quaproptèr nece&longs;sè e&longs;t, vt in illo vnico
in&longs;tanti &longs;eparationis creetur &longs;patium interceptu&mtail;,
cuius figura, aut parallelepipeda erit, (&longs;i &longs;uperficie-
rum &longs;eparatio fiat motu perpendiculari ad ea&longs;dem,
&longs;cilicèt &longs;i planum &longs;upremum &longs;emper &longs;ibi ip&longs;i æquidi­
&longs;tando feratur) vel figuræ pri&longs;matis triangularis (&longs;i
motus circularis &longs;it circa axim firmum, quie&longs;centem­
que AG;) hoc verò &longs;patium &longs;i repleri debet à cor­
pore &longs;olido, vel fluido, quod ambiat prædictæ cor­
pora, nece&longs;sè e&longs;t vt in&longs;inuetur intra prædictum hiatum
motu &longs;ucce&longs;&longs;iuo, qui quantacumque celerita re fieri
fingatur, &longs;emper exigit tempus, numquam verò i&ntail;
in &longs;tanti fiet, & proindè &longs;altem per aliquod exiguum
tempus internæ partes prædictæ cauitatis in in&longs;tanti
creatæ, remanebunt prorsùs inanes, quapropter ibi­
dem verè vacuum admitti debet.

Cap.
12. d&etail;
vacui nece&longs;­
&longs;itate.

Si po&longs;tea con&longs;ideretur eiu&longs;dem &longs;patij vacui figura
dum fit motus &longs;eparationis, procùl dubio continentèr
cre&longs;cit, aut altitudinem, aut angulum DAH amplian­
do, ergo in qualibet particula temporis, in quo mo­
tus tabularum fit, creatur noua, & maior figura vacua,
& ideò in quolibet minimo tempore debet in&longs;inuari
noua materia fluida, vel dura, vt replere valeat præ­
dictum &longs;patium, quæ materia &longs;i componitur ex par­
tibus quantis, & duris, videtur impo&longs;&longs;ibile accom­
modari po&longs;&longs;e, vt pr&etail;cisè impleat prædicta &longs;patia cre­
&longs;centia, & varias figuras habentia.
PROP. CCLXV.

In &longs;eparatione corporum durorum contiguorum, vel conti­
nuorum licèt aer intercipiatur, & rarefiat, vacuum eui­
tari non potest.

Cap.
12. d&etail;
vacui nece&longs;­
&longs;itate.

SI quis verò recurrat ad poro&longs;itates tabularum aere
repletas, vel per quas materia fluida penetran­
do præ&longs;tò accurrere po&longs;&longs;it ad replendum vacuum cre­
atum in in&longs;tanti; refelli pote&longs;t ex eò quòd tabulæ non
vbique; & vniuersè perforatæ &longs;unt, alias nullam den­
&longs;itatem haberent, & proindè nece&longs;sè e&longs;t, vt habeant
aliqua inter&longs;titia &longs;olida non poro&longs;a, quæ nece&longs;&longs;ariò
quanta erunt, inter quæ inter&longs;titia &longs;patia relicta ina­
nia in in&longs;tanti &longs;eparationis, non po&longs;&longs;unt repleri, ni&longs;i
in tempore, quia fluidum accurrens motu locali &longs;uc­
ce&longs;&longs;iuo &longs;patium quantum pertran&longs;ire debet, ergo ne­
ce&longs;sè e&longs;t, vt &longs;altem per aliquod tempus inane remaneat.

Et licèt aduer&longs;arij in gratis a&longs;sumpta hypothe&longs;i per­
&longs;i&longs;tant dicendo, quod &longs;emper inter duo corpora &longs;e tan­
gentia fluidum intercedit, &longs;altem admittere debent,
quod inter duas vitri portiones, quæ vnitæ, & vnum
continuum componere aiunt, antequam diffringantur,
&longs;cindanturque, neque aer, neque æther intercipiatur;
& in tali ca&longs;u ratio &longs;uperiùs adducta euincit in vitri
&longs;ci&longs;&longs;ura vacuum admitti debere.

po&longs;tea capi non po­
te&longs;t ab&longs;que nouo corpore forin&longs;ecùs adueniente exi­
guam aeris particulam maius &longs;patium occupare po&longs;&longs;e,
&longs;e vndique dilatando cum rarefit; & licet hoc interim
admittatur patet, quod prædicta ampliatio molis il­
lius corporis, quod rarefit, &longs;ine motu locali &longs;ucce&longs;&longs;iuò
fieri non po&longs;&longs;it, transferuntur enim eius partes ab
exiguo, & re&longs;tricto loco ad ampliorem, ergo dilatatio
illa rarefactionis nece&longs;&longs;ariò in tempore peragi, & ab­
&longs;olui debet, at illud &longs;patium inane in in&longs;tanti creatum

fuerat, ergo à temporanea aeris rarefactione, & dila­
tatione &longs;patium illud vacuum repleri omninò non pote&longs;t,
& ideo vacuum procùl dubio remanebit.

Cap.
12. d&etail;
vacui nece&longs;­
&longs;itate.

His declaratis o&longs;tendendum e&longs;t nece&longs;&longs;ariò vacuum
di&longs;per&longs;um intra exiguas corporum particulas admit­
ti debere.

Quia manife&longs;tum e&longs;t motum in rerum natura dari
intra corpora fluida, &longs;i o&longs;tenderimus motus aliquos
fieri non po&longs;&longs;e ab&longs;que vacui intermixtione, erit pro­
fectò certum vacuum admitti debere.
PROP. CCLXVI.

In di&longs;ci&longs;sione corporis flexibilis, dum partes tractione &longs;epa­
rantur, nece&longs;&longs;ariò vacuum intercipitur.

ET primò con&longs;ideremus motum, quo diuelluntur,
&longs;cinduntur, & &longs;e parantur duo fragmenta &longs;axi du­
ri&longs;&longs;imi ab aliqua valida percu&longs;&longs;ione diffracti, vel à vi
cunei, aut vectis ex&longs;ci&longs;&longs;i, in ijs du&etail; &longs;uperficies fragmen­
torum, qu&etail; arcti&longs;&longs;imè connex&etail; & vnit&etail; erant, licèt in in&longs;tan­
ti videantur ab inuicem &longs;eparari, tamen fatendum e&longs;t
in tempore breui&longs;&longs;imo diui&longs;ionem peragi; atque hoc
contingere ex flexione quam patiuntur prædicta frag­
menta, licèt &longs;int marmorea, aut adamantina, ex qua
inflexione fit vt prædicta fragmenta in actu diui&longs;ionis
aliquanti&longs;per incuruentur, & &longs;ic non tota &longs;imùl in in­
&longs;tanti à &longs;ubiecta &longs;uperficie diuellatur, &longs;ed &longs;ucce&longs;&longs;i­
uè vna pars po&longs;t aliam; vt &longs;i duæ laminæ marmoreæ
vniantur duabus planis &longs;uperficiebus AB, & CB, cum
diuellere planum CB aliqua potentia conatur, &longs;i CB
flexibilis &longs;upponatur, patet quod di&longs;iuncta particula
CD ab AM, adhùc reliqua tota eius portio DB ne­
ctitur, tangitque portionem &longs;ubiectam MB; po&longs;tea per­
&longs;euerante violentia diuelli­
tur &longs;ecunda particula DE ab
MN, per&longs;euerante contactu in
tota longitudine EB, deinde
tertia particula EF &longs;olummo­
dò ab NO &longs;egregatur, & &longs;ic
con&longs;equentes reliquæ omnes
particulæ vna po&longs;t aliam: Et
hìc notandum e&longs;t, quòd &longs;i in plano CB particul&etail; CD, DE,
EF; non e&longs;&longs;ent quantæ, &longs;ed lineæ tran&longs;uer&longs;ales, aut
puncta indiui&longs;ibilia, quæ con&longs;equentèr diuelleren­
tur in &longs;ingulis in&longs;tantibus temporis, procùl dubio pla­
nities CB degeneraret transformaretur que in curuam
&longs;uperficiem, quod profectò contingere non po&longs;&longs;et, ni&longs;i
&longs;olida lamina CB con&longs;taret ex lineis tran&longs;uer&longs;alibus,
aut ex punctis actu inter &longs;e diui&longs;is contigui&longs;que, eò
quòd diuer&longs;imodè moueri, & tran&longs;poni, debent ad hoc
vt perfectam curuitatem acquirere po&longs;&longs;int.

At &longs;i lami­
na ex particulis quantis corporeis con&longs;taret, quarum
quælibet omninò dura, & inflexibilis fui&longs;&longs;et, licèt
po&longs;t inflexionem curuitatis apparentiam sen&longs;ibus re­
pr&etail;&longs;entaret, tamen figuram quamdam polyhedram
ex pluribus planis CD, DE, EF, &c: compo&longs;itam effi­
ceret, & tunc licèt prædictæ planitieculæ &longs;ucce&longs;&longs;iuo
motu vna po&longs;t aliam à &longs;ubiecto plano diuellerentur,
tamen vnaquæque earum ob natiuam eius duritiem
inflexibilem tota &longs;imùl, & in in&longs;tanti &longs;epararetur à
&longs;ubiecto plano.

Cap.
12. d&etail;
vacui nece&longs;­
&longs;itate.

Cap.
12. d&etail;
vacui nece&longs;­
&longs;itate.

Cogitemus modò CB e&longs;&longs;e laminam, &longs;en fragmentum,
quod ex integro marmore AB di&longs;rumpitur, licèt in actu
diuul&longs;ionis inflectatur lamina CB, tamen non acqui­
rit perfectam curuitatem, quia non componitur ex
punctis actu inter &longs;e di&longs;cretis, & inæqualibus moti­
bus agitatis, &longs;ed con&longs;tat ex partibus quantis, figura­

tis, omninò duris, & rigidis, vt o&longs;ten&longs;um e&longs;t; ideoque
in eius inflexione acquiret figuram ex pluribus fa­
cieculis, & ex pluribus angulis &longs;olidis compo&longs;itam,
& &longs;ic verum e&longs;t, quòd integra di&longs;tractio, & diuul&longs;io
&longs;ucce&longs;&longs;iuè, & in tempore ab&longs;oluitur, at vnaquæque
ex illis facieculis inflexibilibus à &longs;ubiecta lamina, cum
qua vnita, & conglutinata erat, diuelli debet, non in
tempore, &longs;ed in in&longs;tanti, vt ex dictis deducitur; mo­
dò, quia &longs;patiola illa vacua pri&longs;matica triangularia, in
in&longs;tanti creata, nequeunt in in&longs;tanti repleri neque à
&longs;olido, neque à fluido, ambiente corpore etiam ra­
refacto, quandoquidem motus, quo accurrere de­
bent ad illud &longs;patium replendum in in&longs;tanti fieri non
pote&longs;t; ergo nece&longs;&longs;ariò vacuum in illis inter&longs;titijs &longs;al­
tem per aliquod breue tempus admitti debet, & hoc
&longs;ufficit ad probandum, nedùm vacuum impo&longs;&longs;ibile non
e&longs;&longs;e, &longs;ed nece&longs;&longs;ariò requiri ad talem motum efficiendum.

PROP. CCLXVII.

In eadem &longs;cis&longs;ione non pote&longs;t fluidum ambiens omninò crea­
ta &longs;patia vacua replere.

COn&longs;ideremus po&longs;tea materiam corpoream, quæ
accurrere debet ad replendum illud &longs;patiu&mtail;
vacuum, quod continentèr augetur mutando figuram;
hæc profectò materia, aut mollis, vel flexibilis, aut
fluida &longs;it, oportet; & procùl dubio non poterit quam­
libet figuram acquirere, cùm non componatur ex pun­
ctis indiui&longs;ibilibus, &longs;ed ex partibus quantis, duris,
& figuratis, & ideò non poterit accommodari ad fi­
guram va&longs;is, &longs;eu &longs;patij de nouo creati, itaut omninò,
& præcisè omnes eius angulos repleat; finge eni&mtail;
apicem alicuius particulæ duræ fluidum componen­
tis præcisè accommodari, replereque angulum &longs;patij
creati, po&longs;tea ampliato pauli&longs;pèr angulo &longs;patij opor­
teret, vt angulus &longs;olidus illius particulæ fluidæ ob­
tu&longs;ior fieret, vel ibidem accurrere deberet angulus
alterius particulæ aptus ad replendum augmentum
prædictum angulare, quod aliundè cùm continentèr
cre&longs;cere, ampliarique &longs;upponatur, deberent accur­
rere apices particularum fluidum componentiu&mtail;,
quæ haberent angulos &longs;olidos infinitis modis inter
&longs;e inæquales, & differentes, & hi po&longs;tea vndequaque
accurrere deberent in&longs;tantaneo motu ad replend&atail;
innumera &longs;patiola de nouo creata, quod profectò
omnem humanum captum &longs;uperat.

Cap.
12. d&etail;
vacui nece&longs;­
&longs;itate.
PROP. CCLXVIII.

In motu fluidi intra fluidum vacua &longs;patiola creantur per
breue tempus per&longs;euerantes.

PErpendamus deindè motum fluidi intra ei homo­
geneum fluidum, & quia, vt o&longs;ten&longs;um e&longs;t, par­
ticulæ primum fluidum componentes non &longs;unt fluidæ,
nec indiui&longs;ibiles, nec molles, aut flexibiles, cùm &longs;em­
per in vnoquoque deueniendum &longs;it ad particulas quan-
tas figuratas non molles, nec fluidas, quæ proindè
omninò rigidæ, & duræ e&longs;&longs;e debent certis, ac deter­
minatis figuris præditæ; imaginemur modò huiu&longs;mo­
di duras particulas fluidum componentes &longs;ic coapta­
ri, ac con&longs;tipari vt omninò &longs;patium repleant, patet
apices angulorum earumdem ad vnum punctum con­
uenientes dum in quiete con&longs;i&longs;tunt præcisè octo an­
gulos rectos &longs;olidos æquare, aliàs &longs;patium omninò
non implerent; qualemcumque po&longs;tea figuram ha­
bere particulas duras fluidum componentes &longs;uppo­
namus, &longs;i illæ omnibus varij&longs;que motionibus agiten­
tur, certum e&longs;t, quod textura, ordo, & difpo&longs;itio con­
&longs;tipata particularum fluidi perturbatur, di&longs;&longs;oluitur­
que, vt innumera &longs;patiola vacua in in&longs;tanti creentur.

Hoc profectò patet exemplo pauimenti &longs;picati, &longs;iuè
rexellati, ex laterculis, &longs;iuè lapillis angularibus po­
lygonis variè figuratis contextum; hi &longs;anè concinnè
adaptati &longs;patia lateralia omninò implent, quamdiù
in quiete con&longs;i&longs;tunt, at &longs;i quis velit vnum &longs;olummodo
laterculum reuoluere, aut directè horizontali motu
transferre inter alia latercula, nece&longs;sè e&longs;t vt di&longs;&longs;oluat
con&longs;tipatam illam texturam ambientium laterculo­
rum, quæ contorqueri, & è &longs;uis locis expelli debent
diuer&longs;is, & contrarijs reuolutionibus, & tunc e&longs;t pror­
sùs impo&longs;&longs;ibile, vt anguli &longs;olidi ad vnum punctum con­
uenientes æquales &longs;int, &longs;icuti priùs octo angulis re­
ctis &longs;olidis, &longs;ed nece&longs;sè e&longs;t, vt plura inter&longs;titia inania,
&longs;eù à laterculis non occupata remaneant.

Idem pror­
sùs in particulis fluidum componentibus euenturum
e&longs;&longs;e manife&longs;tum e&longs;t.

His po&longs;itis, quia, vt antea in&longs;inua­
uimus, e&longs;t impo&longs;&longs;ibile, vt aliud corpus fluidum accur­
rere po&longs;&longs;it ad replenda prædicta &longs;patia vacua, quæ
creantur in in&longs;tanti dum motus, aut di&longs;gregatio flui­
di, quod conatur &longs;patia illa replere, fieri debeat, in tem
pore; igitur e&longs;t impo&longs;&longs;ibile, vt &longs;ubitò &longs;patia prædicta
repleantur.

Præterea figuræ &longs;olidæ, & duræ particu­
larum eiu&longs;dem fluidi accurrentis ineptæ &longs;unt ad re­
plenda pr&etail;cisè &longs;patiola vacua infinitarum figurarum,
quæ in motu partium prædicti fluidi creantur, igitur
&longs;i vna, vel plures partes fluidi intra alias moueri de­
beant (vt certum e&longs;t moueri) nece&longs;&longs;ariò vacuitates
aliquæ &longs;altem per aliquod breue tempus admitti de­
bent.

vacui nece&longs;­
