Prop. 263.

Cap.
12. d&etail;
vacui nece&longs;­
&longs;itate.

Sed dicent Carte&longs;iani, corpora omnia dura, & flui­
da facilè permeari à &longs;ub&longs;tantia quadam &longs;ummè rara,
tenui, & penetranti, quæ æther appellatur, hæc ne­
dùm poro&longs;itates omnium con&longs;i&longs;tentium corporum oc­
cupat, &longs;ed pr&etail;&longs;tò accurrere po&longs;&longs;e aiunt ad replendas
qua&longs;cumque vacuitates.
PROP. CCLXIX.

Admi&longs;&longs;a &longs;ubstantia ætherea &longs;ubtilis&longs;ima, & penetrantis&longs;i­
ma, non po&longs;&longs;et ip&longs;a, vel quodlibet aliud corpus, moueri ab&longs;­
que vacui interpo&longs;itione.

COncedendum e&longs;t primò illam &longs;ub&longs;tantiam æthe­
ream fluidum quoque corpus e&longs;&longs;e, & ideo con­
poni quoque debere ex &longs;uis minimis particulis no&ntail;
fluidis, &longs;ed duris, quantis, & figuratis, quæ in tem­
pore velint, nolint, accurrere debent ad replend&atail;
&longs;patia illa vacua in in&longs;tanti creata; & præterea ob fi­
guras &longs;olidas non po&longs;&longs;unt omninò replere inanitates
illas vt priùs dictum e&longs;t.

Cap.
12. d&etail;
vacui nece&longs;­
&longs;itate.

Secundò omi&longs;&longs;o motu partium aquæ, vel aeris, lo­
quamur de motu partium eiu&longs;dem fluidi ætherei, o&longs;ten­
detur, vt priùs ad motiones varias particularum æthe­
ris nece&longs;&longs;ariò vacuitates in eorum motu oriri debe­
re, cùm non minùs ætheris particulæ ex quibus pri­
mùm componitur, quantæ, figuratæ, & duræ &longs;int.

Ex corolli
pr. 261.

Po&longs;&longs;umus ergo ex his omnibus non ineptè conclu­
dere, quod ex eò quòd datur motus, admitti quoque
debeat vacuum di&longs;&longs;eminatum intra particulas com­
ponentes corpora con&longs;i&longs;tentia, & fluida, &longs;altem tunc
temporis, cùm motus efficitur.
PROP. CCLXX.

Etiam corpora quie&longs;centia intra eorum poro&longs;itates innu­
mera &longs;patiola vacua admittere debere.

QVia &longs;i non repugnat, immò nece&longs;&longs;arium e&longs;t, vacua
&longs;patiola admitti debere, tunc temporis cùm
motus efficitur, quid vetat eadem vacua diutiùs per&longs;e­
uerare extincto motu, dum fluidum omninò quie&longs;cit?

hoc profectò in fluido omnium rari&longs;&longs;imo, & &longs;ubtili&longs;­
&longs;imo, qualis e&longs;t &longs;ub&longs;tantia ætherea, affirmari debere
videtur planè nece&longs;&longs;arium, & con&longs;equentèr in alijs
corporibus à prædicto æthere repletis: nam cùm eius
minimæ particulæ &longs;int quantæ, duræ, & varijs figuris
præditæ, videtur impo&longs;&longs;ibile, vt exacta vnione ad in­
uicem con&longs;tipari &longs;emper, & vbique queant, vt pror­
sùs &longs;patium compleant, cùm cu&longs;pides earum ad vnum
punctum conuenientes &longs;ummam octo &longs;olidorum an­
gulorum rectorum numquam, vel rarò complere po&longs;­
&longs;e videantur; veluti aceruus, & cumulus arenæ, aut
tritici concipi non pote&longs;t ab&longs;que eò quòd &longs;patiol&atail;
innumera inter grana prædicta intercipiantur, quæ
&longs;patiola augeri, & re&longs;tringi po&longs;&longs;e experientia con­
&longs;tat, quatenùs &longs;uccu&longs;&longs;o modio meliùs, & &longs;trictiùs
granula accommodari po&longs;&longs;unt.

Et licèt gratis conce­
datur alicubi partes ætheris omninò &longs;patium imple­
re, &longs;altem po&longs;t eius agitationem, & commotione&mtail;
vacua &longs;patiola creari debere con&longs;tat, vt dictum e&longs;t;
cùmque eadem partium di&longs;po&longs;itio per&longs;euerare po&longs;­
&longs;it in &longs;ub&longs;equenti quiete eiu&longs;dem fluidi ætherei, per­
&longs;euerabunt quoque poro&longs;itates illæ vacuæ.

Cap.
12. d&etail;
vacui nece&longs;­
&longs;itate.

Huiu&longs;modi porrò vacua &longs;patiola intra corpor&atail;
mundana di&longs;per&longs;a, & di&longs;&longs;eminata præclarum v&longs;u&mtail;
habent in natura, non minùs ac pori, qui in plantis, &
animalibus reperiuntur; &longs;icuti enim per eos effluere,
& penetrare po&longs;&longs;unt exhalationes igne&etail;, &longs;ucci, & alia
corpu&longs;cula, à quibus viuificantur, nutriuntur, & cre­
&longs;cunt, ita per inanes mundanorum corporum poro&longs;i­
tates effluuia ignea lucida, & alia innumera pene­
trando rerum naturalis ordo, & periodus con&longs;erua­
tur.

Præterea ex vacuis prædictis di&longs;&longs;eminatis ha­
betur facilis, & perceptibilis modus quomodo cor­
pora fluida, mollia, & flexibilia fluere, cedere, &
flecti po&longs;&longs;int, & quomodo &longs;ecari, diuidi, conden&longs;a­
ri, & rarefieri queant, &longs;ine quibus hæ omnes operati­
ones nullo modo percipi, & explicari po&longs;&longs;int.

Cap.
13. cau­
&longs;a rarefuncti­
onis glaciei
affertur.

Ex his omnibus concludere licet, nedùm extra mun­
dum &longs;en&longs;ibilem &longs;patium vacuum admitti debere, vt
&longs;upra o&longs;ten&longs;um e&longs;t, &longs;ed etiam intra corpora di&longs;&longs;emi­
nata &longs;patiola omninò vacua nece&longs;&longs;ariò ponenda e&longs;&longs;e,
vt propo&longs;itum fuerat.

Quare inter fluida &longs;ola aquea corpora cùm congelantur ingen­
ti vi augeantur mole rationem reddere.
CAP. XIII.

EX doctrina &longs;uperiùs tradita, coronidis loco, ten­
tabimus rationem reddere problematis admi­
rabilis; quare &longs;ola aqua, & cætera fluida aquæ naturam
participantia, vt &longs;unt vinum, humores animalium,
& plantarum, ab inten&longs;o frigore nedùm non con&longs;trin­
guntur, & ad minus &longs;patium rediguntur, vt contingit
in reliquis corporibus duris, mollibus, & fluidis; &longs;ed
præterea augentur mole amplianturque, &longs;cilicèt rarefi
unt, & hoc fit ingenti vi.

Cùm ex vulgi loquendi v&longs;u
den&longs;itas à duritie non di&longs;tinguatur, & fluida corpora
cen&longs;eantur rariora e&longs;&longs;e corporibus den&longs;is, & duris,
facilè &longs;uadentur nonnulli quotie&longs;cunque corpus flui­
dum, vt aqua induratur, & glaciei con&longs;i&longs;tentiam acqui­
rit; à vi frigoris, conden&longs;atam fui&longs;&longs;e, non verò rarefa­
ctam; quia verò inter rare factionem, & conden&longs;atio­
nem hoc di&longs;criminis intercedit, vt in illa parua materia
&longs;eu &longs;ub&longs;tantia corporea grande &longs;patium occupet, cum
in hac è contra copio&longs;ior &longs;ub&longs;tantia corporea minus
&longs;patium, & magis re&longs;trictum expleat; cùmque euiden­
ti&longs;&longs;imè corpora omnia tum dura, cum fluida ab actio­
ne, & vi caloris, & ignis rarefiant, & maiorem fluidi-
tatem acquirant, & è contrà à frigiditate conden&longs;entur in­
durenturque, videtur illis omninò impo&longs;&longs;ibile vt ma­
xima, & inten&longs;i&longs;&longs;ima actio frigiditatis, quæ e&longs;t conge­
latio eam pa&longs;&longs;ionem producere debeat, quæ propria
caliditatis e&longs;t, & propterea negant aquam glaciatam
rarefactam e&longs;&longs;e debere.

Cap.
13. cau­
&longs;a rarefunctio­
nis glaciei
affertur.
PROP. CCLXXI.

Experientia con&longs;tat fluida aquæ naturam participantia
ab inten&longs;o frigore in actu congelationis ingenti vi rare­
fieri.

NAm glacies &longs;uper aquam fluidam innatat, ergo
minùs grauis e&longs;t ip&longs;a aqua fluida, proindeque
rarior ip&longs;a aqua erit, quod ex princi­
pijs Archimedis euidentèr deducitur.

Sed prædicti
ratiocinij fal­
laciam Gali­
leus olim de­
texit.

Po&longs;tea in Academia experimentali
Medicea innumeris experimentis eui­
cimus glaciem amplius &longs;patium occu­
pare, quàm aqua fluida, quæ omnia legi
po&longs;&longs;unt in prædicto libro experimen­
torum à fol.

127. v&longs;que ad fol. 165. vbi
habetur progre&longs;&longs;us congelationis aquæ
communis, tum à frigore artificiali niuis
producto, cùm à frigido naturali aeris;
& in artificiali congelatione &longs;emper ve­
rum e&longs;t, quod in principio immer&longs;ionis
va&longs;is vitrei ABD intra niuem RSTV
&longs;ale a&longs;per&longs;am, primo aqua à puncto E,
&longs;cilicèt à gradu 142. breui &longs;altu trium ferè graduum
eleuatur v&longs;que ad F, & hìc licèt videatur augeri, &
rarefieri moles aquæ ip&longs;ius va&longs;is, nihilominùs ego
animaduerti, & docui hoc contingere à re&longs;trictione
eiu&longs;dem vitrei va&longs;is; po&longs;tea à puncto F continuato
motu moles aquæ decre&longs;cit, conden&longs;aturque, quou&longs;­
que deprimatur ad punctum G graduum 120. & hìc
pauli&longs;per videtur quie&longs;cere, po&longs;tea denuò moles
aquæ fluidæ augeri incipit, &longs;ubleuaturque ab infimo
&longs;igno G v&longs;que ad punctum H, &longs;cilicèt v&longs;que ad gra­
dum 130. & paulò po&longs;t vehementi&longs;&longs;imum &longs;altum a­
qua efficit v&longs;que ad gradum 166. in I, & tunc præ­
cisè obtenebratur veluti nebula aqua in va&longs;e AB con­
tenta, & in glaciem vertitur, eodem illo exiguo, &
imperceptibili tempore, quo veloci&longs;&longs;imus aquæ &longs;al­
tus efficitur; præterea dum maiorem duritiem gla­
cies acquirit, & aliquæ partes fluidæ propè colli ex­
tremitatem AC gelantur, pro&longs;equitur fluxus aquæ
&longs;upra &longs;ignum I ver&longs;us D, ibidemque profluit egredi­
turque aqua extra vas; ex qua hi&longs;toria (relictis innu­
meris alijs experimentis) euidenti&longs;&longs;imè con&longs;tat, aquam
in actu congelationis rarefieri, &longs;cilicèt expandi, & ad
&longs;patium amplius redigi, idemque ob&longs;eruatur i&ntail;
aquis &longs;tillatitijs; thermalibus, in vino, in aceto, in li­
monum acredine, & in &longs;piritu vitrioli; & &longs;olummo­
dò aer, &longs;piritus vini, olea, & hydrargyrum ab hac
communi lege eximuntur, quæ ab inten&longs;iori gradu
frigoris &longs;emper magis mole imminuuntur &longs;tringun­
turque, licèt oleum aliquo pacto con&longs;i&longs;tentiam &longs;oli­
ditatemque acquirat, cum aer, &longs;piritus vini, & hydrar­
gyrum &longs;emper fluida remaneant.

Cap.
13. cau­
&longs;a rarefacti­
onis glaciei
affertur.

De vi per­
cu&longs;s. cap. 31.
pr. 105.

Cap.
13. cau­
&longs;a rarefactio­
nis glaciei
affertur.

Quòd verò vis, qua aqua dilatatur, in actu conge­
lationis &longs;it propemodum immen&longs;a, con&longs;tat ex experi­
mentis ibidem traditis, va&longs;a enim vitrea vndiqu&etail;
clau&longs;a in actu congelationis aquæ inclu&longs;æ diffringun­
tur, & va&longs;a ærea paritèr clau&longs;a, licèt eius parietes
cra&longs;&longs;itiem &longs;emidigiti auricularis habeant, nihilomi­
nùs etiam di&longs;cinduntur, diffringunturque, quod qui­
dem à vi, & energia cunei compre&longs;&longs;i à va&longs;to ponde­
re præ&longs;tari minimè po&longs;&longs;et.

Ex recentioribus aliqui tentarunt cau&longs;am rarefa­
ctionis glaciei reddere; primò ex principijs Ga&longs;&longs;en­
di, qui expre&longs;sè negat frigiditatem e&longs;&longs;e meram calo­
ris priuationem: &longs;ed &longs;icuti in natura dantur corpu&longs;cu­
la ignea caliditatem producentia, fic quoque dari
corpu&longs;cula aliqua tetraedica, quæ frigorifica, &longs;iu&etail;
alinitralia à Ga&longs;&longs;endo appellantur; hæc dum intr&atail;
aquam in&longs;inuantur, molis amplitudinem, connexionem,
& duritiem creare putant, vnà cum ingenti frigidita­
te, & hanc e&longs;&longs;e cau&longs;am rarefactionis, &longs;eù ampliatio­
nis, quam aqua glaciata acquirit.
PROP. CCLXXII.

Rarefactio, & augmentum molis aquæ glaciatæ non effici­
tur à mixtione, & interpo&longs;itione corpu&longs;culorum frigidi­
tatem creantium.

SEd hoc duplici modo redargui mihi po&longs;&longs;e vide­
tur; primò, quia &longs;alia prædicta aquæ admixt&atail;
pondus, & grauitatem eius augere aliquo pacto de­
berent, quod quidem experientiæ repugnat, cùm cya­
thus aquæ fluidæ vnius libræ v.g. po&longs;t eius congela-
tionem ad exacti&longs;&longs;imam trutinam examinatus nè mi­
nimum quidem nouum pondus acquirat.

His adde,
quòd non parua moles &longs;alis requiritur ad congelan­
dam eamdem aqueam ma&longs;&longs;am, tantopere ampliatam,
quia deberet &longs;al per vniuer&longs;as aquæ particulas di­
&longs;pergi, vt prædictam vnionem, conden&longs;ationemque
vniuer&longs;alem crearet: cumque &longs;alia ex &longs;ui natura graui­
ora &longs;int ip&longs;a aqua, igitur valdè augeri deberet pon­
dus in aqua glaciata; nec valet effugium, quòd parti­
culæ illæ &longs;alin&etail; &longs;int volatiles, nam ex ob&longs;eruationibus
in Academia experimentali Medicea factis con&longs;tat
&longs;al volatile non differre &longs;ub&longs;tantia, con&longs;i&longs;tentia, &
figura à &longs;ale fixo eiu&longs;dem generis.

Cap.
13. cau­
&longs;a rarefacti­
onis glaciei
affertur.

Præterea &longs;i aqua in glaciem ver&longs;a mole augetur,
quia intra eius &longs;ub&longs;tantiam in&longs;inuantur, mi&longs;centurque
corpora frigorifica, vel &longs;alina, profectò omnia cor­
pora fluida ab eodem gradu frigiditatis æquè auge­
ri mole, & ampliari deberent, ac aqua glaciata; cùm
ex hypothe&longs;i nulla alia de cau&longs;a corpora frigida red­
dantur ni&longs;i quia replentur, & impr&etail;gnantur ab illis
corpu&longs;culis, &longs;iue &longs;alibus frigorificis, &longs;ed hoc e&longs;t fal­
&longs;um, nam aer, &longs;piritus vini, oleum, & hydrargyrum
licèt eidem boreali vento exponantur, non augentur
mole, imò multò magis conden&longs;antur, imminuuntur­
que, & &longs;i præterea inten&longs;iori gradu frigoris affician­
tur, quàm &longs;it ille, qui aquam glaciare valet, per&longs;eue­
rat nihilominùs in illis fluiditas, & continentèr, ma­
gis, ac magis mole imminuuntur, &longs;cilicèt &longs;emper mi­
nus, ac minus &longs;patium occupant, igitur rarefactio, &
augmentum molis glaciei non efficitur ab a&longs;per&longs;ione,
& mi&longs;tione corpu&longs;culorum, & &longs;alium frigorificorum,
&longs;ed ab alia longè diuer&longs;a cau&longs;a phænomenon hoc de­
pendet.

Cap.
13. cau­
&longs;a rarefacti­
onis glaciei
affertur.

Hoc Ga&longs;&longs;endus indica&longs;&longs;e videtur, cùm ait, in glacie
non paucas aeris particulas commi&longs;ceri, proptere&atail;
quòd videmus congelationem aquæ initium habere
in eius &longs;ummitate, quæ aerem contingit, & hinc po­
&longs;tea inferiùs propagari versùs fundum; & hinc ait pen­
dere, quòd glacies &longs;uper aquam innatat, cùm &longs;it aere
impr&etail;gnata; à quo po&longs;tea veri&longs;imile e&longs;t per&longs;ua&longs;u&mtail;
fui&longs;&longs;e ampliari po&longs;&longs;e molem aquæ glaciatæ, & hoc
conijcitur ex eius verbis, dum ait, cùm verum &longs;it aquam
calefactam refrige&longs;cendo citiùs fortiu&longs;que conglaciare, quam
frigidam, ecquam aliam putemus cau&longs;am, quàm quia facta
maiore quadam partium aquæ laxitate, ip&longs;e aer faciliùs &longs;ub­
ingreditur, & vehementiùs &longs;tringit particulas aquæ, qui­
bus commi&longs;cetur?

Ex quibus Ga&longs;&longs;endi verbis elicitur, quòd ab aere
deforis adueniente in actu congelationis aqua infle­
tur, & rarefiat.
PROP. CCLXXIII.

Nec paritér augetur aquæ moles ànouo aere de foris adueni­
ente in actu congelationis eius, neque à directione, & ten­
&longs;ione anguillularum aquæ.

SI hoc verum e&longs;&longs;et, cùm omninò prohibetur aeris
ingre&longs;&longs;us intra aquam, non deberet in actu con­
gelationis rarefieri, & ampliari eius moles, vtcù&mtail;
vas plumbeum, vel aureum aqua plenum, & vndique
clau&longs;um aeri frigidi&longs;&longs;imo exponitur, vel intra niuem
&longs;ali admixtam demergitur, omninò à metalli con&longs;i&longs;ten­
tia prohiberetur impedireturque ingre&longs;&longs;us aeris in­
tra aquam, quaproptèr tunc non deberet aqua in actu
congelationis rarefieri, & ampliari mole, quod tamen
experientiæ repugnat; euidenti&longs;&longs;imè enim ampull&atail;
illa plumbea, vel aurea &longs;ua mollitie cedendo expan­
&longs;ioni internæ glaciei inflatur efficiturque &longs;phæra ma­
ioris diametri.

præterea proximè ante aquæ conge­
lationem è profundiori aqua va&longs;is a&longs;cendunt aere&atail;
grana, non ab extrin&longs;eco aere intra eiu&longs;dem va&longs;is a­
quam demergi granula illa con&longs;piciuntur; non igitur
à nouo aere &longs;ubingrediente, & penetrante aquæ &longs;ub­
&longs;tantiam rare fieri, inflarique pote&longs;t aqua glacialis.

Cap.
13. cau­
&longs;a rarefacti­
onis glaciei
affertur.

Nec rarefit ob directionem anguillularum aquam
componentium, vt putat Carte&longs;ius: h&etail;c enim &longs;ententia
improbabilis e&longs;&longs;e videtur, primò ob po&longs;itionis ab­
&longs;urditatem, non enim pote&longs;t aqua componi ex anguil­
lulis illis, vt &longs;uperiùs in&longs;inuauimus; In&longs;uper &longs;en&longs;u
con&longs;tat in glacie innumera granula aerea de nouo
apparere, quæ priùs incon&longs;picua erant; quaproptèr
non à directione, & ten&longs;ione anguillalarum, &longs;ed ab
illo aere, vel ab alia concomitante cau&longs;a aquam infla­
ri, & rare fieri debere fatendum e&longs;t.
Prop. 155.

Intra aquæ
&longs;ubitantiam
innummerae ae
ris particule
eommixtæ
r periuntur

Modò animaduertendum e&longs;t pro &longs;olutione huius
problematis, quòd in aqua fluida innumer&etail; aeris par­
ticulæ admixtæ, & di&longs;&longs;eminatæ perpetuò reperiun­
tur; &longs;iuè hoc contingat ex eo quod aqua aeri contermi­
na in varia eius agitatione aeris aliquas particulas in
tercipit, retinetque intra &longs;e ipsam; vel quia ex &longs;ubiecta
terra vnà cum exhalationibus igneis per eius poros
expirantes transferuntur in&longs;inuanturque intra aqueam
ma&longs;&longs;am innumeræ eiu&longs;dem aeris particulæ, quæ &longs;i
grandiorem molem con&longs;tituunt, multis nimirum par­
ticulis &longs;imul aggregatis, tunc globulos, &longs;iuè ampul­
las aliquas aereas componunt, quæ è fundo aquæ conti­
nuato motu ad &longs;upremum eius confinium feruntur; &
hoc pa&longs;&longs;im ob&longs;eruatur in littore maris ijs in locis vbi
&longs;olum e&longs;t luto&longs;um, præ&longs;ertim æ&longs;tate, exi&longs;tente mari
tranquillo, apparet enim &longs;eries plurium ampullularum
è fundo a&longs;cendere varijs in locis; &longs;ed quali&longs;cunque &longs;it
cau&longs;a huius admi&longs;tionis, euidenti&longs;&longs;imum e&longs;t ingentem
copiam aerearum particularum in ip&longs;a aqua reperiri,
licèt vi&longs;u non percipiantur; quod confirmari pote&longs;t
pulcherrimo in&longs;trumento Torricelliano, in quo vacuum
mediante aqua efficitur, nam dum aqua de&longs;cendit ad
&longs;olitam depre&longs;&longs;ionem 17. cubitorum proximè, tunc
videmus ab aqua tantam copiam ampullarum aerearum
egredi, vt repr&etail;&longs;entet ebullitionem, quam efficere &longs;olet
feruor ignis in eadem aqua; & hoc pendet ex eo
quòd particulæ minimæ aeris ibidem non vt priùs
comprimuntur ab ingenti pondere aereæ regionis,
&longs;ed &longs;olummodò ab exigua grauitate aquæ incumben­
tis, quod per&longs;uadetur ex eo, quòd profundiora gra­
nula aeris, quæ ob paruitatem ferè incon&longs;picua erant,
quò magis ad &longs;ummitatem aquæ accedunt, eò magis
ampliantur inflantur, grandiore&longs;que ampullas con&longs;ti­
tuunt, quarum aliquæ nucis magnitudinem æquant,
prout magis vis ela&longs;tica aeris libertatem nacta am­
pliare dilatareque ea&longs;dem ampullas pote&longs;t.

certi&longs;&longs;i­
mum ergo e&longs;t intra aquam contineri innumeras aeris
particulas &longs;en&longs;ui non manife&longs;tas, aliquando magis,
aliquando minùs copio&longs;as; nec mirum e&longs;t, aerem le­
uem intra grauius fluidum retineri po&longs;&longs;e, cùm no­
uum non &longs;it ob molis minutiem corpu&longs;cula varia, tum
graui&longs;&longs;ima, cum leui&longs;&longs;ima intra aquam retineri, &
quie&longs;cere po&longs;&longs;e, vt &longs;uperius in&longs;inuatum e&longs;t.

Cap.
13. cau­
&longs;a rarefacti­
onis glaciei
affertur.

Cap.
13. cau­
&longs;a rarefacti­
onis glaciei
affertur.

In&longs;uper &longs;en&longs;u con&longs;tat, quòd in glacie innumeræ
ampullæ aere refertæ &longs;par&longs;im reperiuntur, vt pluri­
mùm &longs;phæricæ, &longs;i paruulæ fuerint, conformantur, at &longs;i
grandiores fuerint, oblongæ &longs;unt, & multoties &longs;eriem
plurium fi&longs;tularum repr&etail;&longs;entant, quæ aliquando me­
dietatem &longs;patij totius glaciei ad&etail;quant; vt verò con­
&longs;taret an prædictæ ampullæ glaciei e&longs;&longs;ent vacuæ, vel
aere plenæ, eiu&longs;dem glaciei fru&longs;tum intra aquam flui­
dam demer&longs;i, po&longs;tea &longs;tylo ferreo acuto diligentèr e­
ius cru&longs;tam &longs;olidam perforaui v&longs;que ad ampullas, &
tunc remoto &longs;tylo egrediebatur ab illo &longs;patio am­
pulla corporea aerea, quæ in tran&longs;itu per aquam flui­
dam &longs;uum &longs;patium &longs;ph&etail;ricum | occupabat, quou&longs;qu&etail;
ad aeris confinium perducta ibidem difflaret, & cum
eo commi&longs;ceretur.
PROP. CCLXXIV.

Minimæ particulæ aquam componentes minores &longs;unt par­
ticulis aerem componentibus.

HOc plurima experimenta per&longs;uadent; videmus
enim, quod aquæ particulæ per va&longs;is fictilis,
aut lignei poro&longs;itates exudare, & egredi po&longs;&longs;unt,
per quas aer tran&longs;ire nequit, &longs;ic paritèr in bur&longs;a co­
riacea aqua per eius poro&longs;itates, licèt motu tardo,
permeare pote&longs;t, cùm aer ibidem contentus, licèt in­
genti vi comprimatur, egredi non po&longs;&longs;it; erunt igitur
particulæ aereæ grandiores, quàm aqueæ particulæ,
cùm per prædicta foraminula pertran&longs;ire nequeant,
licèt po&longs;tea aeris partes, vtpote ip&longs;a aqua rariores
contineant intra &longs;eip&longs;as ingentia &longs;patia vacua &longs;i con­
parentur cum &longs;ua mole den&longs;a, & plena; vnde &longs;upra
coniecimus, particulas aeris e&longs;&longs;e veluti &longs;piras, vel in­
uolucra ex &longs;ubtili&longs;&longs;imis laminis contortis, inuoluti&longs;­
que efformatas; è contra aquæ minimas particulas
habere figuram plenam, & &longs;olidam, vel octaedram,
vel alterius figuræ ad rotunditatem accedentis, quæ
tamen habent exiguam lanuginem eas ambientem, vt
hactenùs in&longs;inuauimus.

Cap.
13. cau­
&longs;a rarefacti­
onis glaciei
affertur.

Po&longs;&longs;ibile e&longs;t
minimas a­
quæ particu­
las intra va­
cuos tubu­
los aere&mtail;
componen­
tium in&longs;inu­
ari po&longs;&longs;e.

Hinc deducitur non e&longs;&longs;e impo&longs;&longs;ibile, nec à verita­
te omninò alienum, vt particulæ minimæ aquæ ta&mtail;
minutæ &longs;int, vt po&longs;&longs;int intra vacuas capacitates aere­
arum particularum, &longs;cilicèt intra tubulos illos conti­
neri; & ideò ab aliqua vi po&longs;&longs;int ibidem in&longs;inuari,
quare vt po&longs;&longs;ibilis huiu&longs;modi hypothe&longs;is admitti
po&longs;&longs;e videtur.

Ad hæc &longs;upponendum quoque e&longs;t aeris inuolucra,
vel &longs;piras non componi ex laminulis gracili&longs;&longs;imis om­
ninò læuibus, explanati&longs;que, vt &longs;peculum, &longs;ed habere
villos aliquos non di&longs;&longs;imiles ijs, quos in extima &longs;uper­
ficie particularum aquæ reperiri diximus, huiu&longs;modi
verò villi non e&longs;t impo&longs;&longs;ibile, vt in interna ampla ca­
uitate cylindrulorum, vel &longs;pirarum, ramos proten­
dant, itaut internè habeant veluti capillitium com­
po&longs;itum ex villis flexibilibus, & re&longs;ilientibus ad mo­
dum machinæ, eiu&longs;dem naturæ, ac e&longs;t tota aeris &longs;ub­
&longs;tantia, & non minus quam habet aquæ capillitium,
&longs;ed oportet vt villi interni aereorum inuolucroru&mtail;
facilè po&longs;&longs;int à calido molle&longs;cere, vt omninò flectan­
tur, & rigiditatem amittant, & è contra à frigido, &longs;eù
à defectu caliditatis rigiditatem, & ten&longs;ionem eius
naturalem rea&longs;&longs;umant, & acquirant; cuius rei non de­
&longs;unt exempla in natura; videmus enim ceram, metalla,
& innumera alia concreta, quæ à caliditate, &longs;cilicèt
ab incur&longs;u igniculorum mollia, cedentia, & flexilia
redduntur; è contra di&longs;cedente caliditate &longs;pont&etail;
&longs;ua pri&longs;tinam duritiem, ten&longs;ionemque acquirunt: non
igitur erit impo&longs;&longs;ibile, vt eiu&longs;dem naturæ &longs;int villi,
qui intra tubulorum aereorum capacitatem diraman­
tur, protendunturque.

Cap.
13. cau­
&longs;a rarefacti­
onis glaciei
affertur.
PROP. CCLXXV.

His præmis&longs;is inquirenda e&longs;t ratio, & cau&longs;a quare aqua in
actu congelationis rarefit, ampliorenque molem acquirit.

EVidenti&longs;&longs;imum e&longs;t, quòd in actu congelationis
exurgunt de nouo intra aqu&etail; &longs;ub&longs;tantiam innu­
meræ ampullæ aere plenæ, quæ prius non apparebant:
hæ procùl dubio non adueniunt deforis, &longs;ed origi­
nem, & ortum habere videntur in ip&longs;amet aqua, vt
dictum e&longs;t: & quia ridiculum e&longs;t à frigore intra gla­
ciem de nouo aerem gigni, fatendum e&longs;t aeris innu-
meras particulas ita commi&longs;ceri aquæ fluidæ, vt om­
ninò lateant, eo modo quo particulæ terreæ vrinæ ad­
mi&longs;tæ, vel metallicæ in aquis corro&longs;iuis di&longs;per&longs;æ,
prorsùs incon&longs;picuæ &longs;unt, vt tran&longs;picuitatem liquo­
rum non perturbent.

Sed licèt hoc facilè concedi po&longs;­
&longs;it, nihilominùs remanet præcipua, & maxima diffi­
cultas, quomodo, & qua di&longs;po&longs;itione intra aquam col­
locari, &longs;it uarique po&longs;&longs;int aereæ particulæ, vt po&longs;tmo­
dum in actu congelationis exten&longs;ionem, & inflationem
ip&longs;ius aquæ efficere po&longs;&longs;it.

Cap.
13. cau­
&longs;a rarefacti­
onis glaciei
affertur.

Huic difficultati occurri mihi po&longs;&longs;e videtur, expen­
dendo figuras, & moles particularum aeris, & aquæ.

quia, vt &longs;upra innuimus, aeris particul&etail; compo&longs;itæ vi­
dentur ex laminulis tenui&longs;&longs;imis ramo&longs;is, & villo&longs;is
&longs;piralitèr contortis, quæ proinde grande &longs;patium va­
cuum intra &longs;e comprehendant; è contra particulæ
aquæ minutiores e&longs;&longs;e videntur, vt nimirum po&longs;&longs;int in­
gredi in&longs;inuarique intra inanes cauitates tubulorum
aereorum, propterea cauitates aerearum particula­
rum infra aquam fluidam exi&longs;tentium facilè repleri
po&longs;&longs;unt à minutioribus aqueis particulis, & &longs;ic aqua
communis fluida in &longs;tatu eius naturali quid &longs;imile fo­
ret cumulo tritici intra quem plures tubi arundinei
eodem tritico pleni continerentur: & hìc con&longs;tat,
quod amplitudo, & moles prædicti cumuli compone­
retur ex &longs;ub &longs;tantia corporea granulorum, & &longs;olidarum
partium eorumdem tubulorum.

fingamus modò ab
aliqua virtute expelli à cauitatibus tubulorum triti­
cum, quod in ip&longs;is continebatur, vt nimirùm tubuli
omnes vacui omninò remaneant; nonne &longs;equitur ne­
ce&longs;&longs;ariò ampliatio molis totius cumuli; non quidem
à dilatatione facta ab ip&longs;is arundinibus, &longs;ed ex eo quod
grana frumenti expul&longs;a &longs;patium &longs;ibi æquale intra tri­
ticum occupare debent, & &longs;ic tota ma&longs;&longs;a con&longs;tans ex
ij&longs;dem granulis frumenti corporeis, & ex &longs;patijs va­
cuis in arundinibus relictis, procùl dubio maius &longs;pa­
tium occupare deberet, quàm priùs, & proindè am­
pliaretur moles totius aggregati, & rarefieri videre­
tur.

Non &longs;ecùs in aqua pura fluida &longs;piræ, vel tubuli
aerei, qui priùs à particulis aquæ replebantur &longs;i po­
&longs;tea ab aliqua nece&longs;&longs;itate exinanirentur, expul&longs;a ni­
mirùm aqua, quæ ibidem coercebatur, profectò per­
cipimus molem totius aquæ ampliari augerique de­
bere, propterea quod in&longs;urgerent denuo tot &longs;patio­
la vacua quot &longs;unt &longs;piræ, vel tubuli aerei, & hæc vnà
cum &longs;olidis particulis aquæ amplius &longs;patium re­
quirerent, & ideò moles aquea aucta, & rarefact&atail;
videretur.

Cap.
13 cau­
&longs;a rarefacti­
onis glaciei
affertur.

Eò igitur difficultas redacta e&longs;t, vt o&longs;tendamus in
actu congelationis aquæ huiu&longs;modi operatione&mtail;
fieri po&longs;&longs;e, & indagemus modum, nece&longs;&longs;itatem, &
vim motiuam huius operationis.

Et primò duplici modo in&longs;inuari mihi po&longs;&longs;e viden­
tur aquæ particulæ intra cauitates &longs;pirarum, &longs;iuè tu­
bulorum aeris, aut à violentia externa, aut &longs;ponte &longs;ua;
vtroque modo fieri po&longs;&longs;e non videtur improbabile;
certum enim e&longs;t ignis particulas, &longs;eù exhalationes
perpetuo di&longs;currere, fluere que per omnia corpor&atail;
tàm den&longs;a, quàm fluida, igitur quò maior erit copia
di&longs;currentium igniculorum, eò magis corpora inertia,
vt &longs;unt aqu&etail; particulæ intra aquam æquilibratæ, agi­
tari impellique po&longs;&longs;unt; per&longs;euerante igitur aqua in
&longs;tatu fluido procùl dubio per eam maior copia ignicu­
lorum diffunditur agitaturque, quàm dum coale&longs;cit,
& ab ingenti frigore congelatur, nam frigiditas, aut
e&longs;t mera priuatio igniculorum, aut &longs;ine eorum defe­
ctu, & ab&longs;entia, nec exi&longs;tere, neque operari pote&longs;t;
non ergò limites probabilitatis tran&longs;cendit vt in &longs;ta­
tu fluiditatis maior copia igniculorum, vel exhalati­
onum ignearum impellere po&longs;&longs;it minimas aquæ par­
ticulas, ea&longs;que in&longs;inuare intra vacua &longs;patia tubulorum
aereorum, in quibus villi interni eorumdem non ri­
gidam omninò ten&longs;ionem habere po&longs;&longs;unt, & proindè
vehementi&etail; maiori, qua igniculi particulas aquæ im­
pellunt cedere po&longs;&longs;int; & in hoc ca&longs;u ce&longs;&longs;ante copi&atail;
igniculorum, &longs;cilicèt in &longs;tatu algoris, & ingentis fri­
giditatis, aut nullo pacto, aut debiliori conatu parti­
culæ aqueæ impelli po&longs;&longs;ent, & proindè villi interni
tubulorum aereorum, vt totidem machinulæ valen­
tiori vi &longs;uæ ten&longs;ionis expellere aquæ particulas è præ­
dictis cauitatibus fi&longs;tularum po&longs;&longs;ent.

Cap.
13 cau­
&longs;a rarefacti­
onis glaciei
affertur.

At &longs;i &longs;upponamus non impelli violenter aqu&etail; par­
ticulas intra aereos tubulos, &longs;ed &longs;ponte &longs;ua vi graui­
tatis fluere in&longs;inuarique intra &longs;patiola vacua eorum­
dem tubulorum; tunc &longs;upponendum e&longs;t, vt &longs;uperiùs
in&longs;inuauimus, villos internos tubulorum aeris à frigi­
ditate, &longs;eù ab igniculorum ab&longs;entia rigidiores, & ten-
&longs;iores reddi po&longs;&longs;e, & è contra à caliditate molliores,
& flexiliores effici.

His po&longs;itis, quia dùm aqua fluida
e&longs;t, caliditas in aqua viget, & proindè villi interni
&longs;pirarum, &longs;eù tubulorum aereorum molliores, flexilio­
re&longs;que redditi facilè cedere po&longs;&longs;unt vi ponderis flu­
entis aquæ, ideò tubuli prædicti repleri po&longs;&longs;unt;
adueniente po&longs;tea ingenti gradu frigoris, nempè de­
ficiente copia igniculorum, &longs;ponte &longs;ua villi interni
&longs;pirarum aeris ten&longs;iores, directiores, & rigidiores
reddi po&longs;&longs;unt, & ideò ad in&longs;tar machinularum expel­
lere po&longs;&longs;unt ibidem contentas aquæ particulas, &
proindè tubuli prædicti exinaniri po&longs;&longs;unt.

Cap.
13. cau­
&longs;a rarefacti­
onis glaciei
affertur.

Po&longs;tea quia dum efficitur huiu&longs;modi expul&longs;io, non
adhùc aqua congelata indurataque e&longs;t, vel &longs;altem ma­
iori ex parte fluiditatem retinet, fit vt prædictæ &longs;pi­
ræ aereæ non vt priùs aqua impr&etail;gnatæ, &longs;ed vacuæ
relictæ, facilè po&longs;&longs;int ab ambiente fluido agitari, ex­
pellique, & &longs;ic po&longs;&longs;unt plures &longs;piræ aereæ coaceruari,
& cum vicinis vniri, & &longs;ic aliquas ampullas aereas
con&longs;picuas componere po&longs;&longs;unt, & hæc erunt for&longs;an
grana illa aerea, quæ propè initium, & in actu con­
gelationis ibidem oriri videntur.

Contra hanc theoriam dici po&longs;&longs;et, quòd particu­
læ &longs;piritus vini, olei, & mercurij cùm exiguæ, & mi­
nutiores quam &longs;int aeris particulæ concedi debeant,
non &longs;ecùs, ac aqua intra tubulos aereos in&longs;inuari po&longs;­
&longs;ent, & hinc quoque ab eadem nece&longs;&longs;itate &longs;uperiùs
expo&longs;ita valdè refrigeratis fluidis expelli quoque è
tubulis prædictis deberent, proindeque fluida præ-
dicta ampliarentur, ingentioraque &longs;patia occuparent,
quod repugnat experientiæ.

Cap.
13 cau­
&longs;a rarefacti­
onis glaciei
affertur.

Cui re&longs;pondere po&longs;&longs;umus, quòd particulæ minim&etail;
&longs;piritus vini, & mercúrij &longs;i reuera tubulos aereos
replent, tamen à feruenti&longs;&longs;imo frigore expelli, & ex­
cludi non po&longs;&longs;e videntur à prædictis cauitatibus, &longs;iuè
quia particulæ &longs;piritus vini, & olei natiuo eorum ca­
lore &longs;emper mollitiem, & flexilitatem villulorum ae­
ris con&longs;eruant, &longs;iue quia eorum particulæ &longs;unt adeò
exiguæ vt inter inter&longs;titia eorumdem villulorum &longs;pi­
rarum aeris remanere queant, vel &longs;altem impul&longs;æ
facilè circumuolutione facta inter villulos regredi­
antur, & &longs;ic capillitium illud perpetuò madefaciant,
proinde que numquam exinanitio tubulorum aereorum
in &longs;piritu vini, oleo, vel mercurio contingat; & &longs;ic nun­
quam poterit eorum moles ampliari, aut inflari ab in­
genti gradu frigoris, vt in aqua accidit.

Pr&etail;terea obijcere qui&longs;quam po&longs;&longs;et, quod reuera ab ini
tio dum aqua frigefit eius moles diminuitur conden&longs;atur­
que ergo &longs;i à frigiditate villi interni tubulorum aereorum
rigidi, & ten&longs;i redduntur, & proindè aquam è cauita­
tibus illis expellunt, deberet in principio refrigera­
tionis totius aquæ moles augeri, quod e&longs;t fal&longs;um.

Sed re&longs;ponderi pote&longs;t quod ampliatio molis ip&longs;ius
aquæ nedum efficitur à prædicta expul&longs;ione particu­
larum aquæ, è tubulis aereis, &longs;ed multò magis celeri­
us, & euidentiùs, à pr&etail;&longs;entia, & commotione exhala­
tionum ignearum, qu&etail; &longs;uis ictibus &longs;eparant aqu&etail; &longs;oli­
das particulas; è contra dum aqua frigefit, di&longs;cedunt,
& exhalant igniculi eorumque agitationes ab ip&longs;&atail;
aqua, & proinde aqua &longs;ponte &longs;ua &longs;tringitur con&longs;tipa­
tur, minoremque molem acquirit.

Hoc po&longs;ito, incipi­
ente operatione frigiditatis, nempè remotis paucis
aliquibus igniculis, fiet con&longs;trictio, & conden&longs;atio
aquæ, quæ valdè in&longs;ignis, & euidens erit; in progre&longs;&longs;u
verò frigefactionis, &longs;cilicèt magis, ac magis diminu­
ta præ&longs;entia igniculorum, licèt reuera villi interni
fi&longs;tularum aeris incipiant tendi, ac dirigi, & proindè
aliquanti&longs;per expellant aquam à prædictis tubulis,
nihilominùs quia maior e&longs;t diminutio molis depen­
dens à di&longs;ce&longs;&longs;u, fuga, & defectu agitationis exhalati­
onum ignearum, quàm &longs;it rarefactio producta à villis
aereis expellentibus aliquas aquæ particulas è &longs;uis
tubulis, &longs;equitur vt actio &longs;uperexcedens conden&longs;a­
tionis productæ à di&longs;ce&longs;&longs;u ignis occultet aliquandiu
minùs in&longs;ignem expan&longs;ionem factam à prædictis villis;
cùmque progre&longs;&longs;us prædictarum contrariarum ope­
rationum non &longs;int vniformes, &longs;ed contrario ordin&etail;
conden&longs;atio ab ignis di&longs;ce&longs;&longs;u pendens &longs;emper mino­
ri, & minori decremento fiat, & è contra rarefactio
pendens ex inanitione tubulorum aeris &longs;emper ma­
ioribus incrementis progrediatur, (eo quod maiori
proportione cre&longs;cit impetus in villis tubulorum ae­
reorum continenter agitatis, vt motus natura exigit,
quam deficiat ob &longs;ucce&longs;&longs;iuam igniculorum priuatio­
nem) fit vt apparentia diminutionis, & con&longs;trictionis
aquæ tandem de&longs;inat, & facto qua&longs;i æquilibrio ali­
quanti&longs;per videatur in eadem amplitudine aqua per-
&longs;euerare, & deinceps denuò augeri, rarefierique in­
cipiat, & &longs;ic pro&longs;equatur per plures gradus quou&longs;­
que multiplicata, & aucta ten&longs;ione illa villulorum, &
expul&longs;ione innumerarum aquæ particularum è tubu­
lis aeris, con&longs;equatur vehementi&longs;&longs;imus ille &longs;altus aquæ,
& maxima rarefactio eius, tunc præcisè, quando ma­
iori ex parte glaciei con&longs;i&longs;tentiam acquirit.

Cap.
13. cau­
&longs;a rarefacti­
onis glaciei
affertur.

Cap.
13 cau­
&longs;a rarefacti­
onis glaciei
affertur.
PROP. CCLXXVI.

Quare aqua, dum gela&longs;cit, duritiem acquirit, non autem aer,
oleum, &longs;piritus vini, & Alercurius.

ET hoc loco aliqua afferre de Con&longs;i&longs;tentia, & du­
ritie, quam aqua acquirit in actu congelationis
&longs;uperuacaneum non erit.

Cùm ex tradita theoria ab
ingenti gradu frigiditatis debeat aqua mole ampliari,
mirari licet quare aer, &longs;piritus vini, oleum, atque mer­
curius fluida &longs;emper permaneant, dum &longs;emper magis
conden&longs;entur, vniantur, & minus &longs;patium occupent,
& è contra aqua, quæ in progre&longs;&longs;u frigefactionis am­
pliatur, & rarefit, &longs;cilicèt partes eius magis ab inui­
cem di&longs;gregantur, debeant tamen con&longs;olidari, ac in­
durari, & con&longs;i&longs;tentiam glaciei acquirere.

Et hìc primò occurrendum e&longs;t, quod licèt aqua in
tali ca&longs;u rarefiat, &longs;cilicèt maius &longs;patium acquirat,
non proindè cen&longs;endum e&longs;t omnes minimas eius par­
ticulas laxiores reddi, & ab inuicem &longs;eparari, & in­
ter &longs;e di&longs;tare, nam rarefactio eius pendet à &longs;patiolis
vacuis contentis intra tubulos aereos, non verò quia
particulæ aquæ ab inuicem recedant, itaque conci­
piendum e&longs;t aquæ particulas inter &longs;e connecti tena-
ci&longs;&longs;ima vnione, efformareque veluti fornices conti­
nentes &longs;patiola vacua, non &longs;ecùs ac pumicis &longs;olidæ
particulæ duræ &longs;unt, & tenacitèr inter &longs;e connexæ,
licet innumeras poro&longs;itates admittant.

itaque benè
&longs;aluari pote&longs;t durities aquæ glaciatæ cum expan&longs;io­
ne, &longs;eu rarefactione eius pendente ab innumeris po­
ris vacuis, qui &longs;unt cauitates tubulorum aereoru&mtail;
intra aquam contentorum.

Cap.
13 cau­
&longs;a rarefacti­
onis glaciei
affertur.

Sed adhùc remanet difficultas, quare particulæ a­
quæ modo expo&longs;ito connexæ &longs;axeam duritiem acqui­
rant, & contra aer, &longs;piritus vini, &c.

fluida &longs;emper re­
maneant, hoc profectò pendere videtur à diuer&longs;&atail;
conformatione particularum eorumdem fluidorum,
nam &longs;i villi externi particularum aquæ ab in&longs;igni fri­
gidate rigidi redduntur, non e&longs;t impo&longs;&longs;ibile, vt it&atail;
inter&longs;e nectantur, vt non po&longs;&longs;int ab inuicem facilè
&longs;eparari, & &longs;ic con&longs;i&longs;tentiam duritienque creent; è con­
tra &longs;i externi villi olei, &longs;piritus vini, &c.

non habeant
eamdem naturam, & con&longs;i&longs;tentiam, vt nimirum ab in­
&longs;igni frigidate ten&longs;ionem, & rigiditatem non acqui­
rant, tunc mirum non erit non po&longs;&longs;e ad inuicem con­
glutinari, & texturam &longs;olidam, & duram efficere, &
hoc &longs;atis veri&longs;imile e&longs;&longs;e videtur in oleo, & &longs;piritu vi­
ni, quæ cùm ex particulis igneis componantur, faci­
lè villi externi flexibiles, & cedentes con&longs;eruari po&longs;­
&longs;unt; at in aere for&longs;an villi externi, aut exigui &longs;unt,
aut non incuruati, aut lubrici, itaut forti vnione inter
&longs;e mutuò connecti nequeant.

Idipsum dici pote&longs;t d&etail;
particulis hydrargyri; vnde mirum non e&longs;t huiu&longs;mo-
di fluida licèt maximè frigefacta, duritiem non acqui­
rere, &longs;ed po&longs;tea iurare non po&longs;&longs;umus, quòd à vehe­
menti&longs;&longs;imo gradu frigoris in regionibus maximè bo­
realibus, tandem non concre&longs;cant, & duritiem no&ntail;
acquirant; Sed interim &longs;ufficit vt nuclei particularum
mercurij, aut &longs;int rotundi, aut quam maximè ad rotun­
ditatem accedant, & è contra particulæ &longs;olidæ aquæ
figuram angularem habeant, vt &longs;int octaedræ &longs;ua la­
nugine coopertæ, quæ inter &longs;e connecti, adaptarique
po&longs;&longs;int, vt &longs;olidam texturam efficere valeant, non &longs;e­
cùs ac lateres pauimenti &longs;olidam texturam componere
po&longs;&longs;unt.

Con&longs;tat ergo, quòd huiu&longs;modi differenti&atail;
fluidorum, vel alia &longs;imilis di&longs;crepantia efficere pote&longs;t
duritiem glacialem in aqua, non verò in reliquis flui­
dis &longs;uperius expo&longs;itis.

Cap.
13 cau­
&longs;a rarefacti­
onis glaciei
affertur.
PROP. CCLXXVII.

Remanet po&longs;tremo loco inquirenda cau&longs;a ingentis, & vali­
dis&longs;imæ virtutis, qua aqua in actu congelationis eius
di&longs;rumpit, ac frangit va&longs;a ænea con&longs;i&longs;tentia, & du­
ris&longs;ima.

HOc verò minimè mihi negotium face&longs;&longs;it, cùm de­
mon&longs;trauerim in opere de vi percu&longs;&longs;ionis, quòd
quælibet vis motus, & impetus &longs;uperare valet quam­
cumque re&longs;i&longs;tentiam va&longs;ti corporis ab&longs;que motu pre­
mentis.

Cogitemus particulas aqueas intra tubulos
aereos contentas retineri ibidem, & re&longs;i&longs;tere ex­
pul&longs;ioni, ne dum vi ponderis totius aquæ incumbentis,
&longs;ed multò magis vnione partium pilæ, vel va&longs;is ænei

uari deberet.

E contra cogitemus villos internos tu­

tiam &longs;uperare queat.

&longs;imul, & continenter &longs;uam impul&longs;ionem percu&longs;&longs;io­

fluida intra innumeros poros funis in&longs;inuata motu
&longs;uo &longs;ubleuare pote&longs;t ingentia pondera, &longs;ic quoqu&etail;
copio&longs;i&longs;&longs;imi, & innumerabiles ictus facti à villis in­

&longs;tentias inertes quie&longs;cente&longs;que, licèt ingentes, &longs;upe­

di&longs;rumpere poterit aqua in actu congelationis eius,
do nimirùm vehementi&longs;&longs;imo motu rarefit, & innume­
